loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion M., a 61-year-old resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines, is mother to a young adult currently studying in high school. Salvacion operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php13,000 loan which she will use to buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Salvacion dreams that her family will be complete again soon, and that her child will be able to study all the way through college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg J. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Bavuu, is a bus driver and goes between neighboring sub-provinces. Her three sons all attend universities in Ulaanbaatar. They have been living at their current address for 21 years. She usually spends her business earnings on daily household consumption and the tuition fees of her three sons. 

Battsetseg started her meat trading business in 1999 and since then her working capital has increased 10 times compared with her start-up business. Later on, she plans to operate a cow farm. She hopes to buy real estate for her children in Ulaanbaatar. She is a hardworking and honest person. She saves money for her three children's tuition fees and then she will start her new farming business.

 Battsetseg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more meat and supplies so that she may increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta B. is a resident of Kant, a small pleasant city near Bishkek. Sveta is 46 years old and she is married. She has a fifteen-year-old son who is at school.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and she sells wheat, barley, corn and flour at the market. She has been doing this for sixteen years. Sveta started with the initial investment of 750 soms and now she makes 34,000 soms per month. Sveta hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase ten tons of wheat. That wheat will be used for making flour. And then she wants to resell flour at a higher price. In the future Sveta wants to purchase a flat in Bishkek for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase ten tons of wheat

loans.name: Javzandolgor

texts.en:
Javzandolgor T. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and son in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.  She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband has a car which is used as a taxi. Their monthly net profit is approximately 900,000 MNT. She has a chronic back disease and receives an allowance of 54,000 MNT every month. Her son works in the military forces. 

Javzandolgor  used to work at "Eastern Light" company as a cook from 2001 to 2010.   She was able to build her own home because of the success she achieved by running her consumer goods trading business. She started to operate a cafe at a local market in June, 2010. Also she opened and runs a pavilion at a trade center where she sells consumer goods and clothes. She has many future plans such as expanding her clothes shop to attract more customers and doing renovations at her house and so on. She hopes to have more big shops where she sells goods that customers demand. 

Javzandolgor would like to expand her product offerings and is therefore requesting a 2,000,000 MNT in order to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare spring rolls for sale

loans.name: Ma. Mernaly

texts.en:
This is Ma. Mernaly G., 41, a resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to June G., a security guard, and mother to an elementary school-aged child. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Ma. Mernaly as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Ma. Mernaly operates a rug-making business and at the same time is a fabric dealer. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Ma. Mernally dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny C., 29, a resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines, is married to Cubreguito C., a vendor; she is the mother of two children, one of whom is in elementary school, while the youngest is toddling around at home. By the grace of God, Jenny has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college, a dream of most Filipino parents like Jenny who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can give to their children.

Jenny operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Jenny is requesting a Php21,000 loan to buy more quantities of products including groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jenny dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman someday, and faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Gultan

texts.en:
N. Gultan is 46 years old. She is married and has one child. Gultan sells clothing and toys for children. She rents a place for her sales which is located in one of the local markets. 

Gultan has been running this business for 13 years. Having only a couple of competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. Today she is requesting 6000 Somoni to purchase new goods to expand the range of her goods. Gultan thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing and toys for resale

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita C., 52, resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines, mother to a young adult currently enrolled in college.

Lolita operates a computer shop. Computer shops mostly cater to students who need to do research and printing, but it is also open for people who need some relaxation through online interaction. She offers services to her immediate community and neighbors.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 49,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more computer units, repair some of the old units, and purchase new software/hardware for the shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams of being able to help her family through her business. She also hopes that the business will continue to be more successful and stable. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy  computer units, repair some of the old units, and acquire new software/hardware for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nazigul

texts.en:
Nazigul M. is a resident of Kadamjai, a small city in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Nazigul is a 44-year-old widow.  She has a son and a daughter; the son studies at university and the daughter is at school. Nazigul works as a doctor, saving some money from every salary she collects to open a pharmacy. Nazigul applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials to start repairing her house.  In the near future she will celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Tulkinoi

texts.en:
Tulkinoi S. is a resident of Kadamjai, a small city in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Tulkinoi is 44 years old and she is married. She has four sons and two daughters; the eldest daughter is working and the other children are at school.  

Tulkinoi breeds cattle and her husband works as a butcher. Selling the meat they make 10,000 soms per month.  That money made it possible for them to save and purchase a piece of land to start building a new house.  

Tulkinoi hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase bulls for fattening and then to sell as meat.  In the near future she plans to build a new shed and start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase bulls to fatten

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
B. Mahina is a married mother of two children. For more than 6 years Mahina has been selling a traditional men’s coat called a “Chapan”. Considering that her husband-businessman earns little, the business of Mahina's has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past 6 years. Mahina has requested a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing traditional men’s coats called “Chapan” for resale

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara S. is a resident of Kadamjai, a small city in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Gulnara is 42 years old and she is married. She has two sons and a daughter. The first son studies at the university, the second is at school and the daughter works as a secretary.   Gulnara is a bookkeeper and her husband works as an inspector in the Gas Department.  Fifteen years ago with the initial investment of 3000 soms, they started to breed cattle. They make money by selling cattle after fattening. With money received from the loan, Gulnara wants to purchase three bulls to resell at a higher price after fattening. In the future, she plans to build a shed and start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). loans.use: To purchase three bulls

loans.name: Umsunai

texts.en:
Umsunai S. is a resident of Kadamjai, a small city in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Umsunai is a 52-year-old widow.  She has raised five sons and a daughter. Most of them are working, married and living separately with their families.  Umsunai is a pensioner. She has been breeding livestock for 30 years. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase five sheep to resell at a higher price after fattening. Then she will start repairing her flat.  In the future, she wants to see her youngest son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: To purchase five sheep

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a lovely 56-year-old woman with two children. She runs a business selling fabric at the market. She offers a variety of types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Matluba is asking for this loan to buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits. Her dream is to have her own large store one day. On behalf of Matluba and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Zainiddin

texts.en:
K. Zainiddin is 59 years old. He is married with 4 children. Since he was young he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle which is why he has a lot of experience. It is necessary to point out that Zainiddin has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by IMON International. This support has been in the form of a loan which he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their locality. 

Today, Zainiddin has once again come to IMON International for a loan which will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
M. Inobat is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Inobat 's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an entrepreneur didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family. This was the reason that Inobat decided to start her own business 15 years ago selling fabrics for traditional dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow and by offering her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger. 

Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni. With this money, Inobat will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for traditional dresses.

loans.use: To buy more red oil, pepper, onions and salt

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sticks

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia O. D. L. nació en la ciudad D. Luque, está casada con Gabriel Leguizamón Coronel con quien tuvo tres hijos, dos D. ellos aun menores.
Ambos se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir como remeras, pantalones cortos entre otros.
 Los créditos que anteriormente retiraba D. la  Fundación Paraguaya lo destinaron a la compra D. una máquina y menor escala y a la compra D. telas para los diferentes pedidos.
Hoy en día la señora Lidia invierte todo el préstamo que la Fundación le otorga a la compra D. telas esto debido a la cantidad D. pedidos D. prendas que tiene. En adelante quiere seguir ampliando su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia O. D. Leguizamón was born in the city of Luque. She is married to Gabriel Leguizamón with whom she had three children of which two are still minors. She and her husband make articles of clothing like t-shirts, shorts, etc. The previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya were used to buy a sewing machine and fabric for their various orders. Today, Lidia will use the entire loan that the Fundación grants to buy fabric due to the quantity of pending orders for clothes she has. In the future she wants to continue to increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. is married and has a child. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a miner.

Maame operates a provision shop at Takoradi and uses the income she generates from her sales to educate her child with the help of her husband. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Maame Dekyi

texts.en:
Maame Dekyi M. sells smoked fish at Takoradi. She has not received any form of education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is into carpentry.

Maame Dekyi has been selling smoked fish for some time now and helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

Maame Dekyi hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells second-hand clothes at Takoradi. She is married and taking care of seven dependents. Esi has been through junior high school. Her husband is a tailor. She pays utility bills and does the cooking for the family. Her loan will be used to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: buy a bale of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza del barrio San Carlos, se formo hace mas tres años, gracias a que la encargada de limpieza de la oficina de la ciudad de Luque de la Fundación invito a sus vecinas a formar un grupo para que de esa forma tengan la posibilidad de incrementar sus mercaderías para ir creciendo laboralmente. 
Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el décimo quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 17 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Norma A. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas varias como remeras, camisas. Pantalones, camperas,  para la venta de los mismos.
Ella vende sus mercaderías en forma ambulante por la calle, todos los días viaja en distintas zonas para colocar su puesto y exponer sus mercaderías  y de esa forma ofrece sus prendas de vestir.
Es una actividad muy sacrificada pero es la oportunidad que ella tiene para ayudar a su familia comenta la señora Norma.
Ella desea mucho contar con un local en un lugar para vender sus mercaderías ya de la forma como trabaja  actualmente es muy inestables.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza” (Hopeful Enterprising Women) committee was established over three years ago when the cleaning lady of the Fundación’s Luque office invited her neighbors to form a group in order to have the possibility of increasing their merchandise and expanding their work. Currently, the group is in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Committee Program’s 10th cycle with 17 members who are involved in a variety of activities. Mrs. Norma A. sells clothes. She used the money to buy clothes like: t-shirts, shirts, pants and jackets to resell. She is an itinerant merchant that travels to various neighborhoods daily to set up her stand and display her merchandise; this is how she offers her clothes for sale. Norma tells us that this is very demanding work but it’s the opportunity she has to help her family. She very much would like to have a locale to sell her merchandise because the way she currently works is very unstable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, pants, sweatshirts, shirts, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey is 58 years old, married with 5 children who are 8, 14, 18, 20 and 22 years old.  Jean Marie Vianey is well-known in the business of selling meat.  He has been in this business for about 5 years and the hours of his business are from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

 After realizing that his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Jean Marie Vianey realizes he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which in turn will allow him to increase his sales of meat.  With these increased sales, he really hopes that his profits will also increase.  If all his business process is successful, Jean Marie Vianey will hopefully start saving for a better future and in addition to that, he will improve the life style of his family.

loans.use: A large quantity of meat for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame F. is married and has four children. Maame sells sugar cane at Takoradi. Her husband is a poultry farmer. She has received junior high education. Maame uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

 Maame will use the loan to purchase more sugar cane for sale. With the new earnings from her extended business, she plans on plowing her profit back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Bahadir

texts.en:
Bahadir H. is a widower with four children, who lives in Osh city, south of Kyrgyzstan. Bahadir is an open-hearted person who likes to bring positive emotions to people. Seven years ago, in order to support his family, Bahadir began his business in running confectioner's shop. He started selling cakes and soon his shop became known for its delicious goods. 

In June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Bahadir lost his business. His confectioner's shop was burned to ashes. But Bahadir, being a very optimistic person, didn’t give up and decided to resume his lost business and continue activities. For this very reason, Bahadir is applying for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which he needs to restart his activity. He plans to buy an oven, a mixer and stuff for baking. 

Bahadir hopes to see those “sweet” smiles of his loyal customers again.   
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase oven, mixer and stuff for baking

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena E. is married and has three children. She sells firewood and sugar cane at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Mena uses the income she generates to help take care of her family. Mena will use the loan to purchase more of her goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to save to invest in another business.

loans.use: purchase more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel M. sells costume jewelry and boils fresh corn to sell at Takoradi. Mabel has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Mabel has been in this business for some time now. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to reinvest back into her costume jewelry business.

loans.use: buy more corn to cook for sale

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a que una de las integrantes se informó del programa por una amiga que integra otro grupo y decidió invitar a sus vecinas y amigas a formar un nuevo comité.  De esta forma se inicia el comité Oñondivepa el cual se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformada por mujeres que inviertes en distintas actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan.
La señora Ramona C. es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como carnes,  panificados, carbón, carne, condimentos, harina, aceite, entre otros, para el incremento de su negocio.
Ella prepara diariamente los comestibles y sale ella o sus hijos para venderlos, recorren los lugares concurridos por la gente como plazas, mercados  o buces y así vender rápidamente todo lo que preparan.
De esta forma ella obtiene ingreso diariamente para su familia y se siente muy satisfecha con lo que ha obtenido hasta ahora.
texts.en:
This committee was created thanks to one of its members' finding out about the program from a friend who was part of another group and decided to invite her friends and neighbors to form a new committee. And so the Oñodivepa Committee was created, now in its ninth loan cycle with the Committee of Enterprising Women of Fundación Paraguaya. It's made up of women who invest in a variety of activities depending on their skills. One member, Ramona C., sells food products and has invested her money in supplies, including meats, baked goods, charcoal, seasonings, flour, oil, etc., to grow her business. Every day she prepares food, which either she or her children go out to sell. They frequent populated places like squares, markets, or bus stops, where they quickly sell their product. This is how Ramona gets her daily income for her family, and she feels very satisfied with what she has gotten thus far.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, meats, oil, seasonings, flour, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Del Rosario

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio de 42 años esta casado con la Sr. Odilona Gimenez de 40 años, poseen tres hijos dos varones de 7 y 12 años respectivamente y  una nena de 5 años.
Anteriormente Antonio era empleado de una empresa privada durante varios años, luego viajo a la argentina para mejorar su economía. 
Volvió a su país con los ahorros que obtuvo se dedico a la compra y venta de mercaderías, contando actualmente con varios clientes desde hace varios años.
Le gustaría para el futuro ampliar mas  su negocio contar con un local propio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
El solicita el prestamo para la compra de sabanas, colchas, jeans, calzados, camisas, y otros.
texts.en:
Antonio is 42 years old and is married to Odilona Gimenez, who is 40. They have 3 children: 2 boys aged 7 and 12 years, and a 5 year-old girl. Previously Antonio was an employee of a private company for a number of years; later he traveled to Argentina to improve his economic circumstances. He returned to his country with the savings he obtained, and started buying and selling merchandise. He now has a number of customers that he has attracted over the years. In the future he would like to expand his business and have his own store, and he wants his children to finish their education. He requests a loan to buy bed sheets, bedspreads, jeans, shoes, shirts and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, sheets, jeans, shirts, sports shoes, shoes and T-shirts

loans.name: Kunama Group

texts.fr:
Estella N. est une commerçante âgée de 42 ans qui habite  à Rugombo dans la Province de Cibitoke située à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le grain de maïs et le haricot au Marché de Cibitoke.C’est un métier qu’elle exerce il ya de cela 25 ans. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. C’est une veuve de Ezéchiel Nyandwi. Elle fait juste le 1er  cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 8enfants et ceux qui sont à l’école sont âgés de 17ans,15ans,12ans et 9ans. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de produits alimentaires (maïs et haricot) à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir son propre capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business et réaliser ses projets comme la construction de sa propre maison en matériaux durables, assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et réaliser les autres rêves de sa vie.
 
 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Kunama».
texts.en:
Estella N. is a 42 year old shopkeeper who lives in Rugombo in the Cibitoke province, which is in the west of Burundi. She sells food products such as corn seeds and beans at the Cibitoke market, and has been involved in this activity for around 25 years. She attended school up until the sixth year of elementary. She is Ezéchiel Nyandwi's widow and is on her first microcredit loan application with Turame . She has 8 children, all of whom attend school, and are aged 17, 15, 12 and 9. She is seeking a Kiva loan in order to increase her stock levels, so that she may generate higher profits. She aims to use her own funds in future to enlarge her business, build a house from hardy materials, see to her children's education and realise other goals. She is a member of the 'Kunama' solidarity group.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: boost stock levels (corn and beans) in order to generate higher profits

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa N. est âgée de 27 ans et habite dans la localité de Dalifort. Elle est mariée sans enfant. Elle est femme de ménage de profession. Mais parallèlement elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par amour. Ainsi  elle achète des tissus Thioup qu’elle place auprès  de ses voisins. Madame N. est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 2 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs et envisage de renforcer son stock de thioup dans le but de faire face à la demande de la clientèle en cette  période de préparation des fêtes de Korite et de tabaski. Son intention est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Awa N. is 27 years old and lives in Dalifort. She is a cleaning lady, but also runs her own business alongside this. She purchases Thioup fabric which she then sells to her neighbours. She has been a member of the Dalifort credit association for 2 years and is seeking a 400,000 FRS loan in order to boost her stock levels so that she can meet increased customer demand in this high season (in preparation for the Korite and Tabaski festivals). Her aim is to support her husband in meeting her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing business funds

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador que se preocupa por el patrimonio de si familia y por darles una mejor calidad de vida, el trabaja como operador en una maquiladora, su esposa la Señora Claudia, se dedica a las labores del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos pequeños, este seria el segundo crédito del señor Antonio y en esta ocasión ellos necesitan este crédito para colocar una cerca al frente de su vivienda, esto por seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a hard working man who worries about fathering his family and giving them a better quality of life. He is works in a factory, while his wife, Claudia, is a homemaker. They have three young children. This will be Antonio’s second loan and will use the money to build a fence in front of his home to provide better security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fense

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 31 years old and married.  Theogene is commonly known for selling firewood and he has been in this business for about five years.  The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Theogene, after realizing that he is not able to satisfy the demands of his customers, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will hopefully expand his market as well as his profits.  If successful, he will purchase more firewood for sale, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es: La señora Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es empleada domestica y su esposo el Señor Juan, trabaja como obrero en una maquiladora, la señora Claudia se preocupa por la educación de sus hijos y requieren de este crédito para los útiles escolares de sus dos hijos, que están próximos a empezar el ciclo escolar. Ellos son una familia muy unida. La señora Claudia les agradece mucho el apoyó que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Claudia is a very hard working woman. She is a domestic employee and her husband, Juan, works as a laborer at an assembly plant. Claudia is concerned about her children’s education and needs this loan to buy school supplies for her two sons who are about to start the new school term. The family is very cohesive. Claudia very much appreciates whatever support she can get.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite is 39 years old and married without children. Marguerite is a businesswoman. Her husband is jobless. For that reason, she has to work hard to provide all the basic needs for her family. Marguerite's business is well organized and well known. This is her third year of successful operation in business! The hours of her business are from 9 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day. 

Marguerite is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more clothes. She will be able to satisfy her customers, which will make her more efficient, effective and more successful.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 37 years old and married with three children. His first child is 10 years old, the next is two years old, and the third is one years old. Jean Pierre is a businessman. His wife is jobless. Jean Pierre owns a business selling foodstuffs such as beans, rice and so on. These products are profitable, which is the reason he has chosen this kind of business. Jean Pierre's business operates from 7 in the morning to 4 in the evening every day.

Jean Pierre is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more sacks of foodstuffs. With this expansion, Jean Pierre will be able to have more products for sale, which is the best way of earning more profits. With the extra money, Jean Pierre will save money for his future and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Madame ROSE S. est une femme de 39 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis novembre 2004. Elle a 11 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et rembourse à toujours régulièrement son prêt.

Elle fait un commerce de tissus, de bijoux et de chaussures. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant 75 paires de chaussures, 5 rouleaux de tissus et des bijoux.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rose S. is 39 years old. She is single with no children. She has been a member of the Walidane “Banc Villageois” loan group since November 2004. She has been granted 11 loans in a row and has always repaid her loans on time. She has been a retailer of clothing fabric, jewelry and shoes for the past five years. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business activity by buying 75 pairs of shoes, five bolts of cloth and jewelry. Her objective is to participate in improving her family’s living conditions while increasing her savings level.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry, clothing fabric and shoes

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba D. sells provisions at Takoradi. Araba has attained senior high level of education. She helps her husband in the general welfare of the home. She is married and living with her four children. Her husband is a mason. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Teko Pora Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Ursula A. quien  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Y actualmente se encuentra trabajando cada una en sus actividades muy contentas dentro del grupo.

La Sra. Úrsula A. Morel se dedica a la venta de dulces, invirtió el dinero en la compra de materia prima como azúcar frutas (naranjas, duraznos, frutillas) para la elaboración de dulces, logrando obtener mayor variedad de dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella prepara los dulces de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe de sus clientes que en su mayoría son negocios.
Comenta que mediante esta actividad puede ayudar para cubrir los gasto de la familia y por ello se siente muy satisfecha.
texts.en:
Mrs. Úrsula A. was the contact for the start of this committee; she invited and organized a group of her friends to become part of the Enterprising Women Committee’s program. Each member is currently working in her activity and very happy in the group. Mrs. Úrsula A. Morel sells sweets. She used the funds to buy raw materials like: sugar and fruits (oranges, peaches and strawberries) to make the sweets managing thereby to have a greater variety of sweets available for her customers. She makes the sweets according to prior orders from her customers which, for the most part, are businesses. She comments that through this activity she is able to cover family expenses and she feels very satisfied to be able to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oranges, peaches, strawberries, sugar and others.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline is 36 years old and married with six children between 28 and 18 years old.  Jaqueline owns a small business selling charcoal and her husband is a secretary. Even though they have different occupations, they work hard so that they provide everything needed for their family. Jaqueline is serious about her business because she has a beginning and ending time. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Jaqueline is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more sacks of charcoal. Jaqueline's target is to satisfy her customers and to earn more profit. When her customers are satisfied, she will be able to attract the new customers.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre San Lorenzo, debido a que las personas que lo conforman son originarios de la comunidad que lleva este mismo nombre y es por eso que decidieron ponerle este nombre.
La señora Carmen M. B. es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos Karla de 9 años, Erick de 7 y Yuliana de 5, de los cuales 2 estudian la primaria y la menor el preescolar, el negocio que tiene es el de bordar servilletas, ella va a invertir el préstamo otorgado en la compra de mas material como: manta e hilos para seguir elaborando sus servilletas.
 
Ella se decidió por este negocio, ya que desde niña aprendió a elaborar servilletas, por que su mama le enseño y por que esta es una forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante, para que tengan una vida mejor y así no les falte nada, también podrá apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos.
 
Doña Carmen esta muy contenta por que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, puesto que esta teniendo mucho éxito con las ventas de sus servilletas, ya que son artículos artesanales que llaman mucho la atención, sobre todo a los turistas ya que son sus mejores clientes, por eso mismo han aumentado mucho y con esto sus ingresos también están mejorando bastante.
 
Nos platica que son personas muy trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante y luchar para darles un mejor futuro a sus familias, y sobre todo responsables con sus obligaciones, dice esto ya que tiene mucho tiempo de conocer a sus compañeras y sabe que no le fallarían a la empresa.
 
Esta muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva por la ayuda que le están brindando, ya  que gracias a este apoyo ha podrá continuar con su negocio, mejorarlo e incrementar sus ganancias , y con esto ayudar a su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida.
 
El sueño que tiene la señora Carmen es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, ya que quiere poner un taller de costura, para enseñar y darle trabajo a las personas que quieran aprender a bordar y que tengan muchas ganas de sobresalir, ella también quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que tengan una buena profesión, y por lo tanto una mejor forma de vida. 
 
Los integrantes que conforman este grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
Jacinto G. G.- venta de servilletas
Felicitas H. H.- venta de antojitos
Raymundo C. N.- venta de antojitos
Adelina H. A.-venta de frutas y verduras
Dolores G. M.-borda servilletas
Sonia H. C.- borda servilletas
Carmen M. B.-borda servilletas
Juliana B. M.-venta de chorizo
Mariana M. G.-borda servilletas
María Antonia G. Q.- peletería
texts.en:
This group, know as San Lorenzo, was named by its members after their native community. One member, Carmen M. B., is married and has three children: Karla, 9; Erick, 7; and Yuliana, 5. Two of the kids are in primary school and the youngest is in preschool. Carmen embroiders napkins. She will invest her loan in supplies, including calico cloth and thread so she can keep making napkins. Carmen decided on this business because she had learned how to make napkins from her mother when she was a child, and because it’s a way to gain success for her children so they can have a better life and want for nothing. She can also help her husband out with household expenses and the education of their children. Carmen is very pleased because, she says, business is going well. She is enjoying a great deal of success selling her napkins, since they are handmade and attract a lot of attention, mostly from the tourists, who are her best clients. Sales have gone up quite a bit and her income has improved considerably. The members, Carmen tells us, are very hardworking people who want to succeed and fight for a better future for their families. Above all, they are responsible with respect to their obligations, which she can say because she has known them for a long time and knows that they won’t fail in their ventures. Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva donors for the help they’re providing. Thanks to their support she has been able to maintain and better her business, increase profits, and help her family improve their quality of life. Carmen’s dream is to be able to grow her business even more; she wants to put in a sewing workshop so she can teach and give jobs to anyone who wants to learn to embroider and those who really want to make it. She also wants to keep supporting her children with their education so they can have good professions and better lives. The group members and their professions are: Jacinto G. G. - sells napkins Felicitas H. H. - sells snacks Raymundo C. N. - sells snacks Adelina H. A.-sells fruits and vegetables Dolores G. M. - embroiders napkins Sonia H. C. - embroiders napkins Carmen M. B. - embroiders napkins Juliana B. M. – sells chorizo Mariana M. G. - embroiders napkins María Antonia G. Q. – sells furs

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Calico fabric and thread to continue sewing napkins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more hair creams and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 56 years old, and married with three children who are 7, 9 and 17 years old.  Francois is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes.  This is his 16th successful year and the hours of his business are from 8 am until 6 pm every day.

Francois needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Francois will expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of Irish potatoes.  With this additional quantity of Irish potatoes, Francois can satisfy the demands of his customers. Thus his sales, as well as his profits, will also increase.  If successful, he will keep expanding his business until he becomes financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El Señor Pablo es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, el trabaja como operador en una maquiladora de la localidad y su esposa la Señora Ruth trabaja en una casa habitación ayudando en las labores domesticas, tienen un hijo pequeño, son una familia muy unida, requieren de este crédito para colocar una barda al frente de la casa, ya que no tiene y es muy fácil que cualquier persona entre a su vivienda, temen por la seguridad de la casa ya que ellos pasan la mayor parte del día fuera, cada quien en sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is a hardworking gentleman who is always concerned about the welfare of his family. He works as an operator at a local factory, while his wife Sra. Ruth works at home, performing the household chores. They have a young son and are a very close family.

Pablo and his family need this loan to put up a wall in from their house because it is very easy for anyone to enter their home. They fear that their house is not secure enough since they spend much of their time away performing their respective duties.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall in front of his house

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y gaseosas. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando inicio fue por su esposo que tenía problemas de salud y necesitaba ayudar a los ingresos del hogar, ella sale a vender sus productos de manera ambulante en su domicilio, pues para ella es muy importante mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es el primer financiamiento que solicita pues se siente muy alegre así podrá comprar bolsas, hielo, pajillas y ropa de todo tipo. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio de ropa a domicilio.
texts.en:
Elida is 48 years old and has been selling clothing and soft drinks for more than eight years. When she started this business, her husband had health problems, so Elida needed a way to help with the household expenses. She sells her products as a traveling vendor as well as from home because it is very important that she improve her family’s quality of life.

This is her first loan, so Elida is very pleased that she will be able to buy bags, ice, straws, and all types of clothing. She dreams of opening a clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags, ice, straws, and all types of clothing

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 49 years old and married with six children who are between 10 and 22 years old.  Marthe is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes and this is her 10th successful year in this business.  The hours of starting business are from 8 am to 3 pm every day.

Marthe needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes, which in turn will allow her to increase her sales as well as her profits.  If successful, Marthe will keep expanding her business for better financial stability and, in addition to that, she will continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.fr:
Ferdinand I. est un homme  de 26 ans, marié, née à Gahanga district de Kicukiro province ville de Kigali, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a trois enfants, le plus âgée a 6 ans et son cadet a 3 ans. Ils ne vont pas encore  à l’école.
Il est employé d’une entreprise de constructions des routes comme aide maçon. Son compte d’épargne est ouvert dans Amasezerano Community Banking   depuis avril 2007, il contracte un prêt, une partie pour le finissage de maison une autre partie pour payer le minerval de petit frère. Son ambition et son souhait et que dans l’avenir et d’avoir une maison à louer et qui sera l’héritage de son fils ainé. La maison va  verser pour l’épargne éducation des enfants. Il compte aussi améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ferdinand I. is a 26 year old man who was born in the Gahanga district of Kicukiro province, city of Kigali. He has completed elementary school. He has three children, the oldest is 6 years old and the second is 3 years old. The children do not go to school yet. Mr. I. works as a mason's aide in a roadway construction company. He has had a savings account with Amasezerano Community Banking since April 2007. He is seeking a loan, partly to finish the house and partly to pay tuition fees for his younger brother. Mr. I.'s wish and ambition is to have a rental house that will be the inheritance for his eldest son. The house's rent would generate income for the education of his children. He hopes to also improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying tuition fees for his younger brother

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 53 years old and is married with six children who are between 17 and 35 years old.

Anne lives by selling women’s clothes and this is her fifteenth successful year in this business. Her business hours are from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. every day.

Anne needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, with the hope that she will increase her sales as well as her profits. If successful, one portion of her earned profits will be used to develop her business and the other portion will be used in covering all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Agath

texts.fr:
Agath S. est une femme de 42 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE dont elle est la secrétaire depuis son adhésion en novembre 2004. Elle a 11 fois de suite reçu de crédit.

Elle fais de l'embouche porcine depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en novembre 2004.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs CFA elle va acheter 20 porcs adultes à raison de 10.000 francs l'unité (destinés à l'abattage)et 10 pourceaux destinés à l'embouche. Elle va aussi acheter du son de mil pour l'alimentation des porcs.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge son enfant, et de renforcer son épargne
texts.en:
Agath S. is a 42-year-old woman. She is a single mother of one child. She is a member of the Village Bank of Walidane and has been the secretary of the group since her membership began in November of 2004. She has received eleven loans. She has run a pig farm since her membership to the Village Bank began in November 2004. With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she will buy twenty adult pigs at 10,000 francs each (which will be slaughtered) and ten swine that she will raise. She will also buy grain to feed the pigs. Her goal is to take care of her son and to build upon her savings.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Yukuyoo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Yukuyoo las integrantes D. este grupo decidieron ponerle así, por que eso significa el nombre D. L. comunidad en donD. viven, en mixteco ( Yukuyoo-San L.).
Doña Flora M. C. es L. representante D. este grupo, elL. esta casada tiene 3 hijos Laydis D. 17 años que estudia el cebeta, Alberto D. 13 quien esta  estudiando el segundo año D. secundaria y Aníbal D. 8 años que esta cursando el 4° año D. primaria, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. dulces en L. cooperativa D. L. escueL. donD. estudia uno D. sus hijos, el crédito que recibirá lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas dulces, chicharrones, refrescos y demás antojitos para seguir vendiendo.
 
ElL. decidió dedicarse a esta actividad por que le ofrecieron trabajar en L. cooperativa D. L. secundaria donD. estudia su hijo, y también por que quería buscar L. manera D.  mejorar su calidad D. vida y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa  y L. educación D. sus hijos.
 
Doña Flora esta muy satisfecha, ya que dice que le va muy bien con las ventas D. este negocio ,puesto que ahora con los estudiantes estuvieron D. vacaciones, elL. estuvo realizando esta actividad en su casa y obtuvo muy buenos resultados pero ahora que ya regresaron a clases, va a volver a vender en L. escueL., ya que ahí también obtiene muy buenos ingresos.  
 
Me platica que en ninguna ocasión fallará con los pagos D. su crédito, ni elL. ni sus compañeras del grupo ya que dice son personas muy responsables y sobre todo puntuales, ya que son mujeres muy trabajadoras que tienen ganas D. superarse y mejorar su forma D. vida puesto que ya tienen tiempo D. conocerse y dice que son personas muy confiables, ya que todas pertenecen a L. misma comunidad.
 
Quiere darle las gracias a kiva y a sus donadores por el apoyo y L. confianza que le han brindado a elL. y a las demás integrantes del grupo, ya que gracias a eso han podido continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y ayudar a mejorar L. vida D. sus familias.
 
Las metas que tiene doña Flora y dice esta segura va a lograr con el apoyo D. L. empresa, es el D. construir un cuarto para poner se negocio D. venta D. dulces y así obtener mejores ingresos también quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que tengan una muy buena carrera profesional.
 
El nombre y las actividades que realizan las integrantes del grupo Yukuyoo son las siguientes:
Flora M. C.-venta D. dulces
Analidia C. D. L. C.-borda servilletas
Gregoria N. B.-venta D. dulces
Inocencia B. M.- borda servilletas
María H. M.- borda servilletas
RafaeL. H. R.- borda servilletas
Serafina M. S.-venta D. pan
Maximina M. B.- borda servilletas
Antelma B. B.-venta D. antojitos
Paulina R. B.- borda servilletas
Florencia G. B.- borda servilletas
Andra L. M.-venta D. antojitos
texts.en:
The members of this group decided to call themselves “Yukuyoo” because it is the Mixtec name for the community in which they live (Yukuyoo-San L.). Doña Flora M. C. is the group representative. She is married and has three children: Laydis is 17 years old and studying in El Cebeta, Alberto is 13 years old and in his second year of high school, and Anibal is 8 years old and in the fourth graD.. Doña Flora makes a living selling candy at a cooperative located near the school where one of her children attends. The loan she will receive will be used to buy more candy, pork rinds, soft drinks, and other snacks to sell.

She decided to pursue this business because it gave her the opportunity to work at the cooperative near her son’s high school. In addition, she likes finding ways to improve her quality of life and helping her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education.

Doña Flora is very pleased because the sales at her business have been doing well. While her students were on vacation, she continued to sell from home and obtained very good results. Now that classes have started again and children will be returning to school, she expects to generate a very good income.

Doña Flora says she has never failed to make a payment on her loan and neither have her fellow group members. She says they are responsible people and all of them are prompt. All of these women work very hard because they want to succeed and improve their way of life. Since everyone in her group is from the same community, Flora says they are all trustworthy because they have spent a great deal of time getting to know another.

She wants to thank Kiva and its lenders for the support and confidence they have demonstrated to her and the other members of her group. They appreciate the opportunity to continue investing in their businesses so that they can improve the lives of their families.

Now that she has secured financial support for her business, Doña Flora says her goals are to build a room for her business where she can sell candy and to improve her income. She also wants to support her children with their studies so that they can become successful career professionals.

The members of the Yukuyoo Group and their business activities are listed below: Flora M. C. – sells candy Analidia C. D. L. C. – makes embroidered napkins Gregoria N. B. – sells candy Inocencia B. M. – makes embroidered napkins María H. M. – makes embroidered napkins RafaeL. H. R. – makes embroidered napkins Serafina M. S. – sells bread Maximina M. B. – makes embroidered napkins Antelma B. B. – sells snacks Paulina R. B. – makes embroidered napkins Florencia G. B. – makes embroidered napkins Andra L. M. – sells snacks

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, pork rinds, soft drinks, and snacks to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina N. is a senior high school graduate. She is a hairdresser at Takoradi. She is married and has a child. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams to treat her customers’ hair. She hopes to reinvest back into her business should there be any increase in profit.

loans.use: buy more hair creams to treat her customers’ hair

loans.name: C2694 Abafatanye Group

texts.en:
Sada is 45 years old and is married with four children who are 18, 20, 21 and 22 years old.

Sada is the leader of this group called Abafatanye. She and her team operate a business selling a variety of goods including foodstuffs. They have been in this business for about two years and the business hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Although Sada and her team have been in business for about two years, their capital is still too low to expand their business meaningfully. To resolve this, they need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. Once given this loan, they will be able to satisfy the demand of their customers which will result in increased sales as well as increased profits.

If successful, Sada and her team will keep improving their business for better financial stability in the future and, in addition to that, each team member's living style will improve.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods including foodstuffs for their business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a room on the upper floor of his house

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoraida R. M. cliente recurrente  de nuestra entidad,  vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque.
 La titular cuenta con una despensa hace mas de 15 años, posee una buena clientela formada ya que es una de las despensas mas surtidas en el barrio, dicho préstamo solicito para comprar un lote de mercaderías y artículos de mercería para dicho negocio. 
Ha la fecha la Sra. Felicia ha retirado su segundo préstamo y  opera con nuestra institución desde el 2009.
Dicho préstamo la titular considera que le dejara un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio y a la vez le ayudara para un  mejor nivel de vida.-
texts.en:
Sra. Zoraida R. M. is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. She lives in her own home in the city of Luque. Zoraida has been operating a food pantry for more than 15 years. She has a good customer base and manages one of the best stocked shops in the neighborhood. With this loan request, she will buy a batch of merchandise and dry goods for her business. As of this date, Sra. Zoraida has repaid her second loan and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2009. She says this loan will help improve the profit margins of her business and raise her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, flour, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Nael

texts.fr:
NAEL K. est une femme de 47 ans. Elle es mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 22 décembre 2007. Elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans le Banc Villageois. 

Son activité principale est la restauration. Elle est détentrice d'un restaurant où elle sert les trois repas de la journée. Et pour renflouer ses activité elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine.

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter du riz, de l'huile végétale, des légumes et des condiments pour développer son activité de restauration. Elle va aussi acheter 5 bœufs.

Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Nael K. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Walidane “Banc Villageois” loan group since 22 December 2007, but has over 5 years seniority in “Banc Villageois” loan groups. Her main activity is food preparation. She runs a restaurant where she offers the three daily meals. As a side business to keep afloat she fattens cattle. Her loan will enable her to buy rice, vegetable oil, vegetables and condiments to develop her restaurant business. She will also buy five oxen. She participates in the improvement of her family’s living conditions while strengthening her level of savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetables and food condiments.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La Señora María de la Luz es muy trabajadora, ella trabaja en el comedor de una maquiladora y tiene el turno de noche, y en el día atiende una tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa, y cuida a una de sus nietas, su esposo el señor Juan Bernardo le ayuda en atender la tienda. Ellos viven solos y son muy unidos, la señora María de la Luz quiere ampliar su casa y con ahorros ha construido, pero le falta la losa de concreto, es por eso que requiere de este nuevo crédito, ya que la señora María ya ah tenido créditos con nosotros. Ella y su esposo les agradecen su ayuda.
texts.en:
María de la Luz is a very hard worker. She works in the dining room in a factory. She has the night shift. In the daytime she sees to a grocery store that she has in her house, and she takes care of her granddaughters. Her husband, Juan Bernardo, helps her with the store. They live alone, and they are very united. María de la Luz wants to expand her house, which was built with savings. But, the house needs a concrete slab. That is why she needs this new loan. María has already had loan with us. She and her husband are grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Zunilda Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Zunilda es soltera  y tiene un hijo de 12 años de nombre  Cesar Alfredo.
Zunilda desde muy pequeña se dedico a la comercialización de artículos de primera  necesidad, gracias  a su esfuerzofue ampliando su stock en  mercaderías.
Hoy en día Zunilda ya posee su propio local de ventas en su domicilio donde le abástese  a todo el vecindario.
Hoy en día la microempresa de Zunilda posee muchas mas mercaderías debido a la cantidad de cliente que tiene en la actualidad.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, fideos, yerba, gaseosas  y otras.
texts.en:
Zunilda is single, and she has a 12 year old son named Cesar Alfredo. Ever since Zunilda was very little she has sold basic needs items. Thanks to her hard work, she has been increasing her stock of merchandise. Now, Zunilda has her own sales location in her house. She supplies her whole neighborhood. Nowadays Zunilda, the entrepreneur, has a lot more merchandise because of how many customers she currently has. She is requesting the loan to buy sugar, noodles, herbs, soft drinks, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, noodles, herbs, soft drinks, and other things

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El señor Héctor trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa de alarmas, el es muy trabajador, es divorciado y vive solo en su vivienda, pero sus hijos y nietos lo visitan continuamente y el se preocupa por sus nietos pequeños, es por eso que el requiere este prestamos para colocar el Vitro piso en la parte trasera de la vivienda, que es donde juegan los niños, ya que ahorita hay mucha tierra y por la salud de los niños pequeños, no es bueno que jueguen en un lugar así.
texts.en:
Héctor works as a security guard for an alarm company. He is a very hard-worker. He is divorced, and he lives alone in his house. However, his children and grandchildren visit him all of the time. He cares for his little grandchildren. That is why he needs this loan. It is to place a tile floor in the back part of his house. That is where the children play. There is a lot of dirt there. It is not good for the little children’s health to play in a place like that.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a tile floor on the back patio of his house

loans.name: Dulce Amanecer Group

texts.es: Doña Lucia T. P., es una señora casada cursó el sexT. grado primaria, tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra venta y la elaboración D. canastas, desD. su niñez ella elabora cestas, para su diario vivir y hoy en día para apoyar a su esposo, para ellos, poder tener un buen ingreso, y mejorar su economía. Contando con su ayuda y D. otras vecinas y con entusiasmo formaron un grupo, para poder solicitar un crédiT.. El grupo solidario se denomina Dulce Amanecer, el grupo cuenta con 7 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades económicas, entre las cuales podemos mencionar, la artesanía, comercio, crianza D. animales, como gallinas cerdos, ganados, el crédiT. ella utilizara para capital D. trabajo (elaboración D. canastas). Para ellos poder incrementar su economía y capital, deseando que su negocio sea mas granD. y productivo.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia T. P. is married and has attended school through the sixth graD.. She has three children, all in school. She makes a living buying, producing and selling baskets. She has been making baskets since she was a child, T. cover her daily living costs and now T. help her husband increase their income and improve their economic position. Together with some of her neighbors they have enthusiastically formed a group T. be able T. request a loan. The mutual group is called Dulce Amanecer (Sweet Dawn), and it has 7 woman members, who make a living through various activities. Among these activities are craftsmanship, commerce, raising of animals such as chickens, pigs, and cattle. The loan will be used for working capital (for the making of baskets). In order T. be able T. improve their financial position they need T. grow their business and become more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alvaro Samuel

texts.es:
Álvaro de 21 años, el es vendedor de chifles Link, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

El inicio la venta de los chifles porque casi todas sus familiares vendían encebollados y querían que el venda los chifles porque este plato se lo come así. Después de casarse el comenzó con su negocio de venta de chifles, actualmente los reparte en las tiendas y en los puesto de venta de encebollado, trabaja desde las 05h00am. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo una moto para poder transportar los chifles a los lugares de venta y plátanos. En el futuro quiere tener un local propio para los chifles.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 21 years old and a vendor who sells plantain chips. He lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem.

Most of Álvaro’s relatives sell onions, so he opened a plantain chip business because he wanted to sell a different type of food product. Álvaro started his plantain chip business after he got married. Now his products are sold in stores and at vending stands that sell onions. He starts his work day at 5am.

With this loan, Álvaro wants to buy plantains and a motorcycle so that he can transport plantain chips to different sales points. In the future, he wants to open his own plantain chip shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plantains & a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La señora María Magdalena se dedica a la fabricación y venta de piñatas para fiestas, ella es una mujer muy independiente  y muy trabajadora, la señora María es divorciada y tiene a su cargo dos hijos adolescentes que colaboran con ella en la venta de las piñatas, la señora rento un local donde sabe que habrá mas ventas y requiere de este crédito para invertir en la compra de mas material para realizar diferentes tipos de piñatas y así incrementar la clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. María Magdalena makes and sells piñatas for parties. She is an independent and hardworking woman. María is divorced and takes care of her two teenage children who help her with selling the piñatas. She rents a space where she is able to generate better sales, so she needs this loan so that she can buy more materials to make different types of piñatas and increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Doña FRANCISCA I. D. L. tiene 41 años, es casada, tiene 8 hijos, los cuales estan a su cargo y se
dedica a la elaboracion D. telas y fajas D. mostacias, tipicos D. la region, para la venta por mayor y menor,
actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 2 años atrás y con el afan D. mejorar su calidad D. y la D. su
familia deciden organizarse con otras vecinas D. la comunidad para solicitar un credito que les servira para
incrementar el capital D. cada persona, y así generar mas ingresos para cada familia, teniendo en cuenta que 
las integrantes del grupo se dedican a varias clases D. actividades productivas como: Elaboracion D. fajas D.
mostacias, y venta D. mostacia, el cuales los venden en Santa Clara la Laguna, Solola, esperan obtener mejores ganancias para el desarrollo D. la comunidad donD. residen.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca I. D. L. is 41 years old, married, and has eight children who are dependent on her. She makes beaded fabrics and skirts, which are traditional for this region, and sells them in bulk and in smaller quantities. Francisca started this business two years ago and wants to improve the quality of her work. Along with some family members, she decided to join with other neighbors in the community so that they could request a loan that would help everyone increase their capital. This would allow them to generate more income for their respective families.

The members of the group have different types of business activities such as making beaded skirts and selling beaded fabrics. These products are sold in Santa Clara La Laguna, which is in the Department of Solola. They hope to obtain better earnings so that they can develop the community in which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire materials used in making beaded fabrics

loans.name: Patrique

texts.en:
Patrique is 28 years old and single. He is commonly known for selling spare parts.  He has been in this business for about two years and his business hours are from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Patrique would like to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts to sell.  To this end, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With these additional spare parts for sale, Patrique will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will be used to create some other sources of income for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajado Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Mujeres trabajando", las integrantes de este grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, por que dicen es como se consideran ellas, mujeres muy trabajadoras con ganas de superarse y salir adelante, luchar para conseguir un mejor futuro para sus familias.
Esta historia es sobre la señora Francisca Felisa N. G., ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de superarse, ella tiene 61 años es viuda desde hace 40 años y tiene 2 hijos Miguel de 27 años que trabaja para apoyar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y Jesús de 23 el esta estudiando la carrera en Derecho, su hermano y su mamá lo están apoyando, ella se dedica a el bordado de blusas y batas también elabora velas, el crédito que recibirá lo va a invertir en compra de mas mantas, hilos y demás material que necesita para seguir elaborando estos trajes típicos.
 
Doña francisca dice que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, por que la aprendió desde que tenia 11 años ya que su mamá le enseño, lleva mas de 30 años dedicándose a realizar esta actividad, pues desde que su esposo falleció tuvo que buscar la manera de  como sacar a sus hijos adelante.
