Ella esta muy satisfecha con los resultados que esta obteniendo de su negocio, ya que esta teniendo mucho éxito por que el numero de clientes que tiene esta creciendo bastante, tanto que ahora tiene que viajar a los diferentes estados de la republica, para vender sus trajes típicos y los de sus compañeras.
 
La señora Felisa me dice que en ningún momento ha fallado con los pagos de su préstamo, ni ella ni sus compañeras de grupo, puesto que son mujeres muy trabajadora responsables y puntuales en las cuales se puede confiar, ya que tiene tiempo de conocerlas puesto que son de la misma comunidad y este no es su primer préstamo con FRAC, llevan varios y en ninguno han quedado mal.
 
Esta muy agradecida con el apoyo y confianza que fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva , les están dando tanto a ella como a sus compañeras, ya que gracias a esto han podido salir adelante con su negocio, y ayudar a sus familias para mejorar su calidad de vida.
 
El sueño que tiene doña francisca es el de poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos a sus hijos, a uno con sus estudios para que termine su carrera y tenga un buen trabajo y no tenga que sufrir tanto como su hermano, y al otro con sus gastos ya que como trabaja en el campo, a veces no tiene trabajo y aparte de eso lo que le pagan es muy poco, también quiere construir o comprar un local para poner su tienda de ropa típica, para así no tener que andar viajando y obtener mejores ganancias.
 
Las integrantes de este grupo y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes:
Sofía G. M.-venta de ropa típica 
Francisca Felisa N. G.-venta de ropa típica
Cecilia G. S.-venta de ropa típica
Sebastiana H. L. G.-venta de ropa típica
Honoria N. G.-venta de dulce
Victoria María L. M.-venta de ropa típica
Gabriela Delfina L. S.-venta de ropa típica
Emelia G. N.- venta de ropa típica
Virginia G. N.- venta de ropa típica                                                                   
Virginia G. G.- venta de ropa típica
Clemencia G. S.- venta de ropa típica
Sofía Honoria G. G.- venta de ropa típica
Eloina G. N.- venta de ropa típica
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Trabajando” (Working Women). The members of the group selected this name because they consider themselves to be extremely hardworking women who want to succeed and move forward so that they can provide a better future for their families.

The description will focus on Sra. Francisca Felisa N. G., one of the members of this group of women entrepreneurs who want to excel. She is 61 years old and has been a widow since she was 40. Francisca has two children. Miguel is 27 years old and works to help his mother with the household expenses. Jesús is 23 years old and studying for a law degree while his brother and mother support him. Francisca earns a living by making embroidered blouses and gowns, as well as candles. The loan she will receive will be used to buy more fabric, thread, and other materials needed to continue making these traditional garments.

Doña Francisca says she decided to pursue this business activity because she learned the skills from her mother when she was eleven years old. She started this business 30 years ago. Since the death of her husband, she needed to find a way for her children to get ahead. Francisca is very pleased with the results of her business. She has had great success with the number of customers she has gained and it continue to grow since she travels to different states in the republic, where she sells traditional clothing along with her fellow group members.

Sra. Francisca says that neither she nor the other members have failed to make their loan payments. These women are hardworking, responsible, prompt, and trustworthy. Over time they have gotten to know one another since are from the same community. This is not their first loan with FRAC. In fact, they have taken several of them and have not had any problems.

Francisca is extremely grateful for the support and the trust that Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders have given to her and her fellow group members. She is thankful that they will be able to get ahead in their businesses and help their families improve their quality of life.

Doña Francisca dreams of being able to support her children. She wants to help her younger son finish his degree so that he can find a good job and not have to suffer like his brother by having to work in the fields, work at jobs with low pay, or go through stretches of time when no work is available. She also wants to either build or buy a store where she can sell traditional clothing so that she does not have to travel in order to generate better income.

The members of this group and their business activities are as follows: Sofía G. M. – sells traditional clothing Francisca Felisa N. G. - sells traditional clothing Cecilia G. S. - sells traditional clothing Sebastiana H. L. G. - sells traditional clothing Honoria N. G. – sells candy Victoria María L. M.- sells traditional clothing Gabriela Delfina L. S. - sells traditional clothing Emelia G. N. - sells traditional clothing Virginia G. N. - sells traditional clothing Virginia G. G. - sells traditional clothing Clemencia G. S. - sells traditional clothing Sofía Honoria G. G. - sells traditional clothing Eloina G. N. - sells traditional clothing

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and other materials for making embroidered clothing

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: L. señora Laura tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y su esposo trabaja en una maquiladora D. L. localidad, ellos son una pareja muy  unida y los dos contribuyen a los gastos D. L. casa, tienen dos hijos pequeños los cuales estudian.  L. señora Laura ya ha tenido crédito con nosotros y ah demostrado su excelente cultura D. pago, en esta ocasión elL. necesita D. este crédito para invertir en su negocio  ya que quiere comprar mas abarrotes para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Laura manages a grocery store while her husband works at a local factory. They are a very close couple and both of them contribute to the household expenses. Laura and her husband have two young children who are in school. She has taken a previous loan with FVP and has demonstrated that she has an excellent payment record.

On this occasion, she needs a loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy more groceries in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to increase her sales

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 45 years old and married with six children between 6 and 18 years old. Augustin is a businessman and his wife is jobless. For that reason, he has to work hard to provide all the basic needs for his family. Augustin sells handbags and he said that is a good business because it is profitable. Augustin is well known and his business is well organized as well. This is his 15th year of successful operation in business. Augustin runs his business from 6 in the morning to 6 in the morning every day.

Augustin is now requesting a Kiva loan Via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing additional handbags to sell. This expansion will allow him to be more efficient and more successful. Once this loan is given, Augustin will be able to earn more profit to use for his family and his business.

loans.use: To purchase more handbags to sell

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora:  Virginia L. quien es  vendedora de ropas , de la ciudad Parques del Sur   de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, ella recorre a pie todo el barrio por la mañana y por la tarde levantando pedidos entre  los vecinos, en cuanto se entero sobre el programas para mujeres de la Fundación se interesó muchísimo acerca del crédito., pues seria de buena ayuda tanto para ella como para su grupo.
Las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio de la Señora Virginia L.  una señora muy activa, trabajadora y todas las del grupo también todas son mujeres que sigen adelante con su esfuerzo y  tener cada una su puesto de trabajo para poder sobrellevar a sus hijos y a ellas mismas. 
La señora Virginia solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, pantalones, camperas, buzos, camisas.
texts.en:
This group came together thanks to Mrs.Virginia L., who sells clothing in Parques del Sur, of the Villa Elisa city. She goes through the whole neighborhood in the morning and afternoon getting orders from her neighbors. When she found out about the program for women at the Foundation, she became very interested in the loans, because they would be of much help to her and her group. The meetings take place at the home of Mrs. Virginia L., a very active and hard working woman. All the women in the group continue to get ahead through hard work, each having her job to allow her to take care of her children and of herself. Mrs. Virginia is requesting the loan for the purchase of T-shirts, pants, jackets, sweatshirts, and shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, pants, jackets, and other clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dolores Piedad

texts.es:
Dolores de 53 años, vive en una zona urbana, y tiene un pequeño negocio de servicio telefónico, es madre soltera con tres hijos. 

Ella inicio el negocio porque no quería depender del ex-esposo, con algunos ahorros que tenia comenzó a vender hielos y helados, con los ingresos generados compro algunos teléfonos y puso su propio negocio. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, en la foto aparece con uno de sus nietos que le ayudan después de haber salido de clases.     

Ella quiere readecuar el local de las cabinas por eso quiere compra cemento y pinturas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere tener una pequeña papelería a lado de sus cabinas telefónicas.
texts.en:
Dolores is 53 years old, lives in an urban area, and has a small telephone services business. She is a single mother of three children. She started this business because she did not want to depend on her ex-husband. Using some savings, she started to sell ice and ice cream. With the income that she generated she bought some phones and started her own business. She now works from 8:00 am until 10:00 pm. In the picture she is with one of her grandsons, who help her once they get out of school. She wants to relocate the booths, for which she needs to buy cement and paint with the loan proceeds. In the future she would like to have a small stationary store next to her telephone booths.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement and paint

loans.name: Erika Adriana

texts.es: Erika Adriana tiene inicio un hace un año un negocio de compra venta de granos, como maíz y frijoles al por mayor, y también una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, todos los días va a vender sus productos, pues para ella es muy importante mejorar su negocio. Trabaja desde las de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería como aceite, arroz, azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar su local y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
A year ago, Erika Adriana started a business buying and selling grains like corn and beans wholesale. She also has a small store in her house. She sells her products every day, because it is very important to her to improve her business. She works from 6 in the morning until 6 at night. With this loan, she will buy merchandise like oil, rice, and sugar for her business. In the future, she would like to expand her store and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, and other merchandise

loans.name: Las Dos Palmitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Las Dos Palmitas" se tomo la decisión de ponerle esta nombre, ya que en el patio de la casa de una de las integrantes donde se reúnen hay 2 palmas de coco, es por eso que se escogió este nombre.
 
Esta historia es acerca de la señora Tomasa L. O., ya que es una de las lideres del grupo, cuenta con 38 años de edad esta casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales 1 estudia la prepa, otro de ellos la secundaria y el menor la primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de colchas, manteles, y ocasionalmente lonas, ella dice que con el crédito que recibirá va a invertir en la compra de mas colchas, sabanas, cortinas y manteles para continuar con su negocio.
 
Ella se decidió por esta actividad por que una de sus amigas se lo recomendó, ya que dice se obtienen muy buenas ganancias y también por que quería buscar la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos.
 
Esta muy contenta ya que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, puesto que sus ventas han incrementado mucho, ya que ahora tiene mas clientes de los que tenia antes por el buen servicio y  trato que les brinda, aparte de sus excelentes precios  y es por eso que sus ingresos también han incrementado bastante.
 
Doña Tomasa dice que en ningún momento a fallado con los pagos de su crédito, ni ella ni sus compañeras ya que son mujeres responsables, puntuales pero sobre todo muy trabajadoras, puesto que se conocen unas a otras  desde hace bastante tiempo y éste es su tercer préstamo con FRAC, y se tienen mucha confianza , también por que no quieren fallarle a quienes las apoyan y creen en ellas.  
 
Esta muy agradecida con Fundación Realidad y los donadores, ya que sin su ayuda no hubieran podido lograr todo lo que hasta ahora han hecho, como mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también el poder continuar con su negocio y seguir invirtiendo en el.
 
La meta que tiene doña Tomasa es la de que su negocio continúe creciendo aun mas y prosperando como hasta ahora, ya que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de blancos y así no tener que andar casa por casa vendiendo, también el de seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que terminen sus estudios superiores y tengan una muy buena profesión.  
 
Las personas que integran el grupo de las dos palmitas y a lo que se dedican son los siguientes:
Tomasa L. O.-venta de colchas
Bonfilia H. M.-venta de antojitos
Julia H. S.-venta de colchas y cobertores
Fernanda Anabel A. O.-venta de ropa
Cristina R. R.-venta de cosméticos por catalogo
Elizabeth H. B.-venta de colchas y cobertores
Iris Humberta G. P.-tienda de abarrotes
Balvina D. S.-abarrotes
Hidaid M. N.-venta de comida
Nayeli M. N.-venta de ropa
María Elena B. M.-taller de motosierras
Hermelinda Ana R. R.-venta de comida
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Dos Palmitas” (The Two Little Palm Trees) because there are two coconut palm trees in the front yard of one of its members; this is why they chose this name. The following story is about Mrs. Tomasa L. O. since she is one of the group leaders. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. One child is in high school, one in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school. Tomasa sells bedspreads, tablecloths and sometimes tarps. She says that the loan she’ll get will be used to buy more bedspreads, sheets, drapes and tablecloths to continue with her business. She decided to go into this line of work because one of her girlfriends recommended it because she said good profits can be made and because she wanted to find a way to help her husband meet household expenses and pay for their children’s education. She is very happy because she says she is doing very well with her business because her sales have increased much. She now has more customers than she had before thanks to the good service and treatment she provides, aside from the excellent prices. This is why her income has increased notably. Tomasa says that she’s never failed to make her repayments on time. Neither have her fellow members because they are all responsible, punctual women but above all, very hard working. They have known each other for a long time and this is their 3rd loan with FRAC. They trust each other and don’t want to disappoint those people that support them and believe in them. She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and the donors because without their help she would have not accomplished all she has so far like improving her quality of life and that of her family as well as being able to continue with her business and continue to invest in it. Tomasa’s goal is to have her business grow and prosper even more than it has to date. She wants to build a locale to install her linens shop so that she doesn’t have to continue to sell door-to-door. She also wants to continue to support her children’s education so that they may complete higher education and have a good profession. The group members and their activities are as follows: Tomasa L. O.-bedspread sales Bonfilia H. M.-fast food sales Julia H. S.-bedspread and comforter sales Fernanda Anabel A. O.-clothing sales Cristina R. R.-catalogue cosmetics sales Elizabeth H. B.- bedspread and comforter sales Iris Humberta G. P.-grocery store Balvina D. S.-groceries Hidaid M. N.-prepared food sales Nayeli M. N.-clothing sales María Elena B. M.-power tool repair shop Hermelinda Ana R. R.-prepared food sales

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bedspreads, sheets, drapes and tablecloths.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda, de 33 años de edad, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tiene su propia casa. A Casilda siempre le ha gustado escuchar las orientaciones que recibía por parte de su familia, ya que con ello empezó a practicarla en la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de café y cacao. Recuerda que se inició cultivando café, pero al poco tiempo notó que su producto tenía mucha demanda, desde luego que siguió con esta actividad, pero con el pasar de los años decidió introducir un nuevo producto agrícola, que es el cacao, con la finalidad de que pueda captar más clientes. Hoy su negocio agrícola, como fuente principal, está dando buenos frutos económicos, además viene tomando un buen posicionamiento sólido en su localidad, ya que el producto que ofrece es de calidad total, es mas sus compradores potenciales se van satisfechos con los  productos que los ofrece, no contento con ello, hace poco abrió su pequeña tienda en donde vende bebidas para sus comensales. Generalmente trabaja con su pareja y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en temporada de cosecha tienen a cargo de sus peones, para que de esa manera le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto final. Usualmente su productos lo vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad y su rutina diaria  es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio de bebida, introduciendo nuevos productos básicos para el hogar familiar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas, además con su grupo comunal, le esta yendo de la mejor manera. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, con el propósito de que le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Casilda is 33 years old and lives with her partner and they have three children of school age. They live in the brow of the Peruvian jungle located in Quimbiri where she has her own home. Casilda has always enjoyed listening to advice from her family and through them she began agriculture, specifically cultivating and selling coffee and cocoa. She remembers starting with coffee crops but in a short time she noticed that her product had a lot of demand and she continued her job but as the years passed, she decided to introduce a new crop, cocoa, so that she can have more customers. Today her agricultural business is her main source of income and it gives her very good revenue, she has a good status in her area since her products are of very high quality and her potential customers are satisfied with the products that she offers. A little while ago she opened a small store where she sells beverages for her compatriots. Casilda usually works with her partner and they make a good working team but during harvest season the farmhands are in charge so they help extract the final product. The crops are usually sold in areas where people gather. Her daily routine is to leave at 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. Her plans for the future are to expand her beverage business by introducing new products like basic household goods. This is Casilda's second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she is committed to pay the quotas during the established time periods as she enjoys her communal group. With the loan, Casilda plans to buy merchandize and manure so that she can give the proper care to her cocoa and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize and manure to take care of the cocoa and coffee crops.

loans.name: Maia Juana

texts.es:
María de 42 años, ella vende legumbres en un local que alquila, es viuda con dos hijas viven en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil).

Comenzó vendiendo legumbres en un triciclo pero como recorría todo Duran y no tenia muchas ganancias tambien esto le causaba daño a su salud, tuvo que establece la venta de legumbres en un local. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm con la ayuda de una de sus hijas.   

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo legumbres y granos parra venderlos en su pequeña tienda. En el futuro quiere surtir y agranda su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old. She sells vegetables in a rented storefront. She is a widow with two daughters. They live in Primavera de Duran, a semi-urban area with a declining ecosystem, located on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She began selling vegetables on a tricycle, but she had to go all over Duran and did not make much profit, and this was also bad for her health. So, she had to establish a fixed location to sell her vegetables from. Now she works from 7:00 a.m. until 10 p.m., with the help of her daughters. She would like to use this loan to buy vegetables and grains to sell in her small store. In the future, she would like to stock up and expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grains

loans.name: Yader Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Yader Antonio  tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. La ubicación es en su humilde vivienda, el es padre de tres hijos que junto a su esposa han logrado salir adelante, por lo que él es quien  va todos los días a buscar los productos necesarios para su negocio, ya que los precios de sus productos le resultan mucho más favorable porque también tiene a sus clientes en el mercado pues ya lo conocen porque el llega diariamente a realizar estas gestiones. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como frutas, verduras, golosinas, detergentes y otras cosas. Siempre sueña con lograr establecer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Mr. Yader Antonio is 31 years old. He runs a small grocery store, which is located in his humble home. He is the father of three children who, together with his spouse, he has enabled to get ahead in life. Every day, he goes out looking for the necessary products for his business. As a result, the prices of his products are much more favorable, because he also has customers in the market who know him because he goes there every day do business. This loan is to purchase merchandise like fruit, vegetables, candies, detergents, and other items. Mr. Yader always dreams of establishing a wholesale dispensary.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise like fruit, vegetables, candies, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es: Cayetana, de 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos mellizos, Eloy y Elinda de 13 años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa  base de madera. A pesar de no tener estudios, no le fue impedimento de salir adelante, así que se dedico a cultivar cacao en una pequeña parcela, por lo que solo le abastecía para su consumo diario, hoy tiene una estabilidad económica mejor, ya que produce y comercializa su producto de cacao de manera considerable, incluso ya tiene ganado a sus clientes mas recurrentes, en donde ella trata de cumplir con sus compromisos durante las fechas pactadas, de esa manera sus clientes quedan satisfechos. Trabaja en compañía de su esposo, y en las vacaciones escolares recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, que le ayudan a agilizar la extracción de su producto final. Usualmente trabaja de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en los centro de acopio de su localidad. Ella anhela en un futuro próximo mejorar su vivienda a base de material noble, con la necesidad de darle seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas establecidazas, además tiene un buen concepto de banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono, para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, asimismo desea remover sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Cayetana is 52 years old, married, and has a set of thirteen year old twins named Eloy and Elinda. They live together in their own house located in the town of Quimbiri, which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Even though she does not have an education, it has not stopped her from getting ahead. Cayetana grows cacao on a small parcel of land and it is her only means by which she can supply for her daily needs. Today she has better financial stability because she produces and sells her cacao products in considerable amounts. She already has gained more repeat customers, so she tries to complete her orders by the committed delivery dates in order to keep them satisfied. Cayetana and her husband work together and receive the help of their children during the school holidays. During the harvest season, she hires workers to expedite gathering of her final product. She usually works Monday to Saturday from 7am to 6pm. Her sales are conducted at the local collection center. Her wish for the near future is to remodel her home with solid materials in order to provide safety and comfort for her family.

This is her first loan with MFP. Cayetana promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines. She has a good understanding of how the Communal Bank operates. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of compost so that she can adequately maintain her cacao crops and enhance the quality of her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Esta UDE lleva por nombre "Las Guerreras", este nombre lo decidieron las integrantes por que es así como se consideran, personas que luchan por lo que quieren para sacar a sus familias adelante y para tener una mejor calidad de vida, de ahí el nombre de guerreras.
 
Una de las lideres de esta UDE es la señora Claudia Francisca M. Ramírez, de quien trata esta historia ella es madre soltera que lucha día a día para sacar a sus cuatro hijos delante de entre 13 y 23 años de edad, ya que los cuatro estudian ella es costurera y con el préstamo que recibió va a comprar cierres, hilos, telas, agujas y demás material que necesita para seguir con su trabajo.
 
Doña Francisca decidió dedicarse a esta actividad por que aprendió este oficio desde hace varios años, ya que fue su madre quien le enseño y también por que tenia que buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y tuvieran un mejor futuro, puesto que no tenia a nadie quien la apoyara económicamente.
 
Me comenta que le esta yendo muy bien con las ventas de su negocio, sobre todo ahora que los estudiantes regresaron a clases, ya que tuvo mucho trabajo por que le hicieron varios pedidos de uniformes, para las escuelas primarias, secundarias y preescolares y gracias a esto sus ingresos incrementaron bastante.
 
Quiere darle las gracias a FRAC y a los donadores de kiva, ya que gracias a ellos , ha podido continuar con su negocio para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios, ya que también ha mejorado bastante su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
 
El sueño que tiene doña claudia es le de poder comprarse unas 4 maquinas, para poner su taller de costura y así darle empleo a mujeres que al igual que ella son madres solteras, y necesitan trabajar para sacar a sus hijos adelante, también quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que terminen una carrera profesional y tengan mejores oportunidades de vida.
 
Las personas que integran  la UDE de "Las Guerreras" y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
María Teresa M. R.-costurera
Claudia francisca M. R.-costurera
Eloisa Cristi A. A.-venta de sabanas
Bricia G. A.-venta de cosméticos
Vigail A. R.-venta de ropa 
Minerva S. T.-sastrería
María Isabel M. V.-venta de ropa
Isaina M. R.-venta de perfumes
Luis M. R.-mecánico
Adriana L. H..-venta de refrescos
Minerva S. R.-venta de mole
texts.en:
This communal bank goes by the name "Las Guerreras" (The Warriors); the members decided upon this name because it is how they see themselves, as people who fight to get ahead with their families to have a better quality of life. One of the leaders of this communal bank is Claudia Francisca M. Ramírez. This is her story: she is a single mother who struggles daily to support her 4 children who are between the ages of 13 and 23, since they are all in school. She is a dressmaker, and with the loan she received she is going to buy zippers, thread, fabric, needles, and other materials that she needs to continue with her work. Claudia Francisca decided to go into this line of work because she learned to sew a number of years ago since her mother taught her these skills. Also, she needed to find a way to support her children so that they would have a better future, since she did not have anyone to support her economically. She tells us that the sales in her business are going well. Now that the children have returned to school she has had a lot of work because she had a large number of orders for uniforms for the elementary, secondary and pre-schools. Thanks to this work her income increased substantially. She wants to give thanks to FRAC and to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to them she has been able to continue with her business and continue supporting her children in their studies. She has also substantially increased the quality of life for herself and her family. Claudia Francisca dreams of being able to buy 4 sewing machines to put in her sewing workshop. In this way she could employ women like her who are single mothers and need work to support their children. In addition, she wants to continue to pay for her children's education so that they can finish their professional degrees and have better opportunities in life. The members of the communal bank "Las Guerreras" and the activities they carry out are the following: María Teresa M. R.-dressmaker Claudia francisca M. R.- dressmaker Eloisa Cristi A. A.- sells bed sheets Bricia G. A.- sells cosmetics Vigail A. R.- sells clothing Minerva S. T.- tailoring María Isabel M. V.- sells clothing Isaina M. R.- sells perfumes Luis M. R.- mechanic Adriana L. H..- sells soft drinks Minerva S. R.- sells mole (chili sauce)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, fabric, needles and other supplies

loans.name: Anastacia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Anastasia Teresa, es una señora de 64 años y se dedica a la compra y destace de cerdos, desde hace más de 35 años, y con su trabajo logro educar y mantener a sus hijos. Actualmente con su ganancia mantiene su hogar y la educación de uno de sus nietos. Pues siempre le ha gustado esta actividad, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le exigen muy buena calidad. Es necesario con el financiamiento comprara un par de cerdos grande para destace y otros productos para la elaboración de Nacatamales, fritos, chicharrón y todos los derivados del cerdo. Es una señora trabajadora y dedicada a su hogar, sus productos ya que cuenta con una clientela de muchos años que logro conquistar por la calidad y lo sabroso de sus productos.
texts.en:
Anastasia Teresa, 64, has bought pigs to butcher for over 35 years. Her work has made it possible for her to raise and educate her children. She currently uses her profits to support her home and educate one of her grandsons. She has always enjoyed this work. Most of her customers always insist on very good quality. She needs funds to buy a pair of large pigs to butcher and other ingredients to make Nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare), fried pork rind, fried pork and all other pork-derived products. She is a hard working woman who is dedicated to her home and to the quality of her products since she has a long-standing customer base that she secured through the quality and delicious taste of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pair of large pigs.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es: Daria, de 55 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene una hija. Juntas residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Daria se caracteriza por ser una persona exigente y de mucho carácter. En la actualidad su negocio de comida es conocido en su localidad, debido a la buena crítica que obtuvo por parte sus comensales, es por ello que se siente contento por la actividad que realiza, fruto del éxito  que está obteniendo abrió una pequeña tienda de venta de ropa, negocio en el que su hija esta a cargo. Por lo general trabaja con su ayudante en donde lo facilita en la atención y traslado de sus platos típicos hacia sus comensales. Su plan a futuro es poder ampliar su tienda con la necesidad de que pueda introducir nueva mercadería, con nuevos diseños y tendencias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando con sus respectivos pagos, además esta contenta con su banco comunal, ya que le trae muchos beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita será destinado para la elaboración de sus platos típicos, con el objetivo de satisfacer a sus clientes y el resto será invertido en su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Daria, aged 55, is divorced and has a daughter. They live together in the village of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful rainforest in Peru, where she has her own wooden house. Daria can be described as a demanding person with a strong character. Daria's food business is presently well known in her village due to the favorable opinion voiced by her guests, and this is what keeps her happy in her activity. She used the fruits of her successful business to open a small clothes store, which is run by her daughter. Usually Daria works with her assistant who helps her and serves her traditional dishes to her guests. For the future she plans to expand her business and offer new merchandise with new designs and trends. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She commits herself to repaying it according to the loan terms. She is also happy with her community bank, because she has many economic benefits from it. She will use her new loan to prepare her traditional dishes with the aim of satisfying her guests, and the rest will be reinvested in her clothes store.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Melendres Laura

texts.es:
Laura de 38 años, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, su esposo repara zapatos a un bajo precio ellos tiene una hija de 10 años y viven en una zona urbana del Guasmo de Guayaquil. 

Inicio el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares y asegurar la vida de su hija, aprendió a cortar cabello a tinturarlo, hacer peinados y estilo, manicura, pedicura hace años. Trabaja desde muy temprano, hasta el anochecer sola. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar utensilios para su negocio como sillas y panchas de cabello. En el futuro ella quiere abrir un salón de belleza profesional, ya que esta estudiando para perfeccionar el servicio.
texts.en:
Laura, 38, has a small beauty salon. Her husband is a low-cost shoe repairman. They have a 10-year-old daughter and live in an urban zone in El Guasmo, Guayaquil. She started the business to help meet family expenses and provide for her daughter’s wellbeing. She learned how to cut, color and style hair. She also learned how to do manicures and pedicures. She works alone from very early until nightfall. She will use the loan to buy work tools like chairs and hair straightening irons. In the future she’d like to open a professional beauty salon since she is studying to deepen her skills.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For chairs and a hair straightening iron.

loans.name: Benita Celestina

texts.es: Benita es de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y dos varones actualmente es tejedora de fajas de sedalina, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia, solicita su tercer crédito para capital de trabajo, después del análisis correspondiente de la inversión podemos determinar que es rentable, y con la ayuda de su esposo podrá pagar el préstamo sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Benita is 49 years old, married and has a son. She currently works weaving fine sashes made of silk and cotton, which she has been doing for more than 15 years. She is requesting her third loan for working capital, and after an analysis of the investment we can determine that it is a profitable one. With the help of her husband she will be able to repay the loan without any inconvenience.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her weaving busines

loans.name: Acevedo Haroldo

texts.es: Haroldo tiene 39 años, el se dedica a la venta de Ropa, hace mas de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene 1 hijos de 10 años, el inicio como vender ambulante, con el paso del tiempo fue que logro tener su propio. Pues siempre ha luchado por mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su familia. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues será para la compra de materia prima. Este es el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. El sueño de este hombre es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Haroldo, 39, has been a clothing merchant for over 21 years. He has a 10-year-old son. He started out as an itinerant merchant but in time managed to acquire his own locale. He has always striven to improve his wife and family’s quality of life. This isn’t his first loan and it will be used to acquire raw materials. He will buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits. This man’s dream is to improve his home and enlarge his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Villa Universitaria Group

texts.es:
El Comité Villa Universitaria de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones se dedican al comercio, venta de ropas, comidas, empleadas domésticas, almaceneras y otros.
Se encuentran actualmente en el 12° ciclo, permaneciendo en el grupo se han beneficiado con el crédito, la consulta oftalmológica y las capacitaciones de la institución.  
Se encuentran motivadas y desean seguir trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y gozar de los beneficios que ofrece el programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ana que tiene un despensa donde ofrece productos de la uso domestico especialmente para la alimentación y para limpieza.
Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y que va muy bien con su negocio, además de su negocio ella también cuenta para la alimentación de la familia con cría de animales y producción de verduras y frutas.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como fideos, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, panificados, jabones y otros.
texts.en:
The “Villa Universitaria” (University Village) committee of the city of San Ignacio Misiones is dedicated to commerce: to the sale of clothing and food, to being domestic employees, storekeepers and others. They are currently in their 12th cycle. By staying in the group they have benefitted from credit, eye clinic consults and training workshops provided by the Institution. They are motivated and want to continue collaborating with Fundación Paraguaya enjoying all the benefits that the program offers. One of the members is Ana who has a grocery store where she stocks home use items, especially food and cleaning supplies.She comments that she has many customers and she does well with her business. In addition to her store she also raises small farm animals and grows fruits and vegetables for her family’s nutritional needs. She is asking for funding to buy stock items for her store like: pasta, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, baked goods, soaps and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, sugar, cooking oil, rice, baked goods, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: María es D. 58 años D. edad, soltera, actualmente se dedica a prestar el servicio D. Molino D. Nixtamal, tiene ya más D. 5 años D. experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para Remodelación D. vivienda, efectivamente este financiamiento no  es rentable, pero si tienD. a satisfacer las necesidades D. la solicitante, el préstamo anterior lo pago sin ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
María, 58, is single. She provides corn milling services. She has over 5 years experience. She is asking for her 2nd loan to remodel her home. Even though this loan isn’t profit making it does satisfy the applicant’s needs. She repaid her previous loan effortlessly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home remodel.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José María es un padre de familia de  42  años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el anexo El Trapiche del caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de granos y menestras. El adquiere estos productos a los agricultores de la zona en donde vive para venderlo en los diversos mercados de la región al por mayor y al menudeo. El negocio cuanta con mucha acogida debido a que este producto es bastante consumido en la región por lo que la demanda siempre está asegurada, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el sostiene la economía se su familia.

José María necesita de capital para ampliar su negocio, actualmente la producción de menestras en la zona ha aumentado ya que es temporada de cosecha y el espera adquirir la mayor cantidad posible para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

José María es un padre responsable y bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder asegurarle a su familia un futuro estable y tranquilo. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
José María is a 42-year-old head of household who lives with his family in Tranca Sasape’s El Trapiche annex, a rural zone of Mórrope district, belonging to Lambayeque province located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He is a grains and vegetables merchant. He acquires these products from area farmers to sell in various regional markets at wholesale and retail. His business is very well received because the products are consumed widely in the region so demand is assured. Income from this activity supports his family. José María needs capital to expand his business. Currently, vegetable production in the area has increased because it’s harvest time and he hopes to acquire the largest amount possible in order to increase sales and profits. To reach this goal he has deemed in advisable to request his first,1800 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. José María is a responsible father who is quite dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman to insure his family a stable and peaceful future. His neighbors and acquaintances in his area consider him to be a tranquil and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Corina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Corina es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene la edad de 57 años, casada, con cuatro hijos.
Desde hace varios años logro tener su propio negocio, venta de comida en donde vende en su casa. Lo que no ha logrado es la construcción propia del negocio.
Su esposo es de condición humilde pues trabaja como obrero pero ambos se han esforzado para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Hoy en día necesita dar un jiro a su pequeña comideria, el menú le es variado y ha logrado la captación de clientes.
Para ella es de necesidad invertir en las mejoras de su negocio es por eso con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción  para entechar el local y poner piso.
Para esto comprara: laminas de zinc, perlinez, piso. Lo que permitirá un mejor ambiente, mejor higiene. Y esperando lograr mejores ventas que superen el objetivo. Para un bien común.
texts.en:
Corina is a very hard-working woman of 57 years, married, with four children. She has had her own food-selling business for several years, which she manages from within her own house. However, she has not been able to build a proper site in which to house the business. Corina’s husband works as a labourer and is of modest means, but both have worked hard to improve the standard of their family’s living. Corina has given her small eatery a new approach by varying the menu, therefore attracting more clientele. She needs to invest in improving her business and therefore will use the loan to buy building materials from which to construct the roof and lay the foundations. Corina plans to buy zinc roofing panels, purlins (roof joints), and flooring, which will improve surroundings and hygiene. Corina hopes to achieve greater sales, which exceed her expectations, in order to benefit everybody.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan will go towards buying building materials and therefore give the small business a boost in improving its overall infrastructure.

loans.name: Aurelia Ceferina

texts.es: Aurelia es de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones y una mujer, es Tejedora, en la actividad tiene más de 5 años de experiencia, solicita su cuarto crédito para compra de un terreno y así satisfacer la necesidad de la solicitante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida personal y la de su familia en general, las referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 45, is married and has two sons and one daughter. She is a weaver and has over 5 years experience in this activity. She is asking for her 4th loan to buy a lot thus fulfilling the applicant’s need to improve her and her family’s life. Her personal references indicate she’s a responsible, hard working person so she should have no difficulty in making the required repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Trabajadoras es de la zona de Santa Rosa Misiones, se dedican al comercio, venta de pollos caseros y otros gracias al crédito han podido aumentar sus ingresos económicos dentro de su propia casa ya que la mayoría de ellas tienen hijos en edad escolar.    
Desean seguir trabajando en comité y crecer cada día mas unidas y en forma responsable para mejorar su calidad e vida y la de su familia.
La señora Marina es una de las integrantes quien es una persona súper activa y trabajadora, ella ya cuenta con la actividad que se refiere a la cría de animales como de cerdo y aves, y actualmente también quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropas, para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de remera, camisa, pantalones y otros.
Ella desea mucho que esta actividad le resulte bien ya que le será muy útil para su familia y agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible el crédito que ellas reciben.
texts.en:
The “Trabajadoras” (Working Women) committee is in Santa Rosa Misiones. They are merchants and sell home-grown chickens and other products. Thanks to financing they have been able to increase their household income since most of them have school aged children. They want to continue to work as a committee and daily grow more closely together and responsibly to improve their own and their families’ quality of life. Marina is one of the group members. She is a super-active, hard working person. She raises pigs and chickens but she also wants to go into clothing sales now. To do so, she is asking for funding to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and others. She very much hopes that this activity will yield good results because it will be very useful for her family. She is grateful to all the people that fund the loan they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, pants, blouses, shirts, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es:
Don José trabaja en construcción, desde joven comenzó a ganarse la vida  trabando como ayudante de albañil en donde aprendió el oficio, hoy en día es su fuente de trabajo.
Con esfuerzo de el y de su esposa han logrado mejores condiciones de vivienda.
Su esposa trabaja de domesticas y ambos se ayudan.
A través del apoyo de Afodenic ha logrado las mejoras de construcción
Siendo de gran beneficio ya que no gasta en mano de obra ya que el mismo hace la obra.
Son nueve ciclos con afodenic, en donde esta contento por la oportunidad del financiamiento. Con el crédito anterior logro la terminación del baño e inodoro.
La obra que hará es un pequeño cuarto para lograr mejor comodidad con su familia.
Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines. Y así comenzar.
texts.en:
José works in construction. As a young man, José trained as a bricklayer and now earns his living from such a profession. Both he and his wife have worked hard to improve their standard of living. José’s wife works in the domestic sphere and both help each other. With the help of Afodenic José has been able to make improvements to his house. José does not have to spend money on labourers to build for him, as he builds the house himself. This is his ninth cycle with Afodenic and José is happy with the opportunity that the loan provides. With the previous loan, he managed to finish building the toilet and bathroom. José needs to complete work on a small bedroom in order to improve living conditions for his family. He will buy: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, roof purlins.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc panelling, purlins, etc., to make improvements to his house and living situation

loans.name: Jeannethe

texts.es: Jeannethe de 44 años, tiene 2 menores de edad a su cargo, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de garaje, tiene mucho tiempo de estar en este negocio por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan con mucha confianza a dejar sus vehículos, ella se encarga de cuidarlos por el tiempo que sus clientes le digan. Ella es una persona responsable que se preocupa por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma por lo que es una mujer muy emprendedora. Este financiamiento es para la mejorar es mejorar la castea en donde se estacionan los autos para dar más seguridad.
texts.en:
Jeannethe is 44 years old and has 2 children in her care. She offers a garage service. She gets a lot of work because the majority of her customers come and leave their vehicles with her with a lot of confidence. She is in charge of looking after them for as long as her customers say. She is a responsible person who is worried about paying her bills on time because she is a very enterprising woman. This loan is for improving and giving more security to the garage where she parks the cars.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical cusqueña, donde tiene su propia casa. A Flora desde siempre le gustó trabajar en colectividad, y desde luego que lo hizo durante su adolescencia, en la cual ayudaba a sus padres a sembrar y cosechar cacao, por el cual afirmaba, que la tarea les hacia demasiado fácil, cuando laboraban juntos. Con esa enseñanza  marcada en su vida, se arriesgó en aperturar una tienda con su querido esposo, en donde siempre le ayudaba durante el día y fruto de mucho empeño y ahínco resultó exitoso, debido al precio y a la buena atención que ofrecía a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de que pueda captar mayor clientela y por ende aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecha con grupo comunal, ya que percibe un buen clima cordial. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, con el propósito de que pueda atender oportunamente a sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Flora is 40 years old, married, and has four children of school-age. The family lives in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful tropical Cuscan rainforest, where they have their own home. Flora has always liked to work in a group. When she was a teenager, she helped her parents to plant and harvest cacao, and recalls that the job was much easier when everybody worked together. With this philosophy in mind, Flora took a risk and opened a shop with her beloved husband. Together, as a result of much hard work and enthusiasm, the shop became a success due to the reasonable prices and good customer service afforded. Flora plans to expand the grocery shop with the aim of attracting more customers and therefore increase earnings. This is Flora’s second loan with MFP, and she promises to comply with the repayment plan, and is happy with this lending group, as it ensures a pleasant business environment. Flora will use the loan to purchase essential merchandise in order to meet the needs of her more demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the shop with essential merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Juan Marcelino Ríos se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador ya que atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos y agua.Su núcleo familiar se compone de 5 personas 4 hijos y su esposa, los hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la misma localidad, su esposa trabaja en Managua y  con su salario apoya  los gastos del hogar. Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para la compra de las bebidas gaseosas, jugos y agua así como la compra de pollo y carne para ofrecerla de igual manera y así generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
This client originally hails from Caserío el Paraíso, Mina el Limón road, next to Caserío Minvah. He currently works in the commercial sector, selling fizzy drinks, fried food, etc. He is married with 4 children. His children are studying at the local college. His wife works in Managua and with her salary they are able to pay the household bills. This client has managed to obtain 4 loans, which have enabled him to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase: Pepsi in different containers, bottles, cans, etc., beef, chicken, pork, cooking oil, vegetables, rice and beans

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica de 24 años, tiene un pequeño restaurante, hace comidas típicas como seco de chivo, pollo y carne. Es madre soltera con dos hijos, ellos vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Perimetral”.

Comenzó haciendo encebollados (plato típico que contiene pescado-cebolla) los vendía solo los fines de semana con ayuda de su mama, poco a poco invirtió dinero para comprar una cocina, por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene un pequeño restaurante hace almuerzos, trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, legumbres para su pequeño restaurante. En el futuro quiere tener un local mas grande y que su restaurante sea conocido.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old. She has a little restaurant where she makes typical foods such as goat stew, chicken stew, and beef stew. She is a single mother with two children. They live on the outskirts of the city along the Perimetral. She began by making fish and onion stew, a typical dish, and sold it on the weekends with the help of her mother. Little by little she invested money to buy a kitchen stove. From this good decision, she now has a little restaurant where she serves meals. She works every day from 4 pm to 10 pm. With the loan, she wants to buy provisions such as rice and vegetables for her little restaurant. In the future she wants to have a bigger place and to have her restaurant be well known.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio hace once años con una pulpería que gracias a su empeño de trabajo y financiamiento de la institución ha logrado el crecimiento en su inventario.
No ha sido fácil hay día que se vende poco. Pero como vende una variedad de productos se ayuda.
Ha contado con el apoyo de su esposo desde el inicio, y junto han logrado mejorar su vivienda.  Así  como el apoyo financiero que ha dado Afodenic ya que lleva once créditos en donde ha logrado aumentar sus ventas, el equilibrio, y mejoras de vivienda.
Con este préstamo lograra la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás.
Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hiero, estribos, y comenzar la obra. Mejorando el resguardo de su negocio y el de  su familia.
texts.en:
Aracely is a small shopkeeper who set up her convenience store 11 years ago. Thanks to her work ethic and financing, she has managed to increase her stock. This has not been easy and there are days when Aracely sells little, but the variety in her stock helps business. Aracely has had the support of her husband since setting up her shop and together they have improved their standard of living. Their living situation has also been improved by the financial assistance provided by Afodenic, as Aracely has received 11 loans which have helped her increase her sales and improve her standard of living. This loan will permit Aracely to build a wall at the back of the shop and to purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, metal framework, and begin construction. All this will benefit the shop and Aracely’s family.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make structural improvements to her business and living conditions by building a wall at the back of her shop.

loans.name: Edwin Roberto

texts.es: Edwin es de 33 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo varón y una mujer, es jefe de cobranza de créditos, en la actividad tiene 1.5 años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para acabados de vivienda, con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades del solicitante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida personal y la de su familia en general, las referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable, por lo que nuevamente se confiara que podrá efectuar los pagos sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Edwin is 33 years old, married and has a son and a daughter. He is in charge of collecting loans and has been doing it for the past year and a half. He is requesting his second loan to finish his house. He wants to fulfill his obligations as an applicant and improve his living conditions for himself and his family in general. His personal references say that he is a responsible person and they are confident that he will be able to make his payments again without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish his house

loans.name: Carmen Isolda

texts.es: La Señora Carmen Isolda se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y cosa de horno en sus 24 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente, el negocio fue heredado por su Mama desde hace 13 años, ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes faldas y otro tipo de vestimenta. Sueña con tener su propio establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
In her 24 years, Carmen Isolda has sold used clothing and pastries. She has always known how to work and support herself independently. She inherited the business from her Mother 13 years ago. With a lot of care and sacrifice she has managed to get ahead, because her mother had taught her to support herself in a humble manner. She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, women's suits, and other types of garments. She dreams of having her own establishment in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy clothing

loans.name: Emilina Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Emilina es madre de tres hijos, casada, y muy trabajadora, tiene dos trabajos. Logrando así poder ayudar económicamente a su esposo, trabaja como niñera de día y de noche vende fritanga, lo que con ahorros ha venido invirtiendo para el bienestar de sus hijos.
Lo que desea lograr hacer es un muro para mejorar las condiciones de su casa para un mejor común.
Como planes es seguir mejorando su vivienda cada vez que logre el financiamiento en Afodenic ya que es de gran beneficio, por sus plazos mediante el cual los hace mensual equilibrando así sus gastos.
texts.en:
Doña Emilina is married and the mother of three children. She is a hard worker who has two jobs so that she can help her husband with the finances. Emilina works as a nanny during the day and sells fried foods at night. Using her savings, she is able to invest in the welfare of her children.

Emilina wants to put up a wall in order to improve the conditions of her home and contribute to a better community. She plans to continue making improvements to her home every time she is able to secure a loan from AFODENIC. The loans have been a great benefit because the terms help balance her monthly expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a security wall

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia, de 38 años de edad, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen una hija, Ariana de cuatro años. Viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa. Florencia se caracteriza por ser una persona creativa, ya que eso fue clave para que su tienda tome mucha presencia en su barrio, en donde expende variedad de productos y a un precio cómodo al alcance de la economía de sus clientes. Es por ello que se siente contenta por lo que hace, además cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja. Su punto de venta está localizado en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad, no obstante, en adelante ella piensa ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de que pueda implementar con un nuevo formato de vanguardia, para que de esa manera pueda buscar diferencia ante sus demás competencia y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura en cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, debido al  buen clima cordial que predomina en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería para que de esa manera pueda abastecer  su tienda con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Florencia is 38 years old and lives with her husband. Together they have a four year old daughter named Ariana. They have their own home in the town of Quimbiri which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Florencia is known for being a creative person, which helped her establish a store that has developed a great presence in her neighborhood. There she sells a variety of products at affordable prices within the reach of her customers. She is very happy with what she does and also has the help of her husband. Her store is located in the same neighborhood where her house is located. However, she wants to move forward by expanding her grocery store so that she can implement a new layout that will separate her from the competition, help increase her revenues, and improve her quality of life.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is sure that she can faithfully complete her payments. Florencia is happy with her Communal Bank since her group promotes a friendly atmosphere. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise so that she can restock her store and fulfill the needs of her most demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa de Jesús Martínez E. de 68 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y prendas, así como accesorios personales para lucir en nuestra vida diaria. Ella desde muy joven se dedicaba a ésta actividad, pues la madrastra de su esposo le dejaba a ella la mercadería que traía de Panamá para que la ofreciera al crédito (2 pagos solamente) y así cobrará los créditos otorgados.

Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de mercadería nueva e invertir más en prendas de oro y plata. Su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener siempre las fortalezas para trabajar y seguir adelante
texts.en:
Teresa is 68 years old and makes a living selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, jewelry and other personal accessories to enhance our appearances in our daily lives. Since a very young age she has made a living in this activity, and her husband's stepmother left her merchandise that she brought from Panama so that she could be offered a loan and cover the expenses. Teresa plans to use the loan to purchase new merchandise and invest in more gold and silver jewelry. Her goal is to increase her working capital and to always have the fortitude to work and keep making headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Manuela Modesta

texts.es: Manuela es de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y dos mujeres, es tejedora, en la actividad tiene más de 5 años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para remodelación de vivienda, efectivamente este financiamiento no es rentable, pero si tiende a satisfacer la necesidad de la solicitante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El préstamo anterior lo pago sin problemas de atraso.
texts.en:
Manuela is 46 years old, married and has a son and two daughters. She is a weaver and has more than five years of experience in the trade. She is requesting her second loan to remodel her home. Effectively, the loan isn't a profitable one, but it will satisfy Manuela's needs and improve her quality of life. She paid her previous loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel home

loans.name: Bella Beatriz

texts.es:
Bella de 21 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en una zona periurbana llamada “Perimetral”, su esposo le ayuda en la tienda, ellos tiene una hija. 

Iniciaron el negocio para obtener dinero y poder mantener a su familia, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación de Bella y su esposo pudieron surtir mas su tienda. Venden todo tipo de legumbres y víveres. Trabajan desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer, uno de los sueño de ellos es que quieren que su tienda sea muy conocida. 

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceite, lácteos. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Bella is 21 years old and has a small store in Perimetral in the city's surround area. Her husband helps her with the store, and they have a daughter. They started the business to earn money to provide for their family, and little by little with Bella and her husband's hard work and dedication they were able to better stock their store. They sell all kinds of foods and vegetables. They work from very early until dusk. One of their dreams is for their store to become better known. With the loan, Bella wants to purchase rice, oil and dairy products to better stock the store. In the future, she wants to purchase a car so she'll be able to transport her supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil and dairy products

loans.name: Lilliam Johana

texts.es:
Lilliam Johana T. C. es una mujer joven de 28 que apenas hace 3 años inició su pulpería en su casa de habitación, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de productos AVON sin embargo decidió vender algunos rubros en su casa como chiverías, gaseosas y golosinas. Hoy esa pequeña venta que inició como un experimento ahora es una pulpería pequeña pero surtida.

Lilliam recibe ayuda de su mamá en cuanto a la atención del negocio puesto que tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años que necesitan aún mucho cuidado y atención. Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos preparados y tener una tienda de ropa. Seguir luchando es su objetivo diario.
texts.en:
Lilliam is 28 years old, and with hard work she started a convenience store in her home three years ago. Previously she made a living selling Avon products, however she decided to start selling some items, such as soft drinks and snacks, out of her home. It started out as an experiment, but now it's a small but well-stocked store. Lilliam's mother helps her with the business because Lilliam has two children ages 5 and 3 who need a lot of care and attention. Her dream is to be able to see her children be successful and to have a clothing store. Her daily objective is to keep fighting.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: La señora Ana Cristina, tiene 42 años ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas de 13 y 18 años de edad. Ana tiene un negocio de venta de sopa y comida, los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación, esto es todos los días además que los fines de semana también elabora nacatamales y comida rápida por las noches. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, empezó este negocio con recursos propios buscando como tener un ingreso económico para brindar manutención a sus hijas, cabe señalarse el negocio lo heredo de su mama quien le enseño a trabajar desde pequeña. Ella solicita este préstamo con el propósito de invertir en el negocio para que tenga un mayor crecimiento y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. El sueño de su familia es ampliar más el negocio y comprar más material para el negocio y obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has two daughters, ages 13 and 18. Ana has a business selling soup and food, which she distributes out of her home. She does this every day, and on the weekends she also makes tamales and other fast food in the evenings. She started her business about five years ago with her own resources, looking to earn an income to provide for her daughters. She was shown how to run the business by her mother, who taught her how to work from a young age. She is requesting the loan with the plan to invest in the business so that it has more growth and in this way she can increase her profits. Ana's goal is to expand the business and purchase more ingredients for it so she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Medoune

texts.fr: Monsieur Medoune F.  habite a Dalifort. Il est marié et âgé de 54 ans. C’est un assureur de profession  qui dispose dune maison personnelle qu’elle veut valoriser et mettre en location. La construction du premier niveau de la maison est  en phase de finition d’où il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs .Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 06 ans. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus mensuels et de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Medoune F. lives in Dalifort. He is 54 years old and married. He is a professional insurer who owns a personal home he wishes to improve and lease. The first floor of the house is in the finishing phase of construction which is why he is seeking a loan of 400,000 francs. He has been a member of the Dalifort bank for 6 years. This loan will enable to increase his monthly revenues and better manage the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction: finishing detail

loans.name: Wiliam Fernando

texts.es:
El señor William es un hombre trabajador, padre de dos hijos los cuales estudian.
Su trabajo es de conductor que lleva varios años laborando, no gana tan bien, pero se ajusta a la canasta básica y con un salario fijo, que le permite cubrir las necesidades. 
A través del apoyo de Afodenic ha venido haciendo las mejoras a su casa lleva siete ciclos en donde ha mejorado paredes de concretos, divisiones de cuarto, piso en su sala y ahora que desea levantar un pequeño muro en frente ya que tiene con latas y desea hacer la mejora para una seguridad mejor y mejor higiene.
Comprara los materiales a necesitar como: piedra, arena, cemento. Hierro para iniciar la obra.
texts.en:
Sr. William is a hardworking gentleman and the father of two children who are in school. He has worked as a driver for several years and does not earn very much on his fixed salary, so he makes whatever adjustments are necessary in order to meet his daily needs.

With the support of AFODENIC, he has been able to make improvements to his home through seven loan cycles. William has been able to put up concrete walls, install room dividers, and lay down a floor in his living room. Now he wants to build a small wall in front of his home to replace the sheets of tin that line his property. He wants to make this improvement in order to provide safer and cleaner conditions.

The loan will be used to buy the necessary materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron so that the work can begin.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a security wall in front of his house

loans.name: Auria

texts.es: La Sra. G. R. Auria, vive en el caserio Santa Petronila perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Trabaja como obrera de campo en parcelas de la zona de santa petronila desde hace 2 años . Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Su sueño según nos comenta es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para poder brindarle asu familia una mejor calidad de vida. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados su vivienda. La Sra. G. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
G. R. Auria lives in the Santa Petronila housing area; part of the Santiago district. She has four children that she cares for and has been working for two years as a field hand on parcels within the Santa Petronila zone. She has her own home on which she is placing the finishing touches. She tells us that her dream is to be able to complete her house so that she can give a better quality of life to her family. She is asking for this loan so that she can put the finishing touches on her house. G. is grateful for the support that we are able to give her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette is 26 years old and single.  She cares for her two brothers, which she says can be a financial challenge.  She has been selling fabrics in the local market for the past three years.  The quality of her fabrics is good and she carries attractive styles, both of which contribute to the popularity of her business.  With this loan, Jeanette plans to buy a sewing machine.  She can use this machine to sew clothing items for her customers from the fabrics she carries.  Her goal is to expand her business to four times its current size.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 34 years old, married, and has three children between 5 and 13 years old.  All of her children go to school.  Her husband is a salesman for Inyange, a company that makes its own products and distributes them across the country.  

Jacqueline sells a variety of things, including clothes, fabrics, sunflower oil, and tea leaves.  She believes the success of her business comes from her good customer care and low prices. Her clients also appreciate the products she sells.  With the loan, Jacqueline plans to increase her inventory.  Eventually, she hopes to start a business selling only food crops, such as beans and sorghum.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Damaris Margarita

texts.es:
Damaris es una mujer emprendedora, muy dedicada al trabajo desde joven, 
Siendo su negocio una pulpería que administra desde hace varios años. Hoy su fuente de entradas en donde cubre sus gastos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su excompañero. Y ha logrado trabajar para poder dar un techo digno como sus estudios a sus hijos.
Procreo tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella, ya que los otros ya trabajan.
En su negocio vende una variedad de producto, que ha logrado invertir con financiamiento que Afodenic  ha dado logrando mejores ventas y más productos accesibles a sus clientes.
Hoy en día tiene poco mercadería lo que con este financiamiento podrá comprar granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, carne, pollo, lácteos, productos escolares entre otros para lograr vender mas.
texts.en:
Damaris is an enterprising woman who has been dedicated to her work from a young age. She has managed a store for several years. Today it provides the income she needs to cover her expenses since she does not receive any support from her ex-husband. Her work has enabled her to provide her children with a decent home as well as an education. She has three children, but only one is still a dependent since the others are already working.

Damaris sells a variety of products through her business. She has invested the loans from AFODENIC to achieve better sales and make more products available to her customers.
