At the moment she has very little merchandise, so she will use this loan to buy basic grains, candies, sodas, meat, chicken, dairy products, school supplies, and other products so that she can generate more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candies, sodas, meat, chicken, dairy products, school supplies, and other products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 43 años de edad, está casada y tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Recuerda que para llegar a lo que tiene ahora le costó mucho sacrificio y el saber aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentaba, ya que desde muy joven anhelaba tener su propia tienda, y lo logró, pero su adaptación no fue tan rápido, ya que obtenía pocas ventas, debido a que no tenía experiencia en la buena atención a sus clientes. Hoy con la experiencia que tiene, se siente más en confianza, incluso sus clientes están más que satisfechos por el producto que los ofrece y de la buena atención que los brinda hacia ellos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, y su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda con el propósito de que pueda mantener a sus clientes más antiguos, de esa manera pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme  con su banco comunal, ya que le brinda muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, con el propósito de suministrar su tienda.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 43, is married and has three school age children. They live together in Quimbiri, which is located in the edge of the Peruvian jungle. That is where she has her own house, which is made of wood. She recalls that it cost her a lot of sacrifice and knowing how to take advantage of the opportunities that presented themselves in order to get where she is today. Ever since she was very young she longed to have her own store, and she got it. But, her adjustment was not so fast. She had few sales because she did not have experience in giving her customers good service. Now, with the experience she has, she feels more confident. Even her customers are more satisfied with the products she sells and the good service that she gives them. She generally works on her own, but during vacation times she gets help from her children. She sells in her own neighborhood. Her future plan is to expand her business so that she can keep her oldest customers. That way she will be able to improve her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP. She promises to continue making her payments on time. Also, she gets along well with her communal bank because it provides many benefits. She will use the requested loan to buy basic needs merchandise in order to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with basic needs products

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 32 years old and married with a one-year-old child.  His wife is a primary school teacher.

Laurent sells beans, Irish potatoes, plantains, peanut flour and onions in the local marketplace.  He has been selling these items for the past 5 years and believes the popularity of his business is due to his good customer care.  With the loan he plans to increase his inventory of foodstuffs.  His goal is to double his sales over the next year.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of foodstuffs

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is 33 years old and a mother of four children aged 3 to 12. All of them are in school.  Her husband is in the transport business.  

Clemence has a wholesale shop where she sells Irish potatoes.  She has had this business for the past two years.  With the loan she plans to invest in her business by expanding her inventory of potatoes.   Her goal is to expand her business to four times its current size.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of potatoes

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 35 years old and a mother of two children aged 11 and 13.  Both of her children are in school. Her husband is a soldier. 

Mediatrice currently sells sand that is used for construction in the local area. However, she is changing her business.  With the loan, she plans to buy new children’s clothes to sell.  People know her as an honest saleswoman, and trust her and the products she sells.  If she earns enough from the business, she will buy a goat.  If she does not earn much, she will buy a chicken to add to the four chickens she already owns.  She eventually wants to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 54 years old, a widow and has eight children who range in age from 13 to 35 years old. Five of her children are in school, one chose not to attend school, one works as a driver, and one is living abroad. Judith makes a living selling maize, millet, soy, sosoma (a mix of maize, soy, and millet), and peanut flour in a local market. She has been in this line of work for the last 11 years. She takes pride in selling flour that is clean and claims that many mothers buy her products to make porridge for their children. The recent growing season has been good, so she plans to use her loan to buy extra flour to sell to her customers. Her goal is to double the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour to sell to her customers

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es: Santos Margarita es de 53 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos varones y una mujer, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, en la actividad tiene 3 años de experiencia, solicita su tercer préstamo para compra de cortes típicos y delantales, así poder ampliar su negocio, surtir sus ventas y poder competir en el mercado, los prestamos anteriores los pago sin problemas de atraso.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita is 53 years old. She is single and has two adult sons and one daughter. She sells typical clothing and has three years experience. She is asking for her third loan so that she can buy typical cuts of clothing and aprons, allowing her to expand her business, vary her sales, and be able to compete in the marketplace. She repaid her previous loans without falling behind.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Saphina

texts.en: Saphina is 24 years old and has one child, who is seven months old. She is married to a businessman and makes a living by working with him to sell potatoes. She is applying for this loan to increase her income by buying more potatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 40 years old and has three children who are between three and 16 years old. Her two older children are in school. Marie Grace is a widow who works hard to support her family by selling food and drinks, including soda and juice. She has been in this line of work for the last eight years. She believes that her success is due to providing good service to her customers, and is very careful to sell high-quality sweet potatoes, bananas and beans. She hopes to double her earnings by the end of the year because this will allow her family to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 35 years old and married to a tailor. She has four children who range in age from six to 13 years old. All of her children attend school. Violette makes a living by selling a variety of products, including sunflower oil, dried fish and cloth. She has been in this line of work for 14 years, and regularly travels to Burundi to buy the products that she sells in her town's local market. Her shop is popular, in part because she holds an annual sale where she provides goods to her clients for a discount. Violette has applied for a loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. Eventually, she hopes to open a wholesale business where she will sell various types of fabric, and use her increased income to buy her own piece of land.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Astherie

texts.en: Astherie is 50 years old and a widow with four children whose ages range from two to 13. All are in school. For the last 16 years, Astherie has made a living by renting out bridal outfits. She is applying for this loan in order to buy more bridal outfits to rent from her store, which is well known locally  because it has been in operation for so long.

loans.use: To buy more bridal outfits to rent out to her customers

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine, a 32-year-old mother of a five-year-old child who is in school, recently changed businesses after selling secondhand shoes for seven years in the local market to selling general household items and food products.  Ernestine believes that the good customer service she provides enables her to attract more clients, and she believes her good reputation will follow her into her new business.  Her goal is to double the size of her business, and with the profits, she  hopes to open a butcher shop eventually.

loans.use: Increasing her inventory of food and household goods

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 31 years old and she is a single mother of five children. Among her children, she adopted three, and they are all in school.

She has a shop in which she sells non-alcoholic drinks, including milk, soda, and juice. In addition, she sells bakery products. She has done this business for five years. 

Prossy is requesting a loan in order to enlarge her business by buying more food products to fill her shop. She hopes to enlarge her business to the extent that she makes it a supermarket.

loans.use: Buying more products to fill her store

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 40 years old and married to a hairstylist. She has two children who are 11 and 16 years old, and she says that it’s a challenge paying for their school fees.

Olive sells food products on two market days at different locations. She sells onions on Tuesdays and sells pineapples on Fridays in a different market. She has done this business for 14 years and her business is well-known because there are only two people who supply pineapples at her market.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying more onions and pineapples

loans.name: Belida Irene

texts.es: Belida es de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene cuatro hijos varones, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de arena de rio para construcción, en la actividad tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, con la ayuda de sus familiares han superado el negocio, solicita su primer crédito para capital de trabajo, compra de arena de rio el cual es una inversión rentable. Sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, con la ayuda de su familia pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Belinda is 37 years old, is single, and has four sons. She sells river sand used for construction and has been doing this for more than 10 years. Her business has been successful thanks to the help from her family. She is asking for her first loan, which will provide her with working capital to buy river sand. This is a profitable investment. Her personal references indicate that she is a hard working and responsible person. She will repay this loan with her family’s help.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 40 years old and her husband is construction worker. She has five children, who are 1, 6, 8, 12 and 14 years old. All her children are in school apart from the youngest. 

Delphine is a tailor and she is asking for a loan to buy fabrics in order to enlarge her business. Her business is well-known because she always has the newest fabrics in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Buying fabrics

loans.name: Margueriitte

texts.en:
Margueriitte is 44 years old, divorced, and a mother of five children. Her children range from 13 to 27 years old and all are in school.
         
Margueriitte sells bananas, Irish potatoes, beans and other vegetables in the local market. She claims that she sells items that are in high demand for her local area.  

With the loan, she plans to buy more food products to boost her sales. She believes that in the next year, she will be able to buy six cows to add to the ones she has. She eventually wants to have a cattle business.

loans.use: Buying more food products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and single. She has a shop where she sells sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and beans. She believes the success of her business comes from her good customer care. Also, she keeps her shop open for many hours so she can sell to clients throughout most of the day.  

With this loan, Mary will increase her inventory of the items she sells. She currently sells five sacks of rice per week and hopes to increase this to 20 sacks per week within a year’s time. She also hopes to increase the sales of her other products significantly.

loans.use: Buying home items such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Elda Mayda

texts.es: Elda es de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones y cuatro mujeres, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, en la actividad tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para capital de trabajo, compra de aguas gaseosas el cual es una inversión rentable, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, por tal motivo no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Elda is 39 years old, married, and she has two sons and four daughters. She sells grocery store items of daily use and she has 10 years' experience in this business. She requests a first time loan to supplement her working capital and with it she will purchase soft drinks, the investment that is the most profitable. Her personal references illustrate that she is a responsible, hard working person, which is why she will not have any troubles repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Aidee Maria

texts.es:
Aidee de 40 años, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive en una zona periurbana con sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder mantener a su hijo, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aidee is 40 years old, and she sells Yambal brand products (a company that engages entrepreneurial women to make their own private sales). She lives in a suburban region with her two children. She is a single mother. She works to be able to support her chidlren. She starts from very early in the morning, selling her products to her neighbors and her friends. She sells perfumes, skin creams, deodorants, etc. This loan will be invested in the purchase of Yambal brand products such as perfumes, skin creams, deodorants etc. In the future she hopes to finish building her house and she wishes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and skin creams.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is married with a grown son. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye, where she sells footwear and clothing merchandise in one of the local markets. Moreover, Lidiya owns a second vending pavilion in the same neighborhood. She can be characterized as a determined and hard-working entrepreneur with a vision for consistent growth of her business. Lidiya has been in the trade for 13 years. Currently, she has invested 25,000 Grivnyas in this business. Her gross income is about 13,000 Grivnyas. 

Lidiya is requesting a loan of 6,900 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise for her vending locations. She loves her job and is hoping to grow both professionally and economically.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 22 años de edad, convive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, Jhon  de tres años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. La actividad que realiza es la de producir y comercializar cacao y café, negocio que le ha permitido con el tiempo subir sus ingresos. Por tal motivo planea ampliar su siembra con la necesidad de que pueda maximizar su producción y por ende sus ganancias. Normalmente trabaja con su pareja, ambos procuran darle un buen cuidado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café, pero en temporada de cosecha, necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que de esa manera le puedan facilitar en la recolección y selección de sus productos agrícolas. Usualmente su producto de cacao y café los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad, en la cual ofrece a un precio competitivo. Su plan a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con la necesidad de que lo pueda dar seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete pagar de manera oportuna durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente bien con su grupo comunal, ya que le brinda seguridad y confianza. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono,  con la finalidad de que realice un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 22, lives with her life partner and her three year old son, Jhon. They live together in Quimbiri, which is located in the Peruvian tropical jungle. They have their own house, which is made from wood. She produces and sells cacao and coffee. The business has allowed her, in time, to increase her income. For that reason she plans to increase her planting in order to be able to maximize her production and her earnings. She normally works with her partner. They both take good care of their cacao and coffee crops. But, during harvest time they need the help of workers to facilitate the harvest and sorting of their crops. She usually sells her cacao and coffee production for a competitive price at the wholesale centers in her community. Her plan for the future is to build her house from sturdy material. She needs for her family to be safe and comfortable. This is her second loan with MFP. She promises to make her payments on time. She gets along well with her communal bank. It offers security and trust. She will use the requested loan to buy fertilizer in order to provide adequate maintenance on her cacao and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to take care of her cacao and coffee crops

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a retail businessman from Zaporozhye. He sells dishware in one of the local marketplaces. He has been in this business for five months. However, he has already gained a loyal clientele. Andrei offers competitive prices. Presently, he has 90,000 invested in this venture. His turnover capital is about 19,000 Grivnyas.  

Andrei is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for his vending kiosk. The trade is prosperous as dishware is a marketable type of product and always sells well. Andrei is full of ideas for development and further expansion of his enterprise. The current loan will assist him in his endeavors and implementation of his business plans.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es: Catarina es de 53 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones y seis mujeres, es comerciante  se dedica a la venta de fajas, servilletas y sabanas típicas, en la actividad tiene 8 años de experiencia, solicita su quinto crédito para compra y venta de mercadería típica, y así poder ampliar su capital de negocios, los prestamos anteriores los pago sin dificultad de atraso.
texts.en:
Catarina is 53 years old, married, and she has two sons and six daughters. She sells table cloths, napkins, and traditional bed linen, and she has 8 years' experience in the field. She requests her fifth loan to continue buying and selling traditional merchandise. She will supplement her working capital. Her past loans have always been paid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es: Rosa es de 34 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y una mujer, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de cortes y blusas típicas, en la actividad tiene 3 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para capital de trabajo, las referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, por tal motivo no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old, married, and she has a son and a daughter. She sells clothing and traditional blouses, a business where she has earned 3 years' experience. She requests a first time loan to supplement her working capital. Her personal references illustrate that she is a responsible and hard working person, which is why she is not expected to have difficulties with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is proud to be able to care for children and support families in her Oakland neighborhood through her in-home childcare center.  “This is something I have wanted to do since I was a little girl. I was raised in an in-home daycare!”
 
Before opening her business, Jessica studied early childhood education at a local college and earned her teaching credential while working at a large preschool. Although she appreciates the experience she gained at the preschool, she didn’t always agree with the way programs were run. By opening her own business, she is able to run her center according to her own childcare philosophy.
 
Jessica heard about Opportunity Fund through a friend, but admits, “It took me a couple months before I even called. I thought they’d never give me a loan because I didn’t have any credit.”
 
With the help of two interns, Jessica currently cares for eight children, although at full capacity she could care for 14. Enrollment has dropped due to the recession, but she is working hard to attract new clients through word-of-mouth references and by improving her facilities.
 
With a $5,000 loan, her third with Opportunity Fund, Jessica will transform her run-down yard into an outdoor play space complete with a protective fence, large lawn, and a vegetable garden where the kids can begin to learn about good nutrition.

loans.use: To pay for landscaping an outdoor play area

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nueva Esperanza es de la zona de Santa Rosa Misiones, se dedican a la venta de comidas típicas, almacenes, viveros y otros.
Las mujeres de este comité organizan ferias periódicas para su fondo común que le pueda ayudar con las mensualidades de sus cuotas.
Agradecen a la Fundación el apoyo constante a través de las capacitaciones ya que les han ayudado para mantenerse unidas y trabajando.     
El objetivo de todas  es que se desarrollen en sus actividades diarias y sigan trabajando en comité y participar de los beneficios que ofrece el programa comité de mujeres.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rosa quien se dedica a la venta de negocio de ventas de productos de usos domésticos y de esa forma ayuda a su familia.
La administración de su almacén la dirige ella misma y comenta que las capacitaciones que recibe de las asesoras de las asesoras con relación a la administración de recurso le ha facilitado mucho para tomar algunas decisiones e invertir mejor la economía  de su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta con su negocio y desea comprar algunas mercaderías como harina, aceite, jabones, enlatados, gaseosa, dulces, golosinas, embutidos, lácteos y panificados es para ello que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The group named "New Hope" is located in the Santa Rosa Misiones region. The hold various types of businesses such as selling traditional foods, running grocery stores, running greenhouses and other types of business. The women of this group organize community sales for their common good, and it helps them meet their monthly payments. They are grateful to the organization for the support they receive through loans - it has helped their group and has kept them all working. Every member's objective is to further develop their business and to keep working so that they may always receive the benefits that the group brings them. Rosa is one of the members and he sells grocery store items. This is how she is able to support her family. She is the manager of her store and she says that loans she has received have helped her make some important decisions and it has translated into a better finances for the family. She is very happy with her business and she would like to purchase some items such as flour, cooking oil, soaps, canned foods, soft drinks, candies, snacks, milk products, and breads. For this investment she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, cooking oil, soaps, canned foods, soft drinks, candies, snacks, milk products, and breads.

loans.name: G.s. Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: La señora Manuela, su negocio que es la venta de ropa ambulante ropa nueva y usada, Ella aduce que en su negocio siempre vende diario, y gracias a esto su nivel de vida ha mejorado pero siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. La señora Yesenia del Socorro solicita este préstamo para invertirle a su negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa   cosméticos en general y tortillas y Marcia Rebeca C. es otra integrante del grupo, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de nacatamales y pan, los nacatamales los hace el fin de semana y el pan es vendido diario, generalmente viaja a Managua a distribuirlo.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Pues juntas están buscando la forma de cómo sobrevivir con sus negocios es por eso que realizan este financiamiento con el fin de mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Manuela's business is to sell new and used clothing from door to door. She says that she makes sales on a daily basis and thanks to her business her quality of life has improved. But she is always looking for a way to improve her earnings. Yesenia del Socorro requests a loan to invest in her business. She sells clothing, cosmetics, and tortillas. Marcia Rebeca C. is another member of the group and she sells traditional foods and breads. She makes her traditional foods on the weekends, but she sells breads on a daily basis. She usually travels to Managua to sell. Hes husband is a construction worker. Together they are looking for a way to prosper their businesses. This loan will help to improve their business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Raquel De Fatima

texts.es:
Raquel de 55 años, ella tiene un taller de costura, es madre soltera y vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil).

Inicio con el negocio porque necesitaba solventar los gastos de su familia, comenzó a coser ropa y poco a poco pudo comprar una maquina de coser. Trabaja todos los días hasta que termine todos los pedidos de ropa. Con el préstamo comprar una maquina de coser para tener mas producción de ropa. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y comprar mas maquinas para tener mas producción de ropa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 55 years old. She has a tailoring shop. She is a single mother and she lives in the region of Primavera de duran (a suburban region located farther than Guyaquil). She started her business because she needed to cover the family's expenses. She started making clothes and soon she was able to purchase a sewing machine. She works every day to complete the orders she receives. With the loan she requests she will pruchase a sewing machine to complete her projects faster. In the future she hopes to expand her business and purchase more sewing machines and increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “La Victoria”, están en el Séptimo Ciclo con 14 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. 
Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos, por lo que están muy interesadas en seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
La señora Rosa quien invirtió su crédito en la compra fideos, panificados, lácteos, arroz, aceite, embutidos y otros productos ya que ella tiene un depende donde vende productos de uso domésticos para generar ingreso para su familia.
La despensa lo tiene en su domicilio y sus clientes lo conforman sus vecinos quienes constantemente recurren a su negocio por la buena atención que ella les brinda.
Ella es una mujer luchadora y siempre esta en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades para su familia y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda crediticia.
texts.en:
The group called themselves "The Victory". They are on their seventh loan cycle and they have 14 members in the group. The group is operates in one district because they are very close and united, and they are very responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit and they are always on time with their payments. They plan on completing this cycle with equally as much responsibility. The loan they request will open many doors of opportunity and they will all progress in their business. They continue to be very intested in working with this organization. Rosa invested her loan in the purchase of pastas, breads, milk products, rice, cooking oil, and other products. She has a store where she sells her goods and this is how she earns an income for her family. She has her grocery store in her house and her clients are mostly her neighbors who constantly patronize her business because she always provides good service. She is a hard working person and she is always on the look out for better opportunities for her family. She is very grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pasta, rice, canned foods, breads, etc.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is divorced with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, western Ukraine, selling retail household items in a busy place in the local market that attracts many potential customers. Tetyana has been in this trade for nine years and presently has 50,000 Grivnyas of gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Tetyana is requesting a loan of 16,000 Grivnyas to purchase school-related inventories for sale. Operating her business with integrity and skill, she is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. Additional merchandise, combined with Tetyana’s work ethic and experience, will enable her to expand her business, increase her income and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase school-related inventories

loans.name: Confianza Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Eligio is the coordinator of his group Confianza y Desarrollo (Truth and Development) 1 & 2. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and nine children. He says that his most difficult challenge is to raise and provide everything his family needs. In the meantime he enjoys working in the livestock business.

Eligio has been in business for around seven years, starting with a calf he bought and raised. He is excited to be taking his tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to buy another calf. He will use the profits to invest in other animals such as pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas.

Eligio began his association with Esperanza because "the program came to my community and I was invited to participate." His story is generally representative of those in his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of the latter having recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. His group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The area’s main economic activity involves a free trade zone, a cement factory and others in an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio is 41 years old. He is single and lives with his sister. He makes sportswear clothing and supplies his products to local schools and athletic clubs. Don Lucio started working in this field 10 years ago, first as an employee learning the skills and saving money. Two years ago, Lucio decided to start his own business.

He is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other materials. He has a successful business and would like to grow his shop to reach more clients in the future.

loans.use: Buy fabric, zippers and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ropa

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: Francisco René tiene 65 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de leña, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la manera más humilde. Pues no es el primer financiamiento que solicita es para mejorar sus condiciones del negocio, pues es muy importante ofrecer los productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de leña para suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco René is 65 years old. He sells firewood for a living, and he has done this for more than 6 years, because he has always liked working in the most humble way. This is not the first financing that he has asked for, it is to improve his working conditions, as it is very important to offer the products that his customers ask for. He is asking for this loan to purchase firewood to meet the demand of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas C. is 51 years old and has been married for 25 years with his wife Bernandina. They have seven children, four of whom are already grown and live on their own. Three children, ages 7, 9 and 13, still live with Nicolas and his wife and are currently going to school. 

Nicolas comes from a humble family and is dedicated to his work. For 11 years now he has been buying and selling logs to local sawmills and has all the documents and permits required, for example transportation and environmental impact. He has a 20-hectare property (49.5 acres) that he also uses to cut trees and sell wood logs in the city. 

Nicolas is requesting this loan so he can buy more logs from other people and transport them to Caaguazu and fulfill all his orders.

loans.use: Logs (wood)

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Maria caracteriza por ser una buena madre y al mismo tiempo una buena vecina. Se preocupa por la economía de su hogar y de su negocio, pues ella se dedica a una pulpería labora de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, pues tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, tiene un hijo de 4 años que estudia en el colegio, gracias a su trabajo. Pues esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos lo hace con la intención de mantener a sus clientes y comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas detergentes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Maria is characterized as a good mother and, at the same time, a good neighbor. She worries about her household's economic situation, and so she runs a small grocery store from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. She has to get up early to do the household chores. She has a 4 year-old son who attends school, thanks to her work. This is the first time that she is taking out a loan. She is doing so with the intention of providing for her customers and to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, candy, detergents, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, candy, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Activas”  están  en el Cuarto Ciclo   con 24 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables realizan labores para la comunidas y el comité,  ellas tienen actividades productivas  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Claudelina quien es la presidenta del grupo y se dedica al negocio de ventas de productos de uso domestico.
Ella es una señora muy activa y constantemente anima a sus compañeras   a realizar actividades para recaudar fondos y también para fortalecer el grupo.
Su negocio le genera un ingreso que comenta ella cubre todos los gasto de  alimentación de su familia y considera esto muy importante por lo que desea invertir en la compra de productos que ella vende en su negocio como son arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, y otros.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Activas" committee has 24 members and is now on its fourth loan. It is a group well known in its neighborhood for being very close, united and responsible, and for working for the community. Some of the women are engaged in productive activities, and others are employed in new work. One member is Claudelina, who is the president of the group and who sells products for domestic consumption. She is a very active woman, and she is constantly encouraging her comrades to do things to raise money and strengthen the group. Her business generates an income which allows her to cover all the costs of feeding her family. This is very important to her. She wants to use the loan to buy the products she sells in her business, such as rice, noodles, sugar, pastries, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, pastries, milk products, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Monica Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mónica de 39 años, tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso” lugar caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio y termina de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mónica is 39 years old and runs a stationery shop (in Ecuador it is caled a "bazar"). She lives in a peri-urban area of Guayaquil called "Paraíso" ("Paradise"), which is characterized by its dirt roads. She started her stationery shop in order to support her family by selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she got together enough money to set up her small stationery shop, she readjusted her house and set the shop up in the front part. She works every day from 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She wants to buy notebooks, pens, and showcases for her business with this loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stationery and notebooks

loans.name: Mujeres De Chonima Group

texts.es:
Doña Teodora E. T., tiene 60 años de edad, es una persona que ha superado vendiendo ropa en los diferentes días de plazas en diferentes lugares y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza de animales; es así como  ha podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos de su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea de formar un grupo de señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también.  Este grupo está conformado por once integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes actividades como: crianza de animales, venta de ropa, venta de artículos de consumo diario.

Las integrantes del grupo decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia ya que estas personas son de escasos recursos y es de gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital de negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Doña Teodora E. T. is 60 years old. She is a person who has been able to get ahead in life selling clothing on different days by traveling to a variety of places. At the same time she raises animals in order to support her family and cover the household expenses. For this reason, she came up with the idea of organizing a group of ladies who also wanted to succeed. This group consists of eleven members. These women are involved in different business activities such as raising animals, selling clothing, and selling daily consumer products.

Since they have limited resources, the members of this group decided to request a loan from Asociación ASDIR so that they could improve the living conditions of their families. The loan will be a great help with expanding their business capital, improving their sales, and increasing their financial income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital required for raising animals

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: Ignacia, de 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. La actividad que realiza es la agricultura y como visualizó que su producto tiene mucha demanda, dejo a cargo de su esposo para que administre el trabajo, mientras ella se dedicaba en instalar una pequeña tienda. Desde entonces atiende a sus clientes, procura siempre mantenerla abastecida de productos y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus compradores. Se encuentra muy satisfecha por lo logros que obtiene, eso le hace sentir una persona independiente, aunque en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo. Su plan a futuro es poder ampliar su negocio, con la necesidad de que pueda mejorar en cuanto a ventas y mejorar sus ingresos con respecto a las anteriores ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta satisfecha con su banco comunal, ya que le dá mucha tranquilidad y comodidad. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías, de esa manera pueda abastecer su negocio de abarrotes y no tenga ningún contratiempo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 54-years-old. She's married and has 6 children in her care. They live together in their own home the town of Quimbiri, located in the Peruvian tropical rain forest. She works in agriculture and her product is in high demand. She leaves agriculture work to her husband while she runs a small store. She attends to her customers and always tries to keep her store stocked up and to offer a good service to her buyers. She's very satisfied with her achievements because they make her feel like an independent person, even though on occasions she receives help from her children and husband. Her plan for the future is to be able to expand her business by improving her sales and income. This is her first loan with MFP and she's committed to continuing to meet the time line of payments. Furthermore, she's happy with her communal bank because it gives her peace of mind and comfort. With this loan she's requesting she's going to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store with groceries so that she can serve her customers in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with various products

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas”,  están en el Quinto ciclo con  18 integrantes y sus respectivas actividades productivas.
Ellas se encuentran trabajando muy unidas realizando actividades para pagar las cuotas del préstamo así como para contar con ahorros para cualquier necesidad.
La señora Felipa es una de las integrantes del comité y se dedica a la fabricación, y venta de productos de limpieza.
Ella semanalmente de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe compra materia prima y prepara los productos de limpieza como detergentes, lanvandinas, jabones para lavar ropa y otros.
Esta actividad le ayuda a ella y su marido para mantener a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para fabricar productos de limpieza y también envases de plásticos para una mejor presentación y distribución  de sus productos.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in its fifth loan cycle with 18 members who engage in productive business activities. They work closely together in various events so that they can make their loan payments and save enough money to meet any need.

Sra. Felipa is one of the committee members who earns her living by making and selling cleaning products. Every week she receives orders, so she must buy the materials needed to prepare cleaning products such as detergents, laundry soaps, and bath soaps. This business helps her and her husband support their family. She is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to make cleaning products and plastic containers for better presentation and distribution of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making cleaning products & plastic containers

loans.name: Esther Jenny

texts.es:
Esther de 44 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso”.

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder mantener a sus tres hijo, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes Yambal y ropa que ella comprar en almacenes de bajo precio, trabaja con sus hijos para que tengan sus propios ingresos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, y ropa de almacenes. En el futuro quiere darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old and sells products manufactured by Yanbal, a company that offers women entrepreneurs the opportunity to start their own independent sales businesses. She lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called “Paraíso”.

Esther works alone in order to support her three children. She begins very early by offering her products to neighbors and friends. Esther sells Yanbal perfumes and clothing she acquires from the department stores at low price. She works with her children so that they can earn their own income.

With this loan Esther will buy Yanbal products such as perfumes and crèmes, as well as clothing from the department stores. She also wants to provide her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and clothing

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mariana is the coordinator of her group Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Pastor) 1 & 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to see to her children, both adult and married. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying resting at home.

Mariana has been in business for three years, starting with some savings. She is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. Mariana plans to use this loan to buy different products to sell like cosmetics, beauty products, clothing, shoes and other items. She will use the profits to invest in her business, which she wants to improve.

Mariana began her association with Esperanza because she needed to improve her business. Her story is generally representative of those in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of the former having recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The area’s main economic activity is a free trade zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and clothing

loans.name: Sartawi De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Sartawi de San Roque”, se ha organizado y capacitado para iniciar su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana, este nuevo grupo consta de ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón,  a la cabeza la señora Virginia como presidenta. 

La  señora Virginia refiere que es su primera experiencia en nuestra institución, ella como el resto de la asociación fueron invitadas por las promotoras.  El negocio que lleva adelante requiere de conocimiento y una gran habilidad para negociar, pues la venta de fruta debe ser rápida y oportuna, caso contrario la mercadería se hecha a perder.  Su tía es  quien le enseñó a negociar con la fruta, a la fecha tiene  cuatro años en el mismo.

Para este crédito está solicitando Bs.2000, lo que le permitirá comprar variedad de frutas por mayor y llevarlas a vender por menor a la extranca de Río Seco, de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde;  lo bueno es que cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñada.

La A.C. “Sartawi de San Roque” cuenta con ocho integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: venta de abarrotes, tejido de mantas, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas, tejido de guantes y chompas, tienda de barrio, tejido de todo, venta de vinos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Sartawi de San Roque” has been organized and trained to start their first loan cycle with the Panamericana Community Center. This new group consists of eight members, seven women and one man. The group is led by Sra. Virginia who acts as President.

Sra. Virginia is reporting on her first experience with Pro Mujer. She, like the rest of the group, was invited to join by the program promoters. Managing a business requires knowledge and the ability to negotiate. Since Virginia sells fruit, she must act in a prompt and timely manner or else she risks losing merchandise sales. Her aunt taught her about the fruit business, and to date, she has been in operation for four years.

For this loan, she is requesting 2000 BOB so that she can acquire a variety of fruit at wholesale that she can sell later at retail at the market in Río Seco where she works from 7am until 6pm. What is good is that she has the help of her sister-in-law.

The Communal Association “Sartawi de San Roque” has eight members who also have their own businesses which include selling groceries, weaving blankets, selling fruit, weaving gloves and sweaters, managing a neighborhood store, and selling wines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Las Artesanas Paquip Group

texts.es:
Doña CATARINA V. P., tiene 34 años,es casada, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales están a su cargo y se dedica a la elaboración D. telas y fajas D. mostacias, típicos D. la región, para la venta por mayor y menor actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 12 años atrás y con el afán D. mejorar su cálida D. y la D. su familia deciden organizarse con otras vecinas D. la comunidad para solicitar un crédito que les servirá para incrementar el capital D. cada persona y así generar más ingresos para cada familia, teniendo en cuenta que las integrantes del grupo se dedican a varias clases D. actividades productivas como: Elaboración D. fajas D. mostacias, venta D. pan, elaboración D. Bordado a mano en güipiles típicos y compra D. ganado vacuno.

Los integrantes son 11 personas que residen en la Aldea Paquib Santa Clara La Laguna. Esperan mejorar sus canancias.
texts.en:
Doña Catarina V. P. is 34 years old, married, and has four children under her care. She earns her living by making beaded fabrics and sashes that are traditional for the region. Catarina has been selling in bulk and in small amounts for 12 years and she wants to improve the quality of her products. She and a few of her relatives decided to organize a group with other neighbors in the community to request a loan that will increase the capital of each member and help generate more income for their respective families. The members of the group are involved in different types of business activities which incluD. making beaded sashes, selling bread, making traditional embroidered blouses, and buying cattle to raise.

This group consists of eleven individuals who resiD. in the neighborhood of Paquib Santa Clara La Laguna. They hope to improve their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire materials used in making beaded fabrics & sashes

loans.name: Angel Uriel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama angel uriel, por que hay una arcangel que vela por los intereses monetarios. esta ubicado en la comidad D. san juan buenavista en el estado D. mexico,en mexico.
El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la primera vez que esta solicitando un credito a credicomun. patricia maribel H. M. es la presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, estudio una carrera tecnica D. programadora analista y estilista, es comercinte actualmente y tiene 2 hijos varones. 
Ella se dedica a venta D. topperware; comida y articulos D. temporada que inicio hace 1 año. solicita el prestamo para poder invertir en su negocio D. topperware.sus clientas son vecinas D. la misma comunidad y a llegado a ofrecer hasta en empresas para tener mayor numero D. clientas y ventas. al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre ya que con la invercion que va hacer crecen sus ventas y su recomendacion con clientas nuevas. quiere este credito para crecer sus ventas y numero D. clientes. tambien espera poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos en su educacion ya que son lo mas importnte para la sra patricia. Los otros integrantes del grupo son: 
Rosalina F. A.
Antonia G. M.
Maria D. los A. R. B.
Lucia V. G. 
Maria Guadalupe V. M. D. O.
Marcelina V. M. D. O.
Eloisa C. A.
Maria Isabel C. Z.
texts.en:
This group is called “Angel Uriel” because it is named after the archangel who oversees one’s financial interests. The members are from the community of San Juan Buenavista in the State of Mexico, in Mexico.

This group consists of nine members who are requesting their first loan from CrediComun. Patricia Maribel H. M. serves as President of the group. She is 35 years old and earned a degree in computer programming and design. Patricia currently works as a merchant and has two sons. She started a business a year ago selling Tupperware, food, and seasonal items. Patricia is requesting a loan to invest in her Tupperware business. Her customers are neighbors from the same community, but she also wants to offer her products to businesses so that she can expand her customer base and increase her sales. Upon requesting her loan, she felt happy that she could begin investing in order to increase her sales and generate new customer referrals. Patricia also hopes to continue supporting her children in their education because this is very important to her.

The other members of the group are listed below: Rosalina F. A. Antonia G. M. Maria D. los A. R. B. Lucia V. G. Maria Guadalupe V. M. D. O. Marcelina V. M. D. O. Eloisa C. A. Maria Isabel C. Z.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy Tupperware, food, and seasonal products

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza de 39 años, ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso”.  

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia y tener una mejor estabilidad económica, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería en su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, libros y papelería, en el futuro quiere darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 39 years old and has a stationery shop (also known in Ecuador as a “bazaar”) in her home where she sells beverages, paper goods, and notebooks. She lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called “Paraíso”.

Maritza started her stationery shop because she needed to support her family and have better financial stability. She began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to neighbors and acquaintances. When she accumulated enough money, Maritza was able to open a small stationery shop in her home. She works every day from 7am to 9pm.

In order to increase her inventory, Maritza will use this loan to buy notebooks, books, and stationery. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, books, and stationery

loans.name: Marthis Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Marthis, porque  es Martha en ingles nombre D. L. boutique D. Rosario L. Tesorera del grupo. Está ubicado en el Estado D.  México.  El grupo está conformado por  9  integrantes. María Eugenia S. P. es L. presidenta del grupo. Tiene  39 años, estudió hasta el 6 año D. primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos.  ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. zapatos y colchas que inició hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. colchas y zapatos. Rosario T. G. es otra integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta L. secundaria,  es soltera y tiene no tiene hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropa que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y regalos. Sus clientes son personas D. L. misma comunidad. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente comprometida apagar Quiere este crédito para el crecimiento y rentabilidad D. su negocio.  

Los otros integrantes del grupo son: 
Martha G. S.             Vta.: traste y zapatos  
Rosa G. M.               Vta.: dulces 
Alicia G. G.             Vta.: refresco  
Anastasia M.D. L. L.     Vta.: Comida 
María Elena N. D. J.     Vta.: a von 
Griselda T. G.           Vta.: Jafra y zapatos  
María Angélica M. F.     Vta.: elotes y chicharrones
texts.en:
This group is called “Marthis” because it means “Martha” in English and is also the name of the boutique owned by Rosario, the group treasurer. This group is from the State of Mexico and consists of nine members. María Eugenia S.P. is the group president. She is 39 years old and completed school through the sixth graD.. María Eugenia works as a merchant and has three children. She has been selling shoes and blankets for ten years. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of blankets and shoes.

Rosario T.G. is another member of this group. She is 25 years old and completed high school. Rosario is single and does not have children. She has been selling clothes for eight years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing and gifts. Her customers are residents from the same community. Upon applying for her loan, she felt committed to pay her obligations. She wants this loan so that she can increase her business and make it profitable.

The other group members are as follows: Martha G. S. – sells cooking utensils and shoes Rosa G. M. – sells candy Alicia G. G. – sells soft drinks Anastasia M.D. L. L. – sells food María Elena N. D. J. – sells Avon products Griselda T. G. – sells Jafra cosmetics and shoes María Angélica M. F. – sells corn on the cob and pork rinds

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets & shoes

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El Señor Joel  junto con su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa, los señores tienen un hijo pequeño, esta venta lo realiza en las distintas ferias de la ciudad, también llevan a las ferias de las provincias el y su esposa realizan este trabajo a diario, ellos quieren ahorrar y tener mejores condiciones para  vivir, ambos tienen planes de ser grandes comerciantes y así poder comprarse un lugar donde puedan vivir juntos y tranquilos y cuidarle mejor a su hijo y darle una educación mejor que la que tuvieron ellos, con el dinero del crédito desean comprar ropa para niños por docena y así poder ganar algo mas para así incrementar su capital de trabajo .
texts.en:
Sr. Joel and his wife have a small child and support themselves by selling clothes. They sell their products at the different fairs throughout the city as well as the provincial fairs. He and his wife work every day because they want to save and have better living conditions. Both of them have plans to become successful merchants, and they want to buy a place where they can live together peacefully, take care of their child, and provide him with a good education.

With this loan, Joel and his wife will buy children’s clothing by the dozen so that they can earn more income. This will help them increase their operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing by the dozen

loans.name: Cecilia Matilde

texts.es:
Cecilia de 44 años, ella tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa, esta separada pero tiene 4 hijos, y viven en el suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Inicio con el negocio cortando cabello y pintando uñas, con sus ahorros puso un local y algunos instrumento para el salón de belleza, poco a poco y con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores pudo readecuar su casa para ubicar salón de belleza. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00pm hasta las 23h00pm todos días. 

Para poder agrandar su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo esmaltes, maquinas. En el futuro quiere incrementar su familia y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and operates a beauty parlor in the front part of her house. She is separated from her spouse and has four children. They live in Suburbio de Guayaquil.

Cecilia started her business by cutting hair and painting nails. With her savings, she was able to create her own shop and purchase equipment for her beauty salon. Little by little and with the help of her adult children, she was able to remodel her house so that she could place her beauty salon there. Now she works every day from 9am until 11pm.

In order to expand her business, Cecilia needs a loan to buy nail polishes and machines. In the future, she wants to grow her family and build a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nail polishes & machines

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: El Señor Jesús dedicado a la venta de plomo, el plomo lo extraen de las baterías usadas  y esto lo funden para venderlo en un precio considerable pero este trabajo es bastante esforzado ya que se tiene que extraer de cada batería, el señor ya tiene experiencia en este trabajo pero la dificultad que tiene es que no tiene techado el lugar donde el trabaja  y es justamente la causa por que el solicito el crédito para comprar calaminas para techar su lugar de trabajo, el esta casado y trabaja duro para mantener a su familia ya que es el único que trabaja ya que su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús sells lead, which he extracts from used batteries. He melts it together and sells it at a considerable price, but it is rather difficult work as he has to extract it from each battery. Jesús already has experience with this work, but the difficulty he faces is that he does not have a roof over his workspace. He is requesting this loan in order to buy corrugated metal sheets to add a roof to his workshop. He is married and works hard to sustain his family, as he is the only one who works, while his wife dedicates herself to household tasks. He is very grateful for the opportunity offered to him.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to add a roof to his workspace

loans.name: Carita Feliz Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “CARITA FELIZ”, se ha organizado y capacitado para iniciar su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana, este nuevo grupo consta de nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón,  a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora Nicolasa como presidenta. 

La  señora Nicolasa refiere que fue invitada por las promotoras al igual que sus compañeras, para conformar la asociación.  El negocio que lleva adelante requiere de tiempo y paciencia, siendo una tienda de barrio, por otro lado una oportunidad de permanecer en el hogar para cuidar y atender a sus hijos.   Inició su negocio por iniciativa propia, trabaja en el mismo ya doce años,  algunas veces recibe la ayuda de sus hijos para efectuar las ventas.

La A.C. “Carita Feliz” cuenta con integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: salón de peinados, venta de polleras, venta y producción de mantas, tienda de barrio, producción y venta de centros (combinación con bordes de encaje), venta de lencería, chofer, venta de ropa y venta de fruta.
texts.en:
The "Carita Feliz" communal bank has been organized and trained to start its first cycle at the Centro Focal de Panamericana. The new group consists of nine members, eight women and one man. Nicolasa is the group's president. Nicolasa explains that she was encouraged by the promoters as well as other group members to form the group. The business she manages, a grocery store, requires time and patience. On the other hand, it gives her the chance to stay at home and look after and care for her children. She started her business out on her own initiative and she has been in this line of work for twelve years. Sometimes her children help her with the sales. The other members of the "Carita Feliz" communal bank also have their own businesses. They include: a hair salon, selling skirts, selling and making blankets, a grocery store, making and selling table centrepieces (with lace trim), selling lingerie, working as a driver, selling clothes and selling fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: La señora Rosa Margarita T. C., tiene la edad de 53 años, y es casada y con su esposo habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores  de edad todos habitan de manera independiente, trabajan y apoyan a su familia con un aporte económico para su economía domestica, ellos tienen una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, productos del hogar y personal,  desde hace mas de 15 años, una de los problemas a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido la delincuencia que habita en la zona y que amenaza con su negocio y tranquilidad para los habitantes que ahí moran, por ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que aumente las ventas del negocio y permita tomar medidas de seguridad para la protección de su familia y el negocio, así mismo la mejoría de las condiciones socio-económicas para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Margarita T. C. is 53-years-old. She's married and lives with her husband in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. They have 3 grown children who are independent. They work and support their family with social security money for domestic expenses. For 15 years they've had a small general store that sells groceries and household products. One of the problems they've faced is the delinquency of the area that threatens their peace and business. She's currently requesting a loan to buy more merchandise that will improve her sales and allow her to invest in security measures for the protection of her family and business so that they can improve their quality of life and well being.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of inventory

loans.name: Ana Claudia

texts.es: La Señora Ana  se dedica a la Siembra y cosecha de papa y otras verduras,  la señora vive en casa de su suegra, para tener corta edad la señora desde muy pequeña se dedico a la venta y comercialización de papa y otros productos, la señora vive en Colcapirhua a un kilometro y medio del barrio kami, el destino del crédito es para poder comprar mas insumos de para la siembra como ser: Semillas, abono, fertilizante. A veces la señora por las fechas de producción aprovecha también en traer juguetes, ropas y otros, la señora llego a emprender gracias a una clienta que trabaja con nosotros ya hace muchos años. Se siente feliz ya que gracias a la tasa preferencial kiva la señora mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana sows and harvests potatoes and other vegetables. She lives at her mother-in-law's. She has been selling potatoes and other produce from an early age. She lives in Colcapirhua, one and a half kilometres from the Kami neighbourhood. The loan is to purchase raw materials for the sowing, such as seeds, manure and fertiliser. Sometimes, depending on production times, she also takes the opportunity to bring toys, clothes and other items. Ana started her entrepreneurial activities thanks to a client who has been working with us for many years. She is happy because she will be able to improve her income thanks to Kiva's preferential rate.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to sow potatoes

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Yguazu Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Unidas de Yguazú”.  Están  en el Quinto Ciclo, con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y comprometido con sus responsabilidades. 
Cada integrante de este comité tiene una actividad dependiendo de las facilidades con cuentan en sus correos.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elena quien tiene un bar donde vende comestibles, y bebidas.
La señora Elena todos los días se levanta muy temprano para elaborar sus comestibles y de esa manera tener todo listo muy temprano para los clientes, quienes concurren en gran cantidad al negocio por la calidad de sus productos y por la buena atención que reciben de ella.
Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y desea invertir en la actividad especialmente en la compra de ingredientes que ella utiliza y también para la compra de bebidas.
texts.en:
The loan group is called “Mujeres Unidas de Yguazú” (“United Women of Yguazú”). It is in its fifth cycle and it has 12 members. The group stands out in the neighbourhood for being very active, supportive and responsible. The lines of business of all group members depend on the facilities they have available. Elena, one of the members, owns a pub where she sells food and drink. Every day Elena gets up very early to prepare the food and have everything ready for her customers first thing in the morning. They go to her pub in large numbers thanks to the quality of her products and her good customer service skills. She is very happy with her business and would like to invest in it, particularly in the purchase of the ingredients she uses as well as to buy drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, condiments, ingredients to make bread, oil, soda water, cigars, wines and beer.

loans.name: Sonia Pilar

texts.es: La Señora Sonia se dedica a la venta D. medicamentos en su farmacia, dicha actividad lo realiza hace doce años, cuenta con gran clientela  motivo por el cual esta Inaugurando una nueva farmacia cerca del hospital Viedma en Cochabamba, tiene dos niñas D. doce y diez años, el padre D. las niñas se encuentra en Brasil se fue para buscar trabajo y le fue muy bien, el  colabora económicamente a la familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra del letrero y muebles D. la nueva farmacia, la Sra. Esta muy contenta con este nuevo emprendimiento y muy agradecida a Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sonia sells medications in her pharmacy, a business she has had for two years. She benefits from a large client base, which is why she is currently trying to open a new location, one closer to the Viedma hospital in Cochabamba. She has two daughters, 12 and 10 years old. They father of the children went to Brazil to find better work. He sends money to the family. This loan will be used to have a sign maD. and to purchase furnishing for the new pharmacy. She is very happy with the new business she is undertaking and she is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) and to Kiva for the trust they have imparted in her and for granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sign for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ernesto Macario

texts.es:
Ernesto de 64 años,  el tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de vivieres y en ocasiones es taxista para tener otro ingreso de dinero para su familia, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil.   

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo arroz, lácteos, bebidas así pudo ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Ahora vende casi todo tipo de víveres, para tener mas ingresos recorre con su carro haciendo taxi informal mientas que su esposa le ayuda en la tienda (ella sale en la fot alado de el). Trabaja desde las 06h00am comprando lo vivieres hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar arroz, bebidas y cemento para un arreglo en su casa, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y surtir mas su tienda.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 64 years old. He has a small grocery store in his house and sometimes he is a taxi driver to obtain additional income for his family. He lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. He started with the store to be able to support his family, selling rice, dairy products, and beverages, and he was able to locate it in his home. Now he sells almost every type of groceries. In order to have more income, he drives his informal taxi while his wife helps in the store (she is next to him in the photo). He works from 6:00 a.m., buying the groceries, until 10:00 p.m. every day. In order to continue with his business he wants to buy rice, beverages and cement to repair his home. In the future he wants to finish building his house and diversify his store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beverages, cement and blocks.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el caserío San Carranco del distrito de Túcume, un distrito bastante conocido por sus atractivo arqueológico, en el se encuentra situado un complejo de pirámides cuya construcción data de temporadas preincaicas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar como panadero, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño horno instalado en su domicilio, todos los dias por la noche prepara la masa que horneará al dia siguiente muy temprano para luego distribuirla en los caseríos que se encuetran alrededor del lugar en donde vive e incluso en el distrito de Túcume. Con este negocio el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia.

José Manuel desea ampliar su negocio fabricando mas pan, por ello ha crédito conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y materiales con los cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

José Manuel es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y preparar mas variedad de productos. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 31 years old. He is single and lives in the community of San Carranco of the Túcume district. It is a district that is very well known for it archeological attractions. A complex of pyramids is found there whose construction dates from pre-Incan times. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and it is located approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For ten years he has worked as a bread baker. Presently he has a small oven installed in his home. Every night he prepares the dough that he will bake very early the next day to distribute in the communities located near the place he lives and even in the Túcume district. He is able to pay his expenses and help his family with the business. José Manuel wants to expand his business by making more bread. For this he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that he plans on investing in purchasing ingredients and materials to attain his goal. José Manuel is a hardworking and enterprising person. His greatest wish is to keep growing as a businessman and prepare a wider variety of products. He has worked with our institution before and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and materials to increase production in a bread bakery located in his home.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen una hija, Ciomara  de seis añitos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene su propia casa. Desde su adolescencia a Rene le ha gustado contribuir con su familia, ya cada mañana se iban a su fuente principal, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, en donde ella labraba la tierra y sembraba, por el cual sus padres le daban propina para su gasto personal. Actualmente produce y comercializa cacao y café, en la cual hace hincapié que todo el conocimiento que adquirió durante su adolescencia lo ha volcado en su negocio agrícola, desde luego que lo está dando buenos resultados económicos, además el producto que los ofrece son primera calidad, y a un precio razonable.
