Marlene is a 46 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone, within the Lambajeque province, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, she's been selling primary needs products and groceries from her store within her home. From there, she sells various daily consumable products to her neighbors. Because of the amount of time she's been working in this trade, she's become well known and has a group of loyal customers. She uses her earnings from this endeavor to operate the business and help her husband support the family. Marlene wants to expand her business by buying more products, so that she can increase her sales and profits. In order to achieve this, she has seen fit to request a 1,500 PEN ($550) loan through Edpyme Alternativa. Marlene is a responsible, calm woman. Her greatest desire is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and become better known in her area, so that she can increase her profits and continue to help her loved ones. Her neighbors prefer her business because she give them friendly service.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Norelvis Alejandra

texts.es:
Norelvys Alejandra V., es una joven de 21 años que vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años en el barrio carrizal. Esta familia se dedica al oficio de la marroquinería, elaboran bolsos, maletines y además confecciona camisetas,  batas y pantalonetas, oficio que aprendió Norelvys de su madre Liliana F., así como el trabajo independiente y responsable, pues es una gran microempresaria vinculada a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 15 años,.
 Norelvys terminó el bachillerato y la experiencia de su madre la llevó a emprender su negocio desde muy joven,  ella se dedicó a elaborar prendas de vestir y maletines y bolsos pues no pudo seguir estudiando y en la actualidad,  ya casada, se dedica con su esposo a este oficio y es justamente lo que ayuda al sustento del hogar.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su primer crédito dejó nuevos frutos porque pudo comprar de contado y adquirir mayores utilidades reflejadas en mayores ingresos al hogar; en la actualidad solicita un credikiva para comprar materiales e insumos para la producciòn de bolsos maletines y camisetas deportivas y camisas manga larga, ante la demanda de clientes que tiene en el   vecino pais de Venezuela donde vende por mayor volumen.  Su sueño es lograr la ampliación de su negocio mejorar su infraestructura locativa, pero sobre todo seguir estudiando para  llegar a ser profesional. Su mayor desafío  es no encontrar un crédito lo suficientemente alto para cubrir sus necesidades de producción inmediatas, porque apenas está construyendo su historia crediticia, pero sabe que con perseverancia y disciplina , poco a poco logrará avanzar  a otro estado.
texts.en:
Norelvys Alejandra V. is a 21 year old young woman who lives with her husband and four year old son in the Carrizal neighborhood. Her family works in the leatherwork trade; they make bags, briefcases, and also make t-shirts, robes, and pants. Norelvys learned this trade, along with her independent, responsible work ethic, from her mother, Liliana F.. This is a great small company that has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 15 years. Norelvys earned her bachelor's degree and her mother's experience took her to begin her business when she was very young. She began making articles of clothing, brief cases, and bags, and was not able to continue with her studies. Now that she is married, she works this trade with her husband and it is what sustains the household. This will be her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The first loan provided new fruits because she was able to buy in cash and get better use of the money. This was reflected in better household income. She is asking for this Kiva loan in order to buy materials and supplies to make bags, cases, sport t-shirts, and long sleeve shirts to meet the demands of her customers, located in the neighboring country of Venezuela, where she sells in greater quantities. Her dream is to expand her business, improve its infrastructure, and above all continue studying so that she can obtain a professional career. Her greatest challenge is not being able to find a large enough loan to cover her immediate production needs, because she is just beginning to establish her credit history, but she knows that, with perseverance, she will continue to advance little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Chineta

texts.en: Chineta V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Lunas, Brgy. Kawit, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling scrap (junk shop), a general store, and buying and selling firewood and charcoal. Her husband Merto V. Jr., who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have five children who are between 12 and 25 years old. Chineta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chineta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she could continue to save up for future business expansion. Chineta V. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To funds business operations

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Tierras Duras del distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la ciudad de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina) el brinda su servicio en los diversos caseríos de la zona y depende de esta actividad para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su  mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para repararla y brindarle mantenimiento el ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona tranquila y responsable, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Santos is a 51 year old father who lives with his family in Tierras Duras hamlet, within the Olmos agricultural district; part of the city of Lambayeque, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years he has been providing transportation services for passengers and cargo in a "mototaxi." (a vehicle consisting of a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment added). He provides this service around the various hamlets within the zone and he depends on this activity for the financial support of his family. The continued use of his unit and the poor shape of the zone's roads have caused his mototaxi to begin to suffer a few faults that need urgent repair to ensure proper operation. In order to repair and maintain [his vehicle], he has seen fit to request a 1,000 PEN ($375) loan through Edpyme Alternativa. Santos is a responsible, calm person. His neighbors and acquaintances within his zone consider his as being trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia G. is a 31 year old who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, electronic reloading (mobile-phone credits) sales and charcoal vending. She lives in Lunas, Brgy. Kawit, Bogo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ignacia is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ignacia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en el caserío El Taymi, una zona rural del distrito de Illimo. Distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. Se encuentra situado aproximadamente a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, ella adquiere aves a sus vecinos y las engorda para luego venderlas en el mercado Moshoqueque, el mercado mayorista de la región. Esta actividad le permite agenciarse de algunos ingresos los cuales utiliza en ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Eulalia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para asegurarse un buen desarrollo de las mismas y una venta a buen precio. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Eulalia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Todos sus esfuerzos tienen un solo objetivo: sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer amable que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 48 years old. She is married and has three children whom she cares for. She lives with her family in the El Taymi hamlet, a rural zone in the Illimo district. This agricultural district is a part of the Lambayeque province, located about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She raises and sells small animals, especially corral birds. She acquires birds from her neighbors, fattens them up and then sells them at the Moshoqueque market, the largest in the region. This allows her to bring in some income, some of which she uses to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the family expenses. Eulalia wants to expand her business by buying more birds and nutritionally balanced feed so that they develop well and she can sell them for a good price. In order to do this, she has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa. Eulalia is a hard working entrepreneurial woman. All of her efforts have one objective; to move her family ahead. Her neighbors and acquaintances from the zone where she lives, all consider her to be a very friendly persons who is always ready to help anyone who needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corral birds and feed

loans.name: Jhon Freddy

texts.es:
John  Freddy O. es un hombre muy joven supremamente responsable y esto fue lo que justamente lo llevó a tener su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, pues desde los 15 años era empleado de una microempresa de esta misma actividad,  pero la propietaria de este negocio quería invertir en mantenimiento y  se le fueron deteriorando   y para no gastar en ello, le ofreció el negocio a  Freddy  para trabajarlo en compañía  , así que el como trabajador ganaba el 50% de la venta del servicio, pero gradualmente ella se desinteresó de este negocio y terminó  por dejárselo a John Freddy, quien teniendo en cuenta la dificultad en el mantenimiento preventivo que se le presentaba, decidió  aprender él mismo a hacerlo y ahora está muy pendiente de sus maquinas y las cuida mucho. John Freddy tiene un ayudante y 30 lavadoras en dos ubicaciones diferentes y también tiene 2 triciclos con los que se combate, llevándola donde pidan el servicio.
Su sueño es continuar estudiando, pero  su esposa  lo está haciendo ahora y es necesario esperar a que esté más organizado, porque también deben ambos estar pendientes de su pequeño hijo de 5 años. John trabaja todos los días del año menos el 1° de Enero y el viernes santos, con todo este esfuerzo tan grande,  y con la ayuda de Dios, el Tiene fe en que va a salir adelante con su familia y le pide a Dios  que le de su casa propia.

Este es su sexto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que lo ha apoyado en su crecimiento como joven empresario y solicita ahora su credikiva como una oportunidad pues quiere comprar 6 lavadoras para  reemplazar las ya  muy desactualizadas  y deterioradas por el tiempo.
texts.en:
John Freddy O. is a very responsible young man and that is what took him to having his own business; renting out washing machines. From age 15 he had been an employee of a small company, doing the same thing, but the owner wanted to invest in maintenance, as the machines were deteriorating, so rather than invest, she offered Freddy a partnership. This allowed him to keep 50% of the profits from the service. Over time, the owner lost interest in the business and left it to John Freddy, who, given the difficulty of the preventive maintenance, decided to learn it and now does it all himself. He is very careful with his machines and cares for them very well. John Freddy has one assistant and 30 machines in two different locations. He also has two tricycles that he uses to deliver the machines to where the customers request. He would like to continue with his education, but his wife is currently in school and he needs to wait until he is better organized, because they must also care for their five year old son. John works every day of the year, except New Years Day and Good Friday. With great effort, and with God’s help, he has faith that he will get ahead with his family, and he asks God to grant him his own home. This will be his sixth loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organization, which has supported him in his growth as a young entrepreneur. He is asking for this Kiva loan for the opportunity to buy six washing machines to replace the ones that have deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy upgraded washing machines

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus tradiciones y danzas de origen afro – peruano. Se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y la venta de leche desde hace mas de 1 año. El cría sus animales en un terreno situado cerca a la zona en donde vive y se vale de el para agenciarse de ingresos diarios con los cuales sustenta la economía de su familia.

Debido a que sus ingresos actuales no son suficientes para mantenerlos el ha creído conveniente instalar una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, como no cuenta con el capital para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles

Con los ingresos que perciba de esta nueva actividad el espera aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el es una persona tranquila, responsable y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Nestor is a 32 year old head of household who lives with his wife and 2 children in the Zaña district. This district is recognized regionally for its Afro-Peruvian dance and traditions. It's located about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year Nestor has made a living raising cattle and selling milk. He raises his cattle on a property close to where he lives and uses the income to help maintain his family. Since this income has proven insufficient to meet all his family's needs he wishes to open a small general store in his home. Since he lacks the funds to do this he has requested a loan of 600 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this new business he hopes to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. He is a laid back responsible and entrepreneurial person.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic needs goods and items for a store in his home

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Pha S. is a 28-year-old married man with a child who is six years old and not in school yet. He and his wife, Mrs. Samnang Meas, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Pha is also a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

Pha was selected to be the village bank president by fourteen members who all live in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. With the loan the members of this village hope to increase their income to improve their families’ living standards. Pha owns some farm machinery that they use to work their field. The machinery broke, so Pha decided to ask for a loan from AMK to repair it.

loans.use: To repair some farm machinery

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es:
Dina tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial, se encuentra situada a mas D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la  venta D. productos lacteos como queso, quesillo, manjar blanco, entre otros. Los adquiere en la ciudad D. Cajamarca, lleva ya mas D. 2 años en esta actividad y trabaja en base a pedidos, sus principales clientes se encuentran en Cayalti. Los ingresos que percibe D. este negocio los utiliza en ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Ella se esfuerza mucho y siempre trata D. conseguir nuevos clientes.

Dina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas productos D. modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y también sus ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles. Con los cuales espera dar a su negocio el impulso que necesita para crecer.

Su mas granD. anhelo es crecer lo suficiente como para poder instalar una bodega en su vivienda. Ella es una mujer tranquila, responsable y entregada a su familia. En la imagen aparece junto a su nieto.
texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old and married. She has 1 child and lives with her family in the Cayaltí district, an agricultural zone with a steady flow of traD.. It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Dina works selling products such as cheese, farmer's cheese, and manjar blanco [thickened sweetened condensed milk], among others. She buys them in the city of Cajamarca. She has done this work for more than 2 years, and she sells in response to customer orders. Her main customers are located in Cayalti. She uses the income she receives from this business to help her husband with the family's expenses. She works very hard and is always trying to obtain new customers. Dina wants to expand her business by purchasing more products, so that she can increase her sales and also her earnings. To achieve her objective, she has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles. With these funds, she hopes to give her business the impetus it needs in order to grow. Her greatest desire is to expand enough so that she can set up a shop in her home. She is a calm, responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family. In the photo, she appears together with her grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to expand her business of selling in response to orders

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo Antonio tiene 42 años y un negocio de comidas rápidas en dos sectores de la ciudad, que atiende con su cónyuge  con la cual tiene 5 hijos. Eduardo inició esta actividad  cuando trabajó durante 17 años con  su hermano, del que se independizó e invirtió sus ahorros en un negocio similar, que fue creciendo con el tiempo y hoy cuenta con 2 microempresas, habiendo iniciado solo con dos mesas;  él vende perro caliente, hamburguesas, sánduche y pechugas a la plancha entre otras picadas, a las que agrega exquisitas salsas que él mismo aprendió a preparar; su negocio lo atiende desde   5: 00 P.m.  a 11:00 P.m., y los fines de semana de 5:00 PM a 1:00 P.m.  . Este es su quinto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que lo ha apoyado mucho, pues dice que siempre está haciendo ahorros por las épocas de bajas ventas  que se presentan  y con esta organización también ha logrado dotar su negocio con sillas y mesas, que lo hacen mas elegante y cómodo; Con su credikiva comprará mesas, sillas, salsas y carnes. Aunque su negocio es su único ingreso con él ha logrado sostener a su familia y mejorar cada día mas;  ahora sueña con emprender esta misma alternativa en su pueblo en  el departamento de Córdoba para seguir prosperando
texts.en:
Eduardo Antonio, 42, operates a business selling prepared food in two city neighborhoods. His partner, with whom he has 5 children, helps him. Eduardo started the business working, with his brother for 17 years, then striking off on his own by investing his savings in a similar business. He started with just two tables but, over time, the business has grown and he now has two food stalls. Among other things, he sells hamburgers, hotdogs, sausages and grilled chicken, to which he adds his own special sauce. He operates the business from 5:00pm to 11:00pm during the week and from 5:00pm to 1:00am on weekends. This is Eduardo's fifth loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, a bank that has long supported him. He says that he always saves for slow periods of the year and that the bank has helped him buy tables and chairs which have helped him to improve the business and make it more comfortable for his customers. He will use this loan from Kiva to buy tables and chairs and ingredients for the food he makes. Although this Eduardo's only business, it has allowed him to support and improve the lives of his family. Now he hopes to set up a similar business in his home "departamento" of Cordoba so that he can continue to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock and supplies for food business.

loans.name: Sokkhy's Group

texts.en: Miss Sokkhy N., age 40, is the village bank president having been elected by its eleven members in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. While each member of this village loan will use their portion to support a different purpose, they are all responsible for the others' loans should they default. Sokkhy N. is a single farmer who owns three hectares of land that she uses to cultivate rice. She works very hard to support the eight members of her family. In order to increase her income, she will use the loan to buy piglets to raise, and for pig food.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and for pig food.

loans.name: 18.7.058 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thuỳ Hồ Thị (29) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thuỳ is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 058 - Quảng Hưng (18.7.058 Quảng Hưng ).

Thuỳ is single and has an adult-aged child. To make a living, Thuỳ raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Thuỳ has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2010, Thuỳ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuỳ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 4248000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuỳ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Liên (33) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

2. Hành (28) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

3.  Tình (32) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

4. Nhung (31) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

5.  Cúc (30) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

6.  Hạnh (27) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuỳ Hồ Thị (29) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thuỳ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 058 - Quảng Hưng (18.7.058 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Thuỳ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuỳ kiếm được khoảng 500000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thuỳ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuỳ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Liên (33) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Nhung (31) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquinga (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay de Curiquinga se encuentra formado por 12 mujeres que viven el la comunidad del mismo nombre que es perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, la agricultura y la ganadería son las actividades tradicionales de su gente. La mayor parte de la población sale por las mañanas a trabajar en la ciudad de Cuenca y retorna por las tardes;  Ocupándose en diferentes actividades económicas. Nuestras socias trabajan en diferentes actividades pero todas con un mismo fin que es  salir  adelante con  sus familias y ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

La Señora. Carmen Isabel C. vive en la comunidad de Conchan del Milagro que es perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle. Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación, los mismos que le han beneficiado  en su pequeño negocio. Es de profesión costurera aprendió esta actividad hace 5 años y fue una amiga quien le ha enseñado  esta actividad, ahora labora en su casa en su pequeño taller junto a su esposo que ejerce la misma profesión, realizan todo tipo de costuras y arreglos, no tienen horario de trabajo y laboran de lunes a sábado, dedicándose el día domingo a la familia.
Doña Carmen  es muy joven con apenas 23 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de  2 años  y otro de 4 meses, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa que su mamá les ha prestado. El  dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva maquina de coser que les hace falta. Su meta es terminar sus estudios del colegio ya que llego a cursar hasta el quinto año.

La Señora Rosa Aurora Q. vive en la comunidad de Maluay de Curiquinga, que perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle. Nuestra socia tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 10 hijos, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus hijos solteros tienen  27, 17, 15, 13, 11, 10 y 5 años de edad, su hija de 27 y su hijo de 13 años pasan en la casa ayudando a los quehaceres, sus hijos de 17 y 15 años trabajan y ayudan a la economía del hogar y sus tres últimos hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo pasa en la casa ya que es de avanzada edad, con el trabajo conyugal ha logrado construir su casa propia.
La Señora Rosa se dedica al trabajo que le han inculcado sus padres que es la agricultura, labra sus propias tierras en donde siembra maíz, papas, etc., que es para su consumo y algo vende, también se dedica  a la cría de chanchos y cuyes a los que los vende en su propia comunidad. Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y  está muy contenta ya que los créditos le están beneficiando en su hogar, el nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca. Su sueño es seguir conservando la salud.
texts.en:
The Maluay de Curiquinga communal bank is made up of 12 women who live in the community of the same name. It’s part of the Valle parish, which has a cold climate. Farming and raising livestock are its people’s traditional occupations. Most of the population goes out in the mornings, to work in the city of Cuenca, to work various trades, and returns in the evening. Our associates work different trades, but with the same goal; to get their families ahead and offer them a better future. Carmen Isabel C. lives in the Conchan del Milagro community, which is a part of the Valle parish. This will be her third loan through the foundation. The prior ones have helped her small business. She is a seamstress who learned this trade five years ago when one of her friends taught her. She now works out of a small workshop in her home, alongside her husband who also works in this trade. They do all sorts of sewing and repairs. They don’t have a regular schedule, but they work Monday through Saturday. Sunday is a family day. Carmen is very young, barely 23. She is married and has two children, one is two years old and the other is four months old. They don’t have a house of their own yet, so they live in a house that her mother loaned them. She will use the money from this loan to invest in a new sewing machine that they need. Her goal is to complete her collage education, now that she has completed five [out of six] years of study. Rosa Aurora Q. lives in the Maluay de Curiquinga community, which is a part of the Valle parish. She is 49 years old, is married and has 10 children. Her three oldest are married and on their own. Her single children are 27, 17, 15, 13, 11, 10, and 5. Her 27 year old daughter and her 13 year old son work in the home and help with the chores. Her 17 and 15 year old sons work and help with the household finances. Her three youngest attend the local school. Her husband stays home, now that he is of old age. They were able to have their house built by working together. Rosa works the trade that her parents gave her; farming. She works her own land, where she grows corn, potatoes, etc. Some of her harvest is for her own consumption and some she sells. She also raises hogs and Guinea pigs, which she sells to people in her community. This will be her second loan from the communal bank and she is happy about the loans that she has benefited from in her home. She will use the money from this loan to buy a cow. She wants to continue to stay in good health.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine / Cow

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina T. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 6, Brgy. Cabanbanan, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   Food Vending (bananaque),  a general store and e-loading. Her husband, Francisco T., who is 46 years old, works as an electrician to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 16 years old. Ma. Lina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Lina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 21,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for the general store and bananaque (fried banana on a stick) so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ma. Lina T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Ten people are members of this village bank loan. Mrs. Sarim C., born in 1979, was elected as the village bank president by its members located in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sarim C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Chy Ros, is a fisherman and also an ice-cream seller in the local village. Between them, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. Sarim C. will use the loan to pay for farm laborers to plow her field and to purchase fishing nets for her husband. The couple has two children, who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To pay for farm laborers to plow her field

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
A hardworking entrepreneur, Nancy D. C. has run a fishing and fish trading business for almost 10 years from the village of Nauring, Pandan in the province of Antique, earning her a reasonable monthly profit. Nancy’s main challenge is her small amount of stock because she only has a small amount of working capital to put into her fishing business. 

She joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2003 and is very grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. Now Nancy wants to request a larger loan for their growing fishing business. Nancy will sell the fish her husband catches in their village and to some people wanting to sell fish in the market. She thinks that commercializing her fishing business and expanding it will enable her to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for her children and cater to the other family needs. With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, Nancy is hopeful her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete college degrees will be achieved. Nancy’s wishes to give her children a brighter future fuel her commitment to her fishing business. 

With all of her plans for the growth of her business, Nancy would be happier if her children are able to achieve their personal dreams and have their own life out of poverty.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her growing fishing business.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S., age 43, was elected bank president by eight members of the village, located in Preak Ta Pring village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Sopheap S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate aromatic plants such as herbs, basil, and parsley. In order to support this farm, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate aromatic plants. Her husband, Mr. Sambo Morn, is a construction worker who makes a small salary to support his family. This couple has five children: three are seamstresses in the local garment factory while the other two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate aromatic plants.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor T. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and raising hogs. She lives in Hda. San Ramon, Brgy. Poblacion, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts by working hard in her general store and hog raising businesses.  She is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP. Maria Flor is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Flor aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tumendelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Tumendelger is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, ages 7, 9 and 11, in a house in Ulaanbaatar city. The three boys are attending a local secondary school. 

Mrs. Tumendelger and her husband are both tailors specializing in making the traditional Mongolian national dress. They have been running this business since 2003 and have three sewing machines at the moment. One corner of their living room is fitted as a tailoring workshop. 

They have their own customers and make around 40 to 50 dresses and accessories a month. They also sell them at "Narantuul," the largest local outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Nowadays, the traditional national dress is a very fashionable item in Mongolia. People wear them on special occasions, like wedding ceremonies, school graduations, during national holidays and so on. 

In 2007, they took a loan from the bank and bought a small house and paid it off recently. The reason they are requesting this loan is they want to buy building materials and make some modifications and repairs to the house. Mrs. Tumendelger's future plan is to extend her business, to repair the house and to have their own family car one day.

loans.use: Building materials to make some modifications and repairs to the house

loans.name: Praeng's Group

texts.en: This village loan group consists of thirteen people who live in BoE. Krum Leu village, Kandal province. Mrs. PraE. K., who was born in 1950, was selected as the village bank president by its members. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. PraE. K. and her husband, Mr. Kong Patt, are toy sellers in the local market who earn a small income to support their family. Since this business is doing well, and in order to increase their income, PraE. K. will use the loan to buy more toys to sell. This couple has seven children: three are fabric sellers for salary in the market, two are car security guards while the others are students in the local public school.

loans.use: to buy more toys to sell.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat T. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and his parents in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His parents have been operating a fruits and vegetables selling business for many years. After graduating from secondary school in 2006, he began to be involved in his parents' business. Now his business working capital is 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). He is a very mannered and hardworking person who says, "I would like to expand my business and hope to one day own my own workspace." 

He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn S. is a very good member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)–Rizal Central Branch. ASHI is a partner microfinance institution of Kiva in the Philippines. 

Analyn is 40 years of age and married to a carpenter. They were blessed with four children. She joined ASHI way back in 2007 and utilized her loan by putting up a small store. As years passed by and because of her dedication, her business grew and her earnings from the store add to the meager income of her husband. Her earnings help pay the school expenses of their children, two of whom are already in college. 

Both parents hope and dream to further expand their store business and increase the products to be sold. She is applying for a loan to buy three sacks of sugar, packs of cigarettes, cases of soft drinks, cans of cooking oil, sacks of charcoal and other grocery products. With this new capital, she will earn an additional 6,000.00 pesos on her monthly profit. This way, she can save more in preparation for the welfare of their children and for their schooling. Her children help also in managing their store. This husband and wife are thankful for ASHI and Kiva for their financial and moral support and promise to work hard to reach their dreams.

loans.use: Buy additional grocery products for her store

loans.name: Chhoen's Group

texts.en: Thirteen members make up this village bank loan group. Mr. Chhoen Y., who was born in 1956, was selected as the village bank president. They are from Boeng Krum Leu village, Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion for different purposes. Mr. Chhoen Y. and his wife, Mrs. Phany Ol, raise pigs at home. In order to support this business, Chhoen Y. will use the loan to buy piglets to raise and pig food. Aside from being a farmer, Chhoen Y. is also carpenter. With both occupations, they are able to earn a small profit to support their family. The couple has four children who are all seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and for pig food.

loans.name: Ave

texts.en:
Ave R. is 57 years old and is married to a carpenter. They have five children who are no longer living with them because they already have their own jobs and families to support. The remaining companion of the couple in their house is their 14-year-old granddaughter whom they fully support. They wanted to help their granddaughter pursue a career; that is why they have kept on working and earning. Also, the couple is getting older and they want to enjoy a better life and save in preparation for their retirement. 

For almost five years, the couple has been engaged in managing a variety store. Aside from the income of her husband, the profit from their store helped the family by providing for a good education among their children. This has continued to be their second source of income. 

Ave wanted to apply for another loan to buy a boat for her husband to use in fishing, a bicycle for delivery, a parcel of land for farming and additional grocery products to display in the store. She will also buy two sacks of sugar and ten sacks of charcoal. They also want to help their community by providing employment to people, and they will continue to support their family. 

They are hoping ASHI and KIVA will always be there to support their dreams in life. Ave R. is a very good member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc.(ASHI)-Rizal Central Branch, a partner Micro-finance Institution of KIVA in the Philippines. Because of her very good performance, the branch chose her to be a recipient of a KIVA loan.

loans.use: to buy a boat, a bicycle and additional grocery products for her store

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Mrs. Y C.'s daily duties at the garment industry. Y C. has been engaged in her job since early 2010 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a laborer in the construction field. The couple helps each other to earn money to care for their only child who is already enrolled in school. 

As the farming season is approaching, Y C. would like to take this occasion to generate extra income. Y C. needs a loan in order to purchase a new cultivating machine that she can use to provide a plowing service to other farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a new cultivating machine to hire out

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng P., 45, is homemaker. She stays at home to tend to her daily routine. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a sport instructor at high school. Another source of family income is from her child who works as a requirement laborer. 

Sreng P.’s husband always faced difficulty traveling to work: he goes to work by taking a taxi which is very expensive. To help solve the problem, Sreng P. has decided to seek a loan in the amount of US$ 700 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn D. is from the village of Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years of age, married and is blessed with 6 children of whom all are now school-aged.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in a snack vending activity. She is also receiving regular support from her husband as a farmer. She’s been engaged in this kind of business (snack vending activity) for 3 years already and earns approximately Php 3,000 a month from this business activity.

In the year 2006, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural communities, Merlyn has successfully repaid a loan of Php 13,000. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 30,000 as her 9th loan to be used for the redemption of a parcel of agricultural land and any remaining amount for the snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, children’s education, insurance and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Redemption of agricultural land and additional capital for her snack vending activity

location.town: Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Elsie Bienes Group

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Gumbil,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Elsie is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elsie B. Group.

Elsie is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Fe Luzana Group

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Fe is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fe L. Group.

Fe is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Fe is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina D. is from the village of Dicoyong. She is 44 years old. Cristina is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cristina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cristina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios G. is from the village of Nangcaan, Rizal. She is 59 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remedios is engaged in the agriculture sector, particularly in planting rice. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income of the business comes primarily from selling her own harvested rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earn a monthly net income of 8000.00.

In 2006, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for rice production. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline O. is from the Barangay of Trigos, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years of age, married, and blessed with 3 children, of whom all of them are now already adults who have their own families.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in snack vending. She also receives regular support from her husband and also from her children in terms of their basic needs. She has engaged in snack vending for 5 years already and earns approximately Php3,000.00 a month from this business activity.

In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out rural communities, Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php12,000.00. She is requesting a loan of Php12,000.00 as her seventh loan, to be used for additional capital for her snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, and funding possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Lelit Alomina's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lelit A., 40 years old and married, is a resident of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Lelit is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lelit A.’s Group.

Lelit is blessed with 7 children; 3 of them are now working and the rest are school-aged. Lelit sells HYPO, a chemical used to remove stains and molds. She is also employed at Naomi’s Botanical Garden as a maintenance worker and receives support from her husband, Eddie, who is also a maintenance worker and gardener at the same workplace. After 5 years selling HYPO, Lelit is able to maintain the business and the couple now earns an average monthly net income of at least PHP 1,200, which is very helpful to their family income.

Lelit joined the cooperative just this year upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 3,000. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as her 2nd loan to be used as additional capital for her HYPO business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs, to repay loans to PMPC and for savings, insurance, the children’s education and possible business expansions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. texts.en:
Mrs. Janechit R., 33 years old and married, is a resident of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Janechit is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Janechit R.’s Group.

Janechit is blessed with 2 school-aged children. She is involved in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and selling longganisa (sausages). Janechit receives support from her husband, Marcelino, who is an automotive painter. After 3 years of operating the store and selling longganisa, Janechit is able to maintain the business and the couple now earns an average monthly net income of at least PHP 6,000, which is very helpful to their family income.

Janechit joined the cooperative in 2009 upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 7,500. She is now requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 as her 3rd cycle loan to be used for additional capital for her existing businesses. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs, to repay loans to PMPC and for savings, the children’s education and possible business expansions. loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro C. is from the town of Siayan. He is 63 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Alejandro owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily goats, for sale. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Alejandro joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Alejandro from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About PMPC:

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina M. is from the village of Sitio Tipan, Montol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Marcelina is married and has 1 school-aged child and 2 adult children. She owns & operates a general retail store where she sells a variety of goods. She has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 1,000 a month.

In 2010, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to provide additional capital for her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marcelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley A. is 47 years old, married and has 4 children (one is adult-aged and three are school-aged). She is from the village of Southern Pob, Mapang. To make a living, she owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a general store. From this activity, she is able to earn a monthly income of 2,800 PHP. She has been engaged in her business for ten years. In 2009, Shirley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and be able to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. loans.name: Deun

texts.en: Deun C. is a 28-year-old married woman who currently resides in the rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a sewing laborer who works in the garment industry. She started her job more than a year ago. Deun is blessed with a young child who is enrolled in school. Her husband is a construction foreman who employs help to provide his service. Deun will use the loan she requested to buy a motorcycle, so that she can commute to work and other places without hiring taxis at the highest price. She intends to use any remaining cash from the loan to buy more construction materials for her husband to use to support his service.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and construction materials

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucina L. is from the Barangay of Guingona, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married, and is blessed with 12 children, all of whom are now already adults with their own families. To make a living, she is presently engaged in fruit and vegetable vending in the Agora  and Osrox area here in the city. She also receives regular support from her husband, who is a farmer, and also from her children in terms of her basic needs. She has been engaged in this kind of fruit and vegetable vending activity for 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Lucina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out rural communities, and has already successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP as her second loan, to be used as additional capital for her fruit and vegetable vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially to meet their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, insurances and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 15 members who live in Boeng KrU. Leu village, Kandal province. Mrs. Vaeasna C. is 38 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. With the loans, the members of this village will use their money to support different purposes. 
Mrs. Vaeasna C. is a farmer who owns 1.3 hectares of land, which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sinat Tith, is an iron welder and also helps his wife on the farm. With both of these occupations they hope to increase income to improve their family. 

This couple has four children: One is a seamstress in a garment factory and two are students, while the youngest one, a six year old, is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to cultivate rice

loans.name: Sophos' Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sophos M., 38, is the village bank president, having been selected by its 17 members, who are located in Boeng Krum Leu village, Kandal province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living standards of his or her family. Sophos and her husband are farmers who own two hectares of land, which they use to cultivate rice for a living. With the farm, they don't earn enough income to improve their family's standard of living. Thus, Sophos decided to ask for a loan to buy a piglet for raising, and pig food. With the new business they hoP. that their family's life will improve. This couple has five children: one is a laborer in a laundry shop and three others are students, while another is two years old.

loans.use: To buy piglet for raising and pig food

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira K. is forty two and married. She has three children: her elder daughter is nineteen, her elder son is sixteen and her younger daughter is twelve. Her elder daughter studies at the institution of higher education and her son and younger daughter go to school. Her husband is carpenter. Elmira sells honey. It was suggested by her aunt that she start selling honey in order to increase her income. Twenty years ago, Elmira bought honey and all necessary business supplies for 8,000 KGS and she earns about $195 monthly. She applied for a loan to buy a 200 liter kettle for the honey-making process. With the profits from selling honey, she plans to give her son a higher education and buy furniture for her house.

Group members:

Marvarhan K. is the treasurer of the group. She is forty two and a widow. She has four children: her daughters are fifteen, thirteen and six and her son is ten years old. Her elder daughters and her son go to school and her youngest daughter is at home. Five years ago, Marvarhan received a loan from the micro-finance company “FINCA” in the amount of 5,000 KGS and bought honey. Then she resold that honey at a higher price. Now she gets about $175 monthly from selling honey. In order to increase her turnover she is applying for a loan because she doesn’t have enough funds. 

Sonaiym C. is forty-seven and married. She has four children: her daughters are twenty-three, twenty-one, and eighteen and her son is fourteen. Her elder daughter is a recent graduate and now is in search of employment opportunities. Her second and third daughters study at an institution of higher education, and her son goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. Nineteen years ago, Sonaiym was selling clothes when her friend suggested she switch to selling convenience goods. She bought some convenience goods for 30,000 KGS and started selling them. Now, she makes about $320 monthly. She has been able to buy an area already planted in a crop and to give her children an opportunity to study at the institution of higher education on the profits from her business. She is applying for a loan in order to get necessary funds for increasing the assortment of goods she sells. In the future, she plans to expand her business and buy a shop for her convenience goods. 

Aizada A. is twenty-two and married. She has two sons: the elder is one year old and her younger son is eight months. Her husband is a computer administrator in a computer club. Aizada sells convenience goods at the local market or from home. In 2009, her neighbor offered her the chance to help in selling convenience goods, and then start selling on her own. She started with a purchase of goods for 25,000 KGS. Now she gets about $195 a month as an income from selling convenience goods. She is planning to increase the assortment but she doesn’t have sufficient funds; therefore, she is applying for a loan. In the future, she is planning to build a shop near her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy a 200 liter kettle for the honey making process

loans.name: Aziipa's Group

texts.en:
Aziipa D. is the leader of this group. She is forty-four and married. She has seven children: three daughters and four sons. Her two elder sons work in Russia, her elder daughter is married and the others either go to school or are at home. Her husband breeds cattle. Aziipa sells maize. Twenty years ago, together with her husband, Aziipa bought a cow with the purpose of fattening and reselling it. They started with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. During the next twenty years, they have significantly increased the number of cattle. She is applying for a loan in order to buy maize. Then she is planning to resell it at a higher price. They hope that their profits will allow them to move to cattle breeding only. 

Group members:

Shahra N. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-three and married. She has a son who is fifteen and goes to school. Her husband breeds cattle. She sells vegetables at the local market. In 2007, she decided to start selling vegetables in order to make money.  The first time she succeeded and then she increased her assortment. Starting with an initial investment of 1,000 KGS, she now makes about $110 monthly. She is planning to increase her assortment further in order to get higher profits and therefore she applied for a loan. With the profits from selling vegetables she is planning to give her son the opportunity to get his higher education abroad. 

Amangeldi S. is fifty-five and married. He has five children, all of whom live independently from their parents. His wife is a housewife. His youngest son helps him with the business. In 2005, he started buying and reselling cattle. He made a profit the first time and decided that it would be a profitable niche. Since that time, he buys and resells cattle. Now, he could greatly increase his number of cattle and therefore he is building another barn. He is applying for a loan because he wants to buy even more cattle and it would help him in increasing his number of cattle.

Anara Z. is twenty-six and married. She has two daughters who are six and five years old and are still at home. Her husband is a builder. Anara breeds cattle. Two years ago, she decided to buy cattle for breeding with the money received from selling vegetables from her own garden. She bought cattle for 15,000 KGS and she could significantly increase their numbers afterward. She is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle for breeding and increasing their numbers. She wants to expand her business as much as possible. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).
