loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phon H., who was B. 1951, was selected as the bank president of this village loan, located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Members of this village will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes.
                 
Mr. Phon H. and his wife, Mrs. Sim Loa, are farmers who own two hectares of land, which they use to cultivate rice, peanuts and corn for a living. In order to support this farm, Phon decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, peanut seed and fertilizer to grow crops. They are also farmers who work very hard to support a child who is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice and peanut seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Burulsun's Group

texts.en:
Burulsun N. is the leader of this group. She is twenty-seven and married. She has a daughter and a son. Her daughter is one year old and her son is three years old.  Her husband is a farmer and a taxi driver. He also breeds cattle. Depending on the season, her husband devotes himself to his job as a taxi driver. During appropriate periods, he farms and breeds cattle. Right now, he is planting wheat and potatoes. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle and increase their number. Mainly, all the work will be done by her husband.  In the future, she wants to improve her family’s living conditions on the profits from their business.

Group members:

Chinar T. is forty-two years old and married. She has seven children: four daughters and three sons. Her elder two sons breed cattle and the other children go to school. Her husband and her sons are buying, fattening and reselling cattle at a higher price. Her husband started his cattle breeding business ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS. He has bred cattle since he was a child. Due to the successful functioning of their business, her husband provides for all the members of the family, and they built a new house and bought a car. 

Kunduz K. is twenty-seven and married. She has a son who is four years old. Her husband combines farming and cattle breeding. In 2004, her husband bought cattle for 10,000 KGS. Since that time he has bred cattle. Also during appropriate seasons he farms. Right now, he is planting wheat and barley. They have already achieved good results, and with the help of the profits received they provide for all their family members.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle for breeding. They are planning to expand both in cattle breeding and in agriculture but they need support in the form of a loan for the purchase of more cattle. 

Kenzhegul T. is thirty-three and married. She has four daughters who are fifteen, thirteen, seven and five years old. Her husband combines his work as a taxi driver and cattle breeding. They started cattle breeding ten years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. The work of cattle breeding is done by her husband because he has bred cattle since he was a child. They have greatly increased their number of cattle. Now, they are applying for a loan in order to get money for the purchase of additional cattle. This would give them an opportunity to grow and expand their cattle breeding business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Cholponai's Group

texts.en:
Cholponai T. is the leader of this group. She is twenty-five and married and has a son who is three years old. Cholponai and her husband breed cattle. They started cattle breeding in 2009 with an initial investment of 20,000 KGS. Her income from cattle breeding is around $220 a month. She applied for a loan in order to get access to funds and be able to purchase additional cattle for breeding. In the future, she is planning to complete construction of her house with the profits received from her business.

Group members:

Zhypar A. is forty and married. She has four children: her daughters are two and three years old and her sons are sixteen and one year old. Her elder son goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. In 2009, Zhypar started cattle breeding with an initial investment of 20,000 KGS. She wants to increase the number of cattle and therefore she applied for a loan. Also, along with cattle breeding, she sells national souvenirs. In the future, she is planning make capital repairs on her house.

Rosa A. is twenty-seven and married. She has three children: her two daughters are nine and six years old and her son is one year old. Her two daughters go to school and her son is at home. Rosa breeds cattle, sells national souvenirs and provides rooms in her house to tourists for rent. She started cattle breeding with an initial investment of 30,000 KGS and she gets about $220 monthly in the form of income from cattle breeding. She wants to expand her cattle breeding business but she needs more cattle. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have enough funds, so she applied for a loan.
  
Zhamalbek C. is seventy and married. He has three children and all of them are students. His wife is a pensioner. In 2008, he decided to start cattle breeding with an initial investment of 30,000 KGS. Now, he gets approximately $220 a month from cattle breeding. He wants to increase his cattle numbers in order to increase his profits. He doesn’t have enough funds to do that, so he applied for a loan which will help him to purchase additional cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Begimzhan's Group

texts.en:
Begimzhan I. is the leader of this group. She is forty-nine and married. She has three sons who are are eighteen, sixteen and twelve. Her elder son works in a hospital and the younger two go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. One year ago, Begimzhan decided to start selling flour. She started her business with an initial investment of 2,000 KGS. Then she increased her income to approximately $110 a month. On the profits from her business, she bought a car for her family. Now, she is planning to purchase ten bags of flour for reselling, but she doesn’t have enough money, so she applied for a loan.

Group members:

Anarbiubiu A. is the treasurer of the group. She is forty-two and married. She has four children: her daughters are twenty-three, twenty-two and eighteen, and her son is three years old. She is applying for a loan in order to buy furniture for her house.

Elvira A. is twenty-eight and married. She has five children: her daughters are ten, eight and six years old and her sons are three and six months. All her daughters go to school. Two years ago, she started cattle breeding with the 10,000 KGS she obtained through the sale of vegetables from their vegetable garden. Now, they have increased their cattle number to five. Also, on the profits from cattle breeding they have started the construction of their own five-room house. They are applying for a loan in order to buy construction materials for their house so as to finish it before the winter period. Then, she will repay this loan with the help of profits from cattle breeding.

Ainagul A. is fifty-five and married. She has six children: her daughters are thirty-seven, thirty-six and eighteen and her sons are twenty-six, fifteen and five years old. Her first daughter is involved in agriculture, her second daughter is a seamstress, and her oldest son owns his business. The other children go to school. She is applying for a loan in order to buy solar oil for harvesting crops.
 
Zhamiyla M., 51, is married. She has three daughters and three sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their families and the sons are working.  Zhamiyla and her husband are farmers. In 1995, when the collective farms broke up, they got a piece of land and since then Zhamiyla and her husband have been cultivating various fruits and vegetables. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fuel for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase ten bags of flour

loans.name: Lira's Group

texts.en:
Lira A. is the leader of this group. She is forty-three and married. She has three children: her daughters are thirteen and ten and her son is five years old. Her daughters go to school. Her husband is a builder. In 1999, she started planting potatoes. Once, they sold six tons of potatoes for six KGS per kilogram and earned $1045. They used this money for the purchase of cattle for cattle breeding. Now they breed cattle along with planting potatoes. Now, they want to buy saltpeter for the potatoes. However, they don’t have enough money, so she is applying for a loan which would help her to have a better crop, and as a result, higher profits this year.

Group members:

Aizat A. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-one and married.  She has seven children: her five daughters are thirteen, six, three and two years old, and her sons are eleven and ten years old. Following the suggestion of her farther, Aizat bought chickens. She raised them and started selling eggs and she makes about $50 each month. For four years, she provided for the education of her children with the help of the profits from her business. She wants to increase her profits, which can be achieved through an increase in turnover, but she needs more hens for that. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have enough funds, so she applied for a loan in order to buy hens.

Zinakan O. is thirty-four and married. She has three children: her son is eleven and her daughters are seven and two years old. Her two older children go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is applying for a loan with the purpose of covering their family's temporary needs. In the future she is planning to significantly improve her living conditions.

Adilbek S.  is thirty and married. He has two children: his daughter is six years old and his son is eight years old. Both of them go to school. His wife is a teacher. In 2001, he started planting potatoes. With the money received from planting potatoes, he bought cattle. Now, he combines potato planting with cattle breeding. He is applying for a loan in order to buy saltpeter for the potatoes for the autumn season. 

Bolotbek S. is thirty-nine and married. He has three daughters. They are four, three and one year old. He is a farmer, and he grows potatoes. During the eleven years that he has planted potatoes he was able to buy household appliances. He is applying for a loan to buy saltpeter for his potatoes and collect the potatoes this autumn.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy saltpeter

loans.name: Melogina

texts.en:
Melogina O. is a married woman who lives in Park Upo, Barangay Hagnaya, San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a repair shop and vulcanizing business.  Her husband, Juan O., who is 47 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 10 and 25 years old. 

Melogina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melogina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $273, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing 22,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase equipment for the shop so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Melogina O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. She is pictured above in her shop together with her husband. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for her business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana C., a 47 year old who has a common law husband, supports her family by operating two business ventures:  egg retailing and pig fattening.  She lives in Barangay Looc, Santander, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her egg retailing and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $273. 

Luciana is now borrowing 24,000 PHP for the purchase of a motorcycle for egg delivery. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 24,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Luciana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

The above photo of Luciana C. was taken in her home.

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Naranhuu J. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Tuv province, central Mongolia. The couple live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works at a pawnshop as a guard and his monthly salary is 150,000 MNT.

Naranhuu operates a business selling secondhand consumer goods at a local market in the city. She began her business in 2007 and rents a working place in front of the market where she sells her products. She has previous business experience related to this trade.

Naranhuu is a very modest and gentle woman who says "I want to expand my business so that I can afford to take care of my own and my husband's health." She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: Ma. Linda B. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a manicure/pedicure service and a networking business. She lives in Barangay Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu. Ma. Linda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her manicure/pedicure service and her networking business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Ma. Linda is now borrowing PHP 15,000 as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Linda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Natsagdorj J. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. His children range in age from 10 years old to 18 years old. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His younger two daughters attend a local secondary school while his oldest is currently unemployed. His wife sells various kinds of dairy products to support the family income. She receives 25 to 30 percent of her business profit.

Natsagdorj has been doing a carpentry job since 1990. He also works as a stoker at a local company during the winter time. In summer, he operates a construction business specializing in small homes and storage buildings. He usually finishes each order on time and receives between 100,000 and 350,000 MNT per order. He says, “My only wish is to be able to afford my children’s education.”

Natsagdorj is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase tools and more dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase tools plus more dairy products for his wife's business

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife, Fatima, in Chtaura. Marwan has worked as a car repairer since 2000, specializing in bodywork. He is a expert in his field and anyone can see that the moment they see his work.

This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. He plans to buy an important steel welding machine which now comes in a new version: it’s known as a cold-welding machine, not like the regular one.

Marwan’s clients could be anyone: friends, neighbors, villagers, or friends of friends. His first obstacle was that people didn’t notice the location of his shop as it’s not on the main road: you have to search for it. However, this obstacle does not exist anymore as he’s kind of becoming famous.

Marwan states that he doesn’t have any other job, as he was raised to do this – his father is a car painter. His dream is to own his shop as it’s currently rented.

loans.use: To buy an important cold-welding machine

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito F. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 41 years old. Tito is married. To make a living, Tito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tito works hard to provide his family's needs like food and clothes.

Tito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tito is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tito from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum P. is a 41-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh City. She owns a piece of farmland on which she and her husband always cultivate crops to earn a living. Besides this, she sells a few grocery ingredients out of her home and her husband provides a motor-taxi service for additional revenue. This couple are good parents of four children, one of whom is employed as an English teacher. In order to generate extra profits, Sum P. needs a loan to pay for hiring a parking lot in the school which she will use to look after a student’s vehicle for a fee. (Mrs. Sum P.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To pay for hiring a parking lot.

texts.en:

To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, is single, and lives with his family.

He has operated a supermarket since 1994. His dad used to own a food market so he gained a good experience in the business. He is well known in his local community and has good manners.

He is requesting a loan of $1,800 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI, which he wants to invest in renovating his store. His purpose is to grow his business and expand it in the future.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and is a married man with two children. He has been a salesman for fourteen years.

In 2009 he opened his own shop for women’s and babies’ clothes plus women's accessories. He has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of $2,500 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI which he wants to invest in buying a big generator for electricity and increasing his inventory. His goal is to improve the quality of life for his family through growing bigger in his business and increasing his profits.

loans.use: To buy a big generator and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Afiswa

texts.en:
Afiswa N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  Afiswa has a business selling cooked food.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Afiswa sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Afiswa has requested a loan of 40000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more  bunches of bananas, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and maize flour for her restaurant. She also generates additional income through plaiting ladies hair.

The main business challenge(s) for Afiswa include; seasonality and the transportation of food staffs from the market to her restaurant.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are; improving her standards of living and to own a fully stocked restaurant.  

Afiswa lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies like rice, bunches of bananas, cassava,  Irish potatoes and maize flour

loans.name: Verona

texts.en:
Verona E. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 42 years old. Verona is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Verona owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Verona has been farming for over 6 years. She was able to put up a sari-sari store where she sells vinegar, sugar and other various products.

Verona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verona has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Verona is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Verona from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional store inventory

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie Y. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 39 years old. Emie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her husband is also a farmer and a carpenter.

Emie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Emie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth U. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 42 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elizabeth works hard to provide her family food on the table, clothes to wear and their other needs.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elizabeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, is married and is the father of four children.

He has owned a garage since 1995 where he repairs cars. He is well-known in his local area since he has been in business for more than fifteen years and has good morals and a good reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI, which he wants to invest in renovating his garage and buying some tools. He aims to develop his work so that he will be able to change his quality of life for the better.

loans.use: To renovate his garage and buy some tools

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang M. is an older woman whose husband appears in the photo. Hang M. earns a living by selling fritters to nearby people who eat them as their snack foods. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a technical officer at the ministry of water resources and meteorology. Hang M. currently lives with two of her daughters who have already got good jobs. 

Hang M. is selling her items well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her clients. However, her profits are small as her business capacity is low due to insufficient financial capital. Hang M. wishes to have more cash to accrue her capital which will allow her to improve her income. This is why she has decided to look for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accrue her capital.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae G. is a caring and loving mother. It was immediately obvious that everything Mae does, she does for her family. She is an incredibly hard worker at her job; taking care of hogs, and what is called "hog fattening", which is buying them small and feeding the hogs until they are ready to be sent for slaughter. She treats the animals well because she says "They treat me well too. Because of them I have a livelihood."

Now, on her 10th loan, she requests the amount of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for four years. Tthe money that she borrows will be used to pay for additional piglets, feeds and other supplies.

Mae lives in Bulanao, Antique which is far away from the main town. It's at the end of a rocky road and up a steep path. Mae has lived here for almost her whole life and her dream is to send her children to school until they finish college and find good job.

loans.use: To pay for additional piglets, feeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn M. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 27 years old. Rubelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rubelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rubelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

Rubelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rubelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rubelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda N. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 51 years old. Merlinda is married and has six children. Her younger children still go to school and she hopes to have them finish college. To make a living, Merlinda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli M. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 49 years old. Noli is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Noli raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noli has been engaged in farming for over eight years. He now owns a tricycle that he uses when free of farming duties. He transports people around his community with his tricycle.

Noli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Noli is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds and for motorcycle maintenance. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Noli from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds and for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Sewing clothes are the main part of 23-year-old Mrs. Yet S.’s daily duties in the garment industry. Yet S. has been engaged in her job since 2008 and receives $90 a month. She has a life partner in her husband (pictured) who has skills in repairing electronic materials. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two children. Both of the children attend school.

S.’s husband is very busy in his business activities.  However, he needs more materials to perform his service. Because he lacks funds, Mrs. Yet S. has decided to request a loan for her husband to use to buy any materials required.

loans.use: To buy any materials required.

loans.name: Nos

texts.en: Nos S. R., 40, is a fish seller who started her business more than nine years ago. She has a partner in her husband who works as a domestic carpenter. The couple has been married many years and they have three young school-aged children. Nos S. R. always uses her old motorcycle to deliver fish to the market. Nos S. R. is running her business well because she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. However, her income is low as her business has low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Nos S. R. wishes to have more money to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane’s biggest dream is to have a successful pig farm someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of hog fattening is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of shortage.  

Over the years, she has provided for her family by managing hog raising. Now she is proposing another loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos for hog fattening, a common business for people in her area suffering from poverty. Mary Jane will buy additional piglets, sacks of feed and supplements and vitamins for the piglets. She will raise them for approximately four to six months until they are ready for sale. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her hog-fattening business will generate a steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy addditional piglets, sacks of feeds, supplements and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 34 years old. Analiza is married and has 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer, just like her husband. They both till their land to plant rice crops. Her husband is also a driver. He uses his motorcycle to transport people around their community. Analiza wants to have a happy family and she does her best to fulfill her obligations.

Analiza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Analiza from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of supplies to sell.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem L. is a 26-year-old married woman who currently lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. She is a cleaner who works in a small company, a job she started more than a year ago.

Chem L. is blessed with a young kid who is not enrolled in school. Her husband works as a security guard in a microfinance institution. Chem L. was not available when the photograph was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

Chem L. requests a loan to be used to buy a piglet to raise in order to earn extra income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a piglet to raise and sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie I. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 42 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosemarie also cooks food that she sells to their community. She has a small sari-sari store where she displays her cooked food and other products.

Rosemarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and ingredients for making food. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosemarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and ingredients for making food

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 41 years old. Elma is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

Elma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Warly

texts.en:
Warly D. P. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 38 years old. Warly is married and has 2 school-aged children. He is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for quite a while now. He works hard to keep his farm free of weeds and pests. He says he is hoping to increase his harvest.

Warly is thankful he joined CEVI because he was able to avoid the individual lenders who charge high interest to their loans. He successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of Php10, 000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers like manure. Warly is hopeful to earn a better income so he could pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 54 years old. Marianita is married. To make a living, Marianita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Marianita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marianita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura M. is the leader of the group. She is 41uears old and married. She has two daughters and two sons. The first daughter is in university and the other children are at school.  Ainura is a teacher at school and her husband works in construction.  Fifteen years ago in order to make money they started to breed livestock. By selling some animals after fattening, they make money to cover their family expenses. Ainura applied for the loan because she needs money to pay for her daughter’s education at university.  In the future she wants to increase the number of livestock they own and have enough money to provide her children good education.

Ainura T., 28, is married. She has two sons and two daughters.  The first daughter is at school, and the other children are preschool age (under 7). Two years ago with the initial investment of 40,000 soms Ainura started to breed cattle. By reselling the cattle after fattening she makes 10,000 soms per month. Her husband works in construction and when he is free he helps his wife with her activity. Ainura hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase school accessories for her children.  In the future she wants to build a new house.

Mira A., 40, is married. She has two sons and two daughters.  The first son studies at university and the other children are at school.  Mira and her husband are engaged in livestock breeding. Her husband also works as a tractor driver. By reselling sheep after fattening, they make 8,500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Mira wants to purchase five sheep to increase the number of livestock and with  part of the loan she will use to purchase school accessories for her children.    

Chynargul B. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 41 and married. She has two daughters and two sons.  The first son and the first daughter are at school and the other children are preschool age.  Chynargul works as a librarian and receives 2,200 soms per month.  Her husband has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1995 By selling cattle after fattening he makes 6,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, Chynargul wants to purchase school accessories for her children. In the future she wants to improve her living conditions and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for the daughter's education at university

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorng T. has been spending her life cultivating crops. Her husband, who is pictured, frequently works alongside her in the farm fields.

In addition to her farming job, Yorng T. makes clay stoves and saves up to one hundred sets or more before having her husband sell them around the community. Making clay stoves is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young.

Yorng T. will be using her first loan as capital to buy clay in order to make more stoves to sell.

loans.use: To buy clay in order to make more stoves to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce R. is forty four years old, single and has one child aged sixteen years old who she hopes will become a pilot some day. Her business is located at Tassia, a residential area in Nairobi. She has been selling house decor such as teddy bears and curtains to the local people for the last fifteen years. She has managed to employ thirty one people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is how to reduce fraud by the employees. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more items  too meet customer demand and to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business until its able to make Kes 5,000,000 as income. She describes herself as an aggressive business woman.

loans.use: To buy supplies of assorted goods including curtains and teddy bears.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum K. is 53 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than three years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and from fishermen.

Chhum K. is a single mother who is blessed with eight children, three of whom are married and the others are single. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a goldsmith.

Chhum K. is applying for a loan in order to replace her old motorcycle that often breaks down.

loans.use: To replace her old motorcycle that often breaks down

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is 38-years-old, married with three-minor children, and lives with her husband in the province of Libertad, Antique. To supply additional income for her family, Marilou has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost four years.  Her husband, Rafael, is a farmer and works closely with her.

Marilou would like to obtain a loan to pay for more piglets, vitamins, and feed.  Marilou believes the purchase of additional piglets will increase her inventory and drive increased monthly revenue.  As a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2007, Marilou has been a devoted member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and solid repayments on previous loans.

Her long term goals are to maintain the productivity of her business, and support the education for her 3 children. She also dreams of a brighter tomorrow and a more prosperous standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for more piglets, vitamins, and feed.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity R. is thirty two years old. She is married and they have a daughter aged five years old. Her business is located at a residential area known as Tassia in Nairobi. Charity owns a salon which has been providing hair and beauty services to the local women. Besides the salon, she also runs a general store in which she sell items like sugar, flour, rice, detergents etc. She says that this business is profitable and the only major issue she tries to manage is the lack of trust for employees. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more hair weaves and chemicals to expand her business. She also hopes to use part of the loan to increase the stock for her general store. In future, she hopes to prosper in business. She describes herself as an aggressive business person.

loans.use: To stock of hair products and items for general store like rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo C. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 24 years old. Danilo is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Danilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Danilo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
A 25-year-old married mother of three sons, all of whom are preschool age (under seven), Gulzar S. is the leader of the group. When the collective farms broke up 15 years ago, Gulzar got a piece of land upon which she started cultivating wheat, rice and potatoes. Because of the high unemployment rate, her husband went to work in Russia. Gulzar has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fertilizers for farming.

A year ago, with an initial investment of 3000 soms, Sharapat Bolotovashe, the 22-year-old treasurer of the group, started wholesaling sunflower seeds. With money received from the loan Sharapat wants to purchase sunflower seeds in order to increase the turnover of her business activity. In the future she wants to save money and purchase a vehicle.

Akjoltoi Z. is a 34-year-old married father of two daughters, both of preschool age. In order to make money, Akjoltoi and his wife sell sunflower seeds at the market. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase dairy products to resell at higher prices in the market. In the future he wants to purchase a vehicle.

Talyp A., 50, is married and has two daughters and three sons. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family; the second daughter is at school, and the sons are working. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 12000 soms, Talyp started wholesaling bottles. In this way he makes 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase 25000 bottles in order to resell them at a higher price to the factories. In the future he wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Vasya

texts.en:
Vasya is married and a small entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, where he owns a business selling fishing supplies in the local wholesale market. He started this business because he loves fishing and is an experienced fisherman. Vasya’s merchandise is unique in the marketplace where he works, which draws many customers to his vending kiosk. Low competition and lending assistance have helped Vasya’s business develop and keep a stable standing. In the last four years his enterprise grew to 70,000 Grivnyas in inventory and 7,000 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Vasya is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital and sales as a result. One of the outstanding characteristics of his venture is its stability and consistent growth. Vasya hopes that this loan will help him to keep his business running and extend it even further. One of Vasya’s future goals is to open one more vending kiosk.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Phân

texts.en: Phân S. earns a living as a tailor for her neighbors. By doing this, she is able to generate $4 per day to resolve her family's financial crisis. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who is a goldsmith. The couple is married and blessed with three school-aged children. Phân S. owns and uses her vehicle which breaks down frequently, and her transportation has been affected. As she lacks funds, Phân S. has applied for a loan to change her old vehicle.

loans.use: To change her old vehicle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. M. is sixty years old. She is single and has one child aged forty years old. Her business location is in Nairobi and is well known by the name Ebenezer. She owns a beauty shop in which she has been selling cosmetics to the women. She has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ two people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more cosmetics to meet the demand of her clients. In future, she hopes to be a wholesaler. She describes herself as aggressive and ambitious.

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia G. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize flour and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour and some bags of charcoal to sell.  Cicilia is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building a store and stock more bags of maize flour, beans etc to sell.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie Q. is from the town of Trento. She is 35 years old. Vergie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Vergie has been engaged in farming for over 10 years. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. 

Vergie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and livestock feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vergie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is from the town of Trento. She is 33 years old. Judith is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith also raises pigs for fattening. She sells her pigs to people in her community.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also livestock feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Judith from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also livestock feed

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice M. M. is thirty years old. She is single and does not have any children. Her business is located at a market called the Stage Market in Embakasi, Nairobi. The business name is Sonnie Enterprises. She owns a shop in which she sells beauty products to hawkers who resell them at a profit. She has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ one person. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge is that she has financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more cosmetics to meet the demand of her clients. In future, she hopes to grow the business to meet the demand of more customers. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: S.,55 years of age, is a widowed woman. In order to provide for the needs of her family, S. sells a few products from her store, next to her house. She has been experienced in this sector for a year and is earning approximately $3 per day. She has two school-aged kids who are dependent on her income. S. requests the money from Kiva in order to accumulate the quantity of products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Mukunyu Twemukye, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en: K. Legi (in the small photo) is a hardworking, determined and married father of 9 children, and a member of the Mukunyu Twemukye group in Kyenjojo. He has been operating a butchery business for over 10 years in Mukunyu, Kyenjojo. Since he wanted to become financially sound, he used his savings from his previous farming and tea growing business to join his friends in the butchery business. He has requested this loan to purchase three cows for slaughtering in his butchery and earning a profit from them. He says this will enable him get more money to pay for his children’s school fees as they prepare to return to their respective learning institutions.

loans.use: purchase of cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. is from the town of Trento. She is 48 years old. Rosalie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosalie also raises hogs for fattening.

Rosalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and livestock feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock feed

loans.name: Abetereine Rushango Association, Ibanda Group

texts.en: M. Scovia is a member of the Abetereine Rushango Association in Ibanda. She is a hardworking and well trained medical personnel who has been running a pharmacy alongside banana selling in Rushango, Ibanda. Her business has been operating for 6 years and has always brought to her dividends close to 160,000 UGX monthly. Her main drawback is having a small stock which is hindering business growth and expansion. With this loan, the widowed mother of 2 children looks forward to restocking drugs, which will allow her to earn more revenue and acquire a self-sustaining life through educating her children.

loans.use: purchase of more drugs

loans.name: Abby

texts.en: Abby N. is fifty eight years old, widowed and has five children aged between thirty four years old and twenty two years old. She does her business in the Donholm estate in Nairobi. She builds rental houses. She has been in this business for two years now. She says that this business is profitable and she hopes to increase the size of her business  and earn more income. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to increase her capital as she continues  building. She hopes to build more houses and become a well known landlady. She describes herself as an aggressive and ambitious business person.

loans.use: Rental house construction.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia S. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Jalia has a business selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Jalia sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Jalia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Jalia include transportation of bales of clothes from Owino market to Kisaasi Market and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes directly from the United Kingdom. She has been withn  MCDT for along time and is servicing her twentieth loan.  Jalai decided to join MCDT bcause of the low interest charged and services are brought nearer to the clients.    Jalia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food  and school fees .

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes
